Over 50 years before that masterpiece Verdi did indeed write another comedy, Un Giorno di Regno, his second opera and one virtually unknown today even as his other early efforts are gradually making their way back into the repertory. The curious Verdi collector may at least have made a passing acquaintance with the music from an old Cetra recording that has been in and out of the catalogue since 1951. Now Philips has turned its attention to the opera and the fine new performance on that label (6703 055, three disks) shows this unlucky score in the best possible light.

title: Violence in Hockey: Blood Over Finesse
description: Canadian hockey isn't breeding men of character and future leaders, it's breeding a stable of animals. It's an outrage.

title: A Computer's Lapse Is Vermonters' Gain
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., Oct. 5 (AP)More than 3,000 aged and disabled Vermonters may be allowed to keep a financial windfall caused by a Social Security computer, the state Welfare Commissioner said.

title: Bateman Outlines Republican Position on School Financing
description: TRENTON  The Legislature's leading Republican spokesman on the controversial and still unresolved issue of public  school financing has outlined what many officials here believe will be his party's position in any compromise proposal.

title: V.K. Krishna Menon, India Defense Minister, U.N. Aide, Dies
description: NEW DELHI, Sunday, Oct. 6 (Reuters)  V. K. Krishna Menon, former Indian Defense Minister and a controversial figure in Indian and international politics for much of his life, died here early today at the age of 77. He had a heart attack last year and went into a hospital again on Friday.

title: Rutgers Downs Harvard, 2421; Penn Is 149 Victor Over Brown
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Oct. 5 Rutgers may not have one of the best football units in its long history. That remains to be seen. This afternoon, however, it proved it certainly must have one of its most persistent. It beat Harvard, 2421, In a game the Crimson led three times.

title: Resignation Announced By Renegotiation Head
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 William S. Whitehead, chairman of the Federal Renegotiation Board, which recovers excess profits from defense contractors, has said he is retiring effective Dec. 31, Mr. Whitehead, 68 years old, has been under heavy Congressional criticism for the board's operations. He was appointed to the board in 1969 and named chairman in 1973.

title: Racial Harmony Stressed in Fete
description: Four hundred children, wearing black and white Tshirts and carrying black and white American flags, ran through the streets of Brooklyn last week to publicize a bicentennial venture aimed at encouraging blacks and whites to work for the borough.

title: Ronnie Krumholz to Wed
description: Dr. and Mrs. Victor Krumholz of Great Neck, L.I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Ronnie Ellen Krumholz, to Ronald Ian Kapner, son of Mr. and Mrs. Fred Kapner of Valley Stream, L.I. The wedding is planned for Jan. 4 at the Plaza Hotel.

title: 5 Die in Philadelphia Fire
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 5 (AP) A faulty electric heater has been blamed for a flash fire ?? which five persons died in a row house today. The fire apparently began on an encloser porch and the heater was said to have set fire to bedding. The blaze then spread through ?? wooden home.

title: This Week in Sports
description: The defending champion Boston Celtics meet the Milwaukee Bucks on neutral territory in Madison Square Garden Tuesday at 6 P.M. The Knicks play the Buffalo Braves at 8. A second doubleheader is slated for Thursday night pairing the Braves and the Bucks at 6 o'clock and the Knicks and the Celtics at 8. The Knicks play the Braves again on Saturday, at 8 P.M., at Monmouth College.

title: The Global Level: Talk of Inflation and Oil
description: WASHINGTON  From Topeka to Tokyo, from the North Cape to the Cape of Good Hope, everybody knows it and feels it: The world economy is in deep trouble, and the name of that trouble is inflation.

title: STUDY DISPUTES WELFARE MYTH
description: In a farreaching new study of the poor released yesterday, 95 per cent of adult newcomers to New York City were found not to have sought welfare help in their first two years hereeven though many were eligible.

title: Tennessee Williams's six short stories
description: As a writer of fiction, Tennessee Williams has two things going for him: he is never dull; and he knows how to ingratiate himself. If, in this collection of six new short stories, Williams is so captivating as a narrator, it is because he had invented a tone of voice that is both racy and genteel, that slyly alternates between juicy vulgarity and the mellifluous circumlocutions of a gentleman of the old school. Here's a specimen passage: Why, this old fart has gone senile. Sabbatha shrieked to her audience of one, a young man whose Mediterranean aspects of character and appearance had magically survived his past ten years of sharing life with Sabbatha in her several retreats. The touches of cultivated diction (aspects, retreats) are amusing and are read (as they no doubt were written) with a smile.

title: Gary Player Loses
description: CHEPSTOW, Wales, Oct. 5 (UPI) Bernard Gallacher won the Dunlop Masters $48,000 golf tournament at the St. Pierre Club today in a suddendeath playoff with South Africa's Gary Player. Gallacher, after rounds of 71. 70, 69, 72282 had a birdie 3 at the first extra hole. Player had tied with 69, 73, 71, 69 282.

title: Romance and carnage, hopeless pursuittwo novels
description: The first sign of trouble at Krishnapur came with a mysterious distribution of chapatis, made of coarse flour and about the size and thickness of a biscuit; towards the end of February 1857, they swept the countryside like an epidemic.

title: On the Surface, the Kremlin Is Pleased With the New Administration
description: MOSCOWAmericans may feel some relief that Richard Nixon has left the White House and Gerald Ford is trying to move the country into the postWatergate era.

title: Grain Curb Seen as Move To Warn Foreign Buyers
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 5Midwestern grain dealers who handle most American grain exports said today that the White House's abrupt halt of a sale to the Soviet Union was more of a warning to foreign buyers than any attempt to protect domestic supplies of corn.

title: Symphony Group Seeks Subscribers
description: PLAINFIELD  Subscriptions are now available for the Plainfield Symphony Orchestia's 197475 season,

title: WOMAN IS MISTAKEN FOR PATRICIA HEARST
description: A young woman meditating in a closed remote area of the Times Square subway station early yesterday morning touched off a fulrry of activity by local and Federal police officials when a Transit Authority policeman mistook her for Patricia Hearst.

title: Historic Properties Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Oct, 5 (AP)  President Ford has signed legislation authorizing the Government to purchase or accept donation of seven historic properties in Bostonincluding Paul Revere House, the Old State House, Bunker Hill, the Charlestown Navy Yard and the U.S.S. Constitution.

title: Whalers Cut Four
description: HARTFORD, Connn. (UPI) The New England Whalers have sent Jake Danby, Bob Charlebois and Guy Dufour, all forwards, and Bruce Landon, a goalkeeper, to the Cape Codders of the North American Hockey League.

title: Cherryl Huested to Wed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Richard S. Huested of Camarillo, Calif., have announced the, engagement of their daughter, Cherryl Lester Huested, an alumna of Wheaton College in Norton, Mass., to Charles McMaster Oman, son of Mrs. Janet McMaster Oman of Bronxville, N. Y., and of William M. Oman of Greenwich, Conn. The future bridegroom, a graduate of Princeton, received a doctorate from Massachusetts Institute of Technology, where he is an assistant professor of aeronautics and astronautics.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: On Menhaden
description: WOODS HOLE, Mass. Bunker dunkingfishing live menhaden for striped bassbecame more feasible off Martha's Vineyard late last month with the arrival of menhaden in the nearby mainland's Woods Hole harbor.

title: Oil Prices Await a Less Confusing System
description: World oil prices continue to be immensely confusingto consumers, to governments and even to the oil companies themselves.

title: Mary Lindsay Eases Into the New Life
description: Mary Lindsay always laughed when she was labeled a political wife.

title: Ohio State, Griffin Rour Wash. State
description: SEATTLE, Oct. 5 (AP)Archie Griffin rushed for 19 yards, including a 75ya?? touchdown gallop, and th?? No. 1ranked Ohio Sta?? Buckeyes crushed Washing ton State, 427, today.

title: Turkish Opium Raid
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, Oct. AP)  The police raided major opium processing plant in Konya today and arrested two men with 55 pounds of the drug, officials said. It was the first major narcotics seizure reported since the Turkish Government allowed poppy cultivation to be resumed this week.

title: New & Novel
description: These are the further adventures of Sammy Miles, a 16yearold runaway, who has charmed his way through two earlier books. Sammy, Smiler to his friends, has taken to the road to avoid being sent back to reform school on a bum pursestealing rap. Being on the run in a Victor Canning novel is better than living at home. You are picked up by gypsies, great people who keep a farm in Dartmoor, which is winter quarters for a circus. You are under the personal protection of a palmist who used to work under the name of the Duchess of Mintoro, and who keeps a fortunetelling tent and a telepathic cat. You get special tutoring from a retired school teacher so you can realize your ambition to become a vet. And you roam a countryside seething with the wild life for which some English authors have such flair.

title: Court Orders War Activist Restored to Welfare Rolls
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Oct. 5 (AP)A judge has ordered that Leslie Bacon, a onetime antiwar activist, be restored to county welfare rolls and paid back benefits although she refuses to divulge the name of her daughter's father.

title: Chess : Ninth KarpovKorchnoi Game Ends in Draw and Minor Flap
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 5  Anatoly Karpov and Viktor Korchnoi met at the House of Unions here today, resumed play in their adjourned ninth game and after two moves by White and one by Blackagreed to a draw, their seventh in the match.

title: Results of Nearby Yachting
description: STRAFFORD SHOAL RACE

title: Sports Editor's Mailbox: Tennis and the Rain/Too Many Teams?
description: To the Editor:

title: Agencies Are Told By Saxbe to Check With Him on Cases
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 (AP)Attorney General William B;. Saxbe has urgedall Government agencies to check with the Justice Department before talking to newsmen and the public about pending court cases.

title: Sarah W. Dunham, a Teacher, Fiancee of Jeffrey Alan Taylor
description: Sarah Williams Dunham, who teaches at the Crawford School in Denver, and Jeffrey Alan Taylor, financial control officer for the United Bank of Denver, plan to marry Dec. 28 at the First Congregational Church in Chappaqua, N. Y.

title: Rangers Win From Islanders
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., Oct. 5The New York Rangers and their suburban counterparts, the New York Islanders, renewed acquaintances tonight for the first time this season. The Rangers also renewed their habit of beating the newcomers to their territory by posting a 43 victory.

title: Jack Dempsey's Restaurant Is Closing
description: The famed James Montgomery Flagg painting depicting the heavyweight championship fight between Jack Dempsey and Jess Willard is gone from the wall of Jack Dempsey's Restaurant.

title: Sailboat Show Opening Thursday
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Oct. 5France will be represented, as will Britain, the Netherlands and Japan, The United States, the host country, will have the largest contingent.

title: Policeman Commits Suicide
description: A police officer assigned to the Bronx District Attorney's office apparently commited suicide by shooting himself while on duty in the Bronx Detective Area office on the third floor in the 45th Precinct station at 2877 Barclay Avenue. He was identified as Craig S. Lowery, 27 years old. He was found about 2 P.M. in the offices with a shotgun alongside his body.

title: The finest offensive general in the Army
description: Martin Blumenson is preeminently qualified  as a contemporary military historian and as the author of several serious studies on the European Theater during World War IIto write this authorized biography. (The first volume of The Patton Papers, covering the years 18851940, came out in 1972.) Blumenson brings to this second volume the same sharp psychological insight into the inner turmoil of George Patton, both as an ambitious, oldfashioned and courtly patriotic hero, as well as a profane, reactionary and violent egomaniacone who despised the Allies, darkskinned races, poor discipline and slackers in about equal measure. In fact, Patton's ambivalence could at the same time condone the killing of prisoners and deplore the largescale bombing of enemy civilians.

title: David Eaton, Organic Chemist, Marries Anne Carroll Price
description: Anne Carroll Price, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Warner W. Price Jr. of Smyrna and Rehoboth Beach, Del., was married yesterday afternoon to David Fielder Eaton, son of Mr. and Mrs. David Church Eaton of West Simsbury, Conn., and East Orleans, Mass.

title: Other N.J. Scores
description: MERCER

title: St. Peter's Beats Rider, 20
description: JERSEY CITY, Oct 5 (UPI) Manny Piniero scored both goals, one in each half, to lead St. Peter's to a 20 soccer shutout over Rider today.

title: Home Improvement
description: IF a pane of glass should break in one of the windows or doors of their home during cold weather, most people would lose no time in getting the broken piece of glass replaced, or in at least temporarily plugging the hole that was left in order to keep out cold drafts and conserve expensive fuel.

title: Ann Warren Is Betrothed
description: The engagement of Ann Farley Warren to Scott William Burcham has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Edus H. Warren Jr. of Short Hills, N. J., parents of the future bride. Her fianc is the son of Mr. and Mrs. William C. Burcham of Kansas City, Kan.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given In Eastern Daylight Time

title: Hamtramck Strives to Retain Its Polish Character
description: HAMTRAMCK, Mich., Oct. 5 They once called it the Wild West of the Middle West, this 2.09squaremile island of Slavic zest, an autonomous city surrounded by Detroit, a tight little village where for more than half a century the PolishAmericans have loved, hated, worked hard in their yards and on the assembly line, and lived life with gusto.

title: FAMILY ACTIVATES TIPS IT GAYS FORD
description: The Nissley family of Ridgewood, N. J., are eating by candlelight, taking bathes in half a tub of water, and giving their cats just ten seconds to get out the door these daysall becaus eof President Ford's plea to the nation to save energy.

title: Lunch Program May Be Renewed
description: SOUTHAMPTON  A free lunch program for senior citizens, which had been discontinued last week by the town board, is expcted to be resumed shortly either under the sponsorship of the town or under the direction of another local agency.

title: U.S. and Soviet Union Beginning Joint EnergyResearch Project
description: WASHNGTON, Oct. 5 (UPI) Federal Energy Administrator John C. Sawhill and the Soviet Minister of Power and Electrification launched a joint energyresearch project today in coal, oil, gas and electricity.

title: Planners Approve Greenpoint Rezoning
description: To preserve a uniquely stable mixture of housing and industry, the City Planning Commission voted last week to rezone much of the Greenpoint area of Brooklyn.

title: Dartmouth Beaten, 143; Cornell Blanks Bucknell
description: WORCHESTER, Mass., Oct 5Bartmouth lost its second football game in a row today, 143, to Holy Cross and then ran hack to re check its schedule.

title: A Rent Strike in Ocean Hill Is Settled by Court in a Pact Providing for Repairs
description: Rent strike leaders at Atlantic Plaza Towers housing complex in Brooklyn claimed victory last week after court  assisted compromise under which a large portion of their rents is to be used for repairs.

title: AROUND THE Garden
description: CITY TREES

title: Carolyn Brooks Bride of Teacher
description: Carolyn Brooks and Peter P. Morrin 2d of Poughkeepsie, N. Y., were married yesterday at noon in Wilton, Conn., at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Malcolm Stotter Brooks, the bride's parents. The Rev. Michael Thornburg, an Episcopal priest performed the ceremony.

title: Mary E. Earls, C. D. Everdell To Wed Nov. 2
description: Mary Elizabeth Earls and Coburn Darling Everdell plan to be married in Cincinnati on Nov. 2. The future bride is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William T. Earls of Cincinati, who have announced her engagement. Her fianc is a son of Mr. and Mrs. William Everell of New York Queenstown, Md., and Edgartown, Mass.

title: OUTLOOK GLOOMY FOR NATURAL GAS
description: Natural gas supplies will be tighter and costlier in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut this winter thin last, but utilities are resorting to such aids as synthetic gas and imposing restrictions on use to help alleviate the problem.

title: MilkPrice Repeal Nearing Floor Vote
description: TRENTON  Legislation designed to repeal New Jersey's 33yearold system of milk pricefixing, which has been tied up in committee for two years, is finally approaching a floor vote in the Assembly.

title: N. Rockland Wins Third In Row, 137
description: A fumble and a blocked punt enabler: the North Rockland Red Raiders to con?? Clarkstown North, 137, yesterday and the Raiders retained their share of first place in Rockland County Public School Athletic League football. Clarkstown South, which shares first place with North Rockland, rallied from a 128 halftime deficit to beat Spring Valley, 2712.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: If The Times hopes to enlist popular support for the idea that Mr. Jaworski should proceed with the indictment of Mr. Nixon, it must give the public some reasons for believing that such a move has some reasonable expectation of success, and these reasons must be independent and apart from the simply hopeful contemplation that an indictment and a trial will produce the missing facts of Watergate.

title: Farmer Solidarity Increases in Europe
description: BRUSSELS, Oct. 5The world economic crisis seems to be drawing together Europe's 9.6 million farmers.

title: FourHitter Pitched by Sutton Paces Los Angeles
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 5The Los Angeles Dodgers, who had not won a game in Pittsburgh all year, won a big one today when they defeated the Pirates, 30, on a fourhitter by Don Sutton in the opening round of the playoff for the National League pennant.

title: Bill for Pure Water Standards Facing New Hurdles in Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5Federal legislation aimed to assure the public of pure drinking water, which has been under debate in Congress for four years, is hanging by a parliamentary thread.

title: Oslo Expects Soviet to Ask Joint Spitsbergen Rule
description: Informed Norwegian sources say they believe the Soviet Union will press Norway anew, for the establishment of joint sovereignty over the Arctic archipelago of Spitsbergen at a conference later this month.

title: Women and Young Find Equality With HardHats
description: Translated into people, a 5.8 per cent unemployment rate means 440,000 more workers on the idle list than a month ago, a total of 5.3 million persons looking for jobs they can't find. Who are the unemployed?

title: Cat Revival Superior To Original Production
description: IS there a more characteristic Tennessee Williams effect than the one that occurs, noisily but helplessly, halfway through the second act of Cat on a Hot Tin Root'? In a vast plantation bedroom, with the lush greenery of the finest land this side of the Valley Nile barely visible through billowing white lace curtains, a father and son are having a nervous, finally passionate, private conversation.

title: A former Supreme Court clerk spills the bean
description: Serving Justice may appear to be an inside book  former Supreme Court law clerk tells all  but there are no revelations here. As the author makes clear to us at the outset, he has tried in every instance to respect the confidence of the Court.

title: BRIBE JURY TOED OF FREED SUSPECT
description: Two police officers were accused by the prosecution in a bribery trial that opened last week of letting a slaying suspee flee from the scan of a murder on the promise that the boys would take care of them.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Troupe in Montclair Gets Art Unit Aid
description: MONTCLAIRThe Whole Theater Company has received a $15,000 matching grant from the State Council on the Arts, in cooperation with the National Endowment for the Arts.

title: Miss Stackhouse Will Wed April 15
description: The Rev. and Mrs. William R. Stackhouse of New City, N. Y., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Virginia Ellen Stackhouse, to Richard Alan von Rueden, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert H. von Rueden of East Troy, Wis.

title: Pleasantville's String Ended At 35 Games by Croton, 2823
description: It's all over for, Pleasantville.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Bell Files Suit Against Eagles

title: ROCKEFELLER GAVE KISSINGER $50,000, HELPED 2 OTHERS
description: Vice Presidentdesignate Nelson A. Rockefeller disclosed yesterday that he had made gifts of $50,000 to Henry A. Kissinger, $86,000 to L. Judson Morhouse, the former Republican state chairman, and an unspecified sum to Dr. William J. Ronan, the chairman of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey.

title: An Argument for a Jaworski Test Of the Presidential Pardon in Court
description: PHILADELPHIA  President Ford's pardon of Richard M. Nixon may well be invalid and should be tested in court now.

title: Food By Craig Claiborne with Pierre Franey
description: One of the great (and none too abundant) prizes of American waters is known in unusually informed circles as Callinectes sapidus. This is the blue or hardshell crab of the Atlantic, found from Cape Cod to the Florida Keys. For some reason crab meat is rarely listed among the horsd'oeuvre riches (caviar, foie gras, smoked salmon, lobster) in classic culinary literature, which seems odd, for it certainly ranks with lobster as one of the treasures of the sea. Crab meat is a versatile delicacy. It makes splendid key ingredient for curried soup; Maryland crab cakes are a delight and so are crab fritters.

title: Angola Guerrillas Still Divided Despite Efforts to Spur Unity
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, Oct. 2African guerrilla movements in the Portuguese colony of Angola are continuing to go their separate ways, raising serious questions about when and under what conditions that oilanddiamondrich territory might become independent.

title: Art Show to Aid Parenthood Group
description: LOCUSTPlanned Parenthood of Monmouth County, Inc., will be the beneficiary of an art show and cocktail party to be held next Friday at Holly Hill, the home of Mr. and Mrs. Bassett S. Winmill on Navesink River Road.

title: Nancy E. Scott Wed to Engineer
description: Nancy Elizabeth Scott, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Thomas Scott of Westfield, N.J., was married there yesterday afternoon in the Presbyterian Church to Fraser McPherson Robson of London. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. William Leonard McPherson Robson of Elgin, Scotland. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Richard L. Smith, assisted by the Rev. Richard W. Shreffler of Bel Air, Md.

title: The Pulse of America Beats in the Music of Ives
description: THERE'S nothing like a centennial to spur assessments, contemplation and public interest; and as 1974 is the hundredth anniversary of the births of Arnold Schoenberg and Charles Ives, the music world has roused itself to pay homage and refocus on those two significant figures. Musically, Ives is getting the better of it. Schoenberg, the most important single influence on the thinking of the musical avantgarde in the second half of the century, has never been a composer popular with the public, and while his centennial has created much interest, he is not receiving too many performances. But the music of Ives is being celebrated the length and breadth of the nation. He was, after all, one of ours.

title: SPOTLIGHT
description: The Pittston Company's biographical sketch of Nicholas T. Camicia says he learned about his business from the underground up. Indeed he did, starting 38 years ago as a coal miner in his native West Virginia, earning $85 a month.

title: Milton Berle
description: Every performer, in his own way, shouts, me, me, me! Look at me! But the premier danseur, a small smile beatifying his mannequin face, does not need us; he knows he is the most gorgeous creature on earth. The piano virtuoso does not need us either. He can play for an audience of two: himself and Beethoven. The comedian is special. He cannot live without an audience, without those flapping hands and exploding throats that tell him, in some strange way, that he is loved.

title: Oklahoma's Mixed Drive. Routs Wake Forest, 630
description: NORMAN, Okla., Oct. 5 (AP)Joe Washington put on a dazzling display of openfield running and Steve Davis hurled two touchdown passes today in leading Oklahoma to a 63.0 rout of Wake Forest.

title: CITY OPERA STAGES A FINE BUTTERFLY
description: The New York City Opera has as one of its principal tasks the presentation of imaginative, wellrehearsed productions of the standard repertory, using young American singers. However well the company may do over the long run, yesterday afternoon's performance of Madama Butterfly was an appealing success. In nearly every respect it is superior to the Metropolitan Opera's current version, and tickets for it cost only half as much.

title: Giants Wary Of Uprising By Falcons
description: NEW HAVEN, Oct 5In many respects, tomorrow afternoon's game against the Atlanta Falcons at Yale Bowl (1 P.M., radio station WNEW, 1130) may be the most important of the season for the New York Giants.

title: MOMA's immortal pots and pans
description: This year a pocket calculator became approximately the 2,100th object in the Museum of Modern Art's Design Collection, a collection consisting of objects both handmade and machinemade that range from household furnishings and office equipment to tableware, tools and textiles. The Design Collection is now a nonstop, 42.year phenomenon, and the pots and pans, beaters and bowls, tables and chairs, typewriters and calculators on which MOMA grace falls keep discreetly piling up. They have just been beautifully and expensively installed in impressive new study quarters in a continuing program of acquisition and classification under the direction of the Department of Architecture and Design.

title: Blancas' Record 64 Ties For Lead in Sahara Golf
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Oct. 5 (UPI)Homero Blancas tied the SaharaNevada Country Club course record with sevenunderpar 64 today and gained a firstplace tie with Dave Hill and Al Geiberger with a 54hole total of 204 after three rounds in the $135,000 Sahara invitation golf tournament.

title: The World/continued
description: SAIGONOn the night Richard Nixon resigned as President of the United States, a huge rock perched atop a grotto in the Vietnamese village of Tri Thuy ominously split in two.

title: A CHRYSLER UNION DROPS 4DAY WEEK
description: WHITE PLAINS, Oct. 2Workers in a Chrysler Corporation parts depot in Tappan have voted by an overwhelming margin to end the only fourday workweek in the nation's automobile industry.

title: Military Service Penalty
description: HOUSTON, Oct. 5 (UPI)Federal District Judge James Noel sentenced Rene Henry Mondejar yesterday to two years in prison for failure to perform civilian work in place of military service, but then suspended the sentence and fined the defendant $500, Mr. Mondejar, 24 years old, a member of the Jehovah's Witnesses, pleaded guilty to the charge, saying he could not perform alternative service because of his religious beliefs.

title: The hospital as seen from both ends of the grimness
description: W3

title: The Oil Warning Was Heard, But Now What?
description: If President Ford and Secretary of State Kissinger, in their recent speeches and in meetings with foreign authorities, have sought to draw attention to the urgency of international economic problems, they have apparently succeeded. Consumer and producer states are debating, at long range, both the dimensions of the problem and the possible solutions.

title: Visions of Cuba Trade Again
description: As Washington and Havana inch toward possible resumption of the relations severed 13 years ago, fondand bittermemories of the once lucrative trade between the United States and Cuba are again being evoked in United States business circles.

title: FollowUp on The News
description: It was just a Year ago that Dr. Howard J. Brown, the first Health Services Administrator in John V. Lindsay's administration's and professor at the New York University School of Medicine, announced publicly that he was a homosexual.

title: Sunnyvale, Once ProNixon, Now a Political No Man's Land
description: SUNNYVALE, Calif., Oct. 5There was a time when this was Nixon country. Then for a while, back in August and early September, when it seemed the long night of Watergate might finally be over, it clearly belonged to Gerald R. Ford.

title: STUDY DISPUTES WELFARE MYTH
description: In a farreaching new study of the poor released yesterday, 95 per cent of adult newcomers to New York City were found not to have sought welfare help in their first two years hereeven though many were eligible.

title: LowPressure Area Forms
description: MIAMI, Oct. 5 (UPI)A lowpressure area that has shown some signs of strengthening into a tropical depression or storm, has formed over the Bahamas, about 230 miles of Miami, the National Hurricane Center said today.

title: Red Smith
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 5Six months to the day after playing their first games, the Pittsburgh Pirates and Los Angeles Dodgers opened the National League pennant race today in the sort of weather Abner Doubleday would have ordered for baseball if he had ever heard of the sport. Each team needed 162 games to reach this point, and now they were starting a miniseason of three, four or five that would qualify one of them for the World Series. In the tidily professional style that characterized them through the summer, the Dodgers won the opener, 30.

title: Notes: Long Holidays Are Getting Shorter
description: EVERYBODY loves a threeday weekend. At least, that was the rallying cry of the notsoloose confederation of business interests that prevailed upon the Federal Government to pass the Uniform Holiday Law back in 1968. Under that law, Federal employes found themselves celebrating Washington's Birthday, Memorial Day, Columbus Day and Veterans Day not on their traditional dates but on Mondays. Most states followed suit. The travel industry rejoiced, and the oil industryintent upon expanding the demand, as it was called in those days before the oil crisislooked forward to booming sales at the pumps.

title: Adelphi Wins in Soccer
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I.,Adelphi University extended its winning streak in soccer to three games without a defeat this year with a 41 victory over Fordham today. Ron Atansio scored two goals.

title: Child to the MacDougalls
description: A daughter was born on Sept. 8 at the Tompkins County Hospital in Ithaca, N. Y., to Mr. and Mrs. Robert Duncan MacDougall of Ithaca. Mr. MacDougall is acting assistant dean of the College of Architecture at Cornell University. The child has been named Margaret Duncan.

title: The Songwriter Sings
description: JUST as some film studios in the heyday of Hollywood were known for the special style of their movies, a number of record companies today are carving out distinct images for themselves. While Warner Bros. Records, along with its Reprise label, issues plenty of native and foreign rockers and rollers, the company has firmly established itself as a friendly home for many of the best current singersongwriters like James Taylor, Dory Previn, Van Morrison, Alan Price, Martin Mull and Neil Young.

title: RATIONING POWER IS URGED BY LAIRD
description: LAKE PLACID, N. Y., Oct. 5 (UPI)  Melvin R. Laird, the former Presidential adviser, said today that President Ford would make tough and unpopular announcements on Tuesday to deal with inflation but that they would be inadequate to cope with economic problems facing the nonCommunist world.

title: News of the Screen
description: If Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche appears to be an unlikely, perhaps unprecedented, subject for a movie, it hasn't fazed Liliana Cavani and Robert Gordon Edwards, director and producer of The Night Porter. They are preparing to start production, Mr. Edwards disclosed, of the tentatively entitled, The Eternal Return (Ritomo Eterno), which will concentrate on the towering and controversial 19thcentury German philosopher.

title: Without Barbarians
description: Nothing reveals the weaknesses of marriage like a thorough examination of an attempt to save one. This novel is the exhusband's reminiscences, and Gene's opening remarks provide something less than a blissful setting: unexpected sadness following the loss, by natural causes, of a pregnancy;. and the life of a couple conscientiously engaged in studying and social work but wanting to do something else. Ann's journal entries, which, break up the narrative, quickly take the lid off what's to come. There is a handsome young man in her office who is troubled by homosexual leanings and a desire For her. She records that the attention of two men leaves her elateda burden lifted, somehow a new life is possible now, I am really going to break out of old patterns, selfimposed rules and regulations and those imposed by society which I do not need.

title: Carolyn T. Whittaker Wed to John Monks
description: Carolyn Tucker Whittaker, administrative assistant at the Bloomingdale House of Music, Inc., a community music school, was married here yesterday afternoon to John Ormsby Monks, of Southport, Conn., an assistant vice president with the People's Savings Bank in Bridgeport, Conn.

title: How to Improve Chances On Your Return of Serve
description: The serve, as almost any tennis player can tell you, is the most important shot in the game. But what's the second most important?

title: What's New in the Camera World
description: THE Midtown Gallery, 344 East 14th Street, will bold a monthly forum with all photographers invited to bring work for showing to one another, for criticism, and for discussion. To be chaired by Larry Siegel, director of the gallery, the forum is free, but there is a limit of six prints per participant. The first meeting is scheduled for Thursday evening from 7 to 10. For more information phone (212) 6747200.

title: Epilogue
description: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority has concluded its investigation into the East River tunnel fire last August and its findings were painful for the agency: The reaction by Transit Authority supervisors to the fire was described as sluggish and confused.

title: A little light on the subject
description: As predictable as my father's injunction, Don't forget to turn off the lights, is the appearance of three books riding the current of the energy crisis. Which is not to criticize my father or these books. For he understandably considered waste unseemly, and these quickie volumes aim to enlighten those afraid the lights are going out by themselves.

title: Television
description: THIS Tuesday evening, courtesy ?? a Marcus Welby, M.D. episod?? called The Outrage, the mos ?? significant scenario concerning ?? primetime program will have alread?? been played off camera. The name ?? the power game can be called Power ?? ful. Networks Versus Increasingl?? Powerful Pressure Groups.

title: Pamela Mills Has Nuptials
description: The marriage of Pamela Wight Mills, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Marshall Mills of Darien, Conn., and Vineyard Haven, Mass., to Stephen Arthur Besse, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Besse Jr. of Weston, Mass., took place yesterday afternoon in West Tisbury, Mass.

title: Soviet Six Is Tied at 44; Canada Goal Disallowed
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 5The Canadian pros finally came to life tonight and battled to a disputed 44 tie with the Soviet, national hockey team Team Canada claimed victory on an endofthegamegoal by Gordie Howe.

title: What They Are Saying
description: Frank Robinson, hired by Phil Seghi, general manager of the Cleveland Indians, thereby becoming the first black manager in the major leagues, learns he had competition for the job: There were a number of other men I considered, Seghi said. Larry Doby [a black] was one. Dave Bristol, Frank Lucchesi, Bob Lemon and Jim Gilliam [a black] were under consideration also. ... Why did I finally decide on Frank Robinson? Because I know him so well. By that I mean I had an opportunity to observe him closely when we were both, with Cincinnati. I saw his capabilities. People talk about the way he won the MVP award in both leagues, with Cincinnati and with Baltimore. But I saw other things in him besides that. I'm talking about his leadership qualities.

title: When You Rent a House for the Summer, You Expect Some Damage
description: WHEN you rent a house for the summereither to or fromyou have to expect a certain amount of damage. China will Chip and glasses break, furniture will scratch and upholstery spot. This summer my wife Joanne and I, our toddler mily and our airedale Fumfer rented a house from the Griggs Irving family in South Kent, Conn. Remarkably, we did not chip a single piece of china, break a Single glass or leave so much as a mark on furniture or upholstery.

title: News Summary and Index
Dining Out in Jersey
description: The restaurants reviewed here are rated four stars to none, based on the writer's judgment of quality in relation to the price of meals and the quality of comparable establishments. Roughly, one star must be translated as fair, two stars as good, three as excellent and four as superb.

title: Obstacle Course in Brooklyn
description: Motorists accustomed to leaving the Belt Parkway at Pennsylvania Avenue to cut across Brooklyn to reach the Interborough Parkway are finding they have to alter their routes because the construction of lowincome housing has closed the road to Flatlands Avenue.

title: SHOP TALK
description: At first glance, it looks like a classic club tie with its small oval patterns and discreet initials sprinkled over a dark background.

title: Gift of $1.1Million To Aid Princeton
description: PRINCETONThe Seeley G. Mudd Fund, established by the will of the noted medical educator, has donated $1.1million toward the construction of a manuscript library at Princeton University.

title: Book Ends
description: Sievers. Being a report on two of the season's surprise best sellers.

title: Dodgers, Orioles Win in Openers
description: Don Sutton allowed only four hits as the Los Angeles Dodgers defeated the Pittsburgh Pirates, 30, in the opener of the threeoffivegame series for the championship of the National League yesterday in Pittsburgh.

title: Burlington Offering Courses on Women
description: PEMBERTON  Five noncredit courses designed to explore the changing role of women in society are being offered this fall at Burlington County College's Center II in the Willingboro Plaza.

title: William Buckley reports on a tour of duty
description: The method by which the Nixon Administration selected its diplomatic appointees was always something of a mystery. If Maurice Stans's fundraising records were easily accessible, of course, it might not require the talents of Sherlock Holmes to crack the Case of the Rich Ambassadors. But no such simple explanation presents itself in trying to discover why, in the summer of 1973, the Administration named as an American delegate to the United Nations a conservative critic of that organization, William F. Buckley Jr. Did Nixon hope to bolster his right flank during round one of Watergate? Did he even know of Mr. Buckley's selection before he read it in his daily news summary? And if he knew, did he care, at a time when John Deanlike Spiro Agnew before himwas succeeding against all odds in making his household word?

title: Ford's Choice Is Not to Ignore His Predecessor
description: WASHINGTONWhat ties bind President Ford to Richard M. Nixon?

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: THE UNITED STATES has suggested a major cutback in oil consumption by the main importing countries bring down world prices. West Germany, France and Japan are cool to the idea.... Gulf Oil raised the wholesale price of gasoline by 1.5 cents a gallon. Sohio cut its price by 1 cent, Skelly Oil by 2.5 cents and Clark Oil by 2 cents.... Grumman has arranged for $200million in bank credits from nine United States banks and the Bank Melli of Iran.

title: MusicBox Society Marks 25 Years
description: SADDLE BROOK  There was a noisy crowd at the Marriott Motel last weekend, but no one seemed to care.

title: New Names Make Difference
description: A good pro football fan probably can identify Dave Butz. He is the huge (6 feet 7 inches, 280 pounds) defensive tackle for the St. Louis Cardinal and his uncle is Secretary of Agriculture. But can the same fan handle Council Rudolph, Leo Brooks, Bob Rowe and Ron Yankowski?

title: The Nation
description: Vital decisions affecting the future of America's prairielands will be made in the coming months, as President Ford, the Congress and Western state governments determine the restrictions to impose on companies ready to stripmine the coal beds of the Great Plain and the Southwest.

title: Baseball Playoffs
description: AMERICAN LEAGUE

title: Police Party Was a Real Bust
description: Get a location set up. This was what Chief of Detectives Louis C. Cottell said last April to Deputy, Chief Edwin T. Dreher, who is in charge of detectives in Queens. The order led to a party last weekend that belongs in a Damon Runyon anthology.

title: Gothic Highgate
description: IT OBVIOUSLY belongs in a gothic novelor at the very least in an Agatha Christie mystery. Especially a little before closing time, when a haze is settling over the grave markers, Karl Marx is looking particularly ferocious and the wind is starting to rustle the undergrowth and leaves.

title: RUSSIAN PRAISES A GULAG SEQUEL
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 5Roy Medvedev, a dissident historian, has praised the second volume of Aieksandr I. Solzhenitsyn's Gulag Archipelago as generally accurate, but has criticized the author for suggesting that Communists got preferential treatment in Stalin's prison camps.

title: Kehler and Reid Spark Westfield, 277
description: Glen Kehler and Jim Reid, Westfield's running stars, ea ched gained more than 100 yards for the second straight week yesterday and led their team to a 277 victory over Union.

title: Late TV Listings
description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: Mary Jane Ragsdale Engaged to Marry
description: Mr. and Mrs. William W. Ragsdale Jr. of Short Hills, N.J., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Mary Jane Ragsdale, to Herbert Hatton Adkins Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Adkins of High Point, N. C.

title: Bakery Products On Sale at School
description: SCOTCH PLAINSFor the third consecutive year, the Baking, Department at the Union County Vocational Center is making its products available to the public. The baked goods are sold every Friday from 1:15 to 2:45 P.M.

title: Gisela May Sings trecht, Tucholsky With Exhilaration
description: Gisela May's recital Friday night at the Hunter College Playhouse of chansons to texts by Bertolt Brecht and Kurt Tucholskyto be repeated next Saturday at S P.M.provided for almost unalloyed pleasure.

title: Chief Justice, epic hero, mythic figure
description: Maybe we need a folkhero to help us forget Watergate or to adorn the coming Bicentennial of the Revolution. At any rate, Leonard Baker gives us one 846 sprawling pages about John Marshall, longtime (180135) Chief Justice of the United States and most influential interpreter of its law, which seems at times less historical biography than a novel set in history, say Thackeray's Henry Esmond.

title: The Season Has Its Reasons
description: THE change from summer to fall begins as a quiet secret in the tree tops. One day, the binds leave without a sound. How easily they disappear find nests in the warmer Southlands. Another day, the apples and pears that were green for so many months turn rosy red and soft yellow.

title: PHARMACIST DIES OF HOLDUP WOUND
description: A Queens pharmacist died yesterday in St. John's Hospital Elmhurst, after being shot in the head Friday night when two men held up a drugstore at 6425 108th Street, Forest Hills, Queens.

title: AbdulJabbar Fractures Hand,
description: BUFFALO, Oct. 5 (AP)Kareem AbdulaJabbar, the Milwaukee Bucks' 7foot2inch center, sustained a fractured bpne in his right hand in an exhibition game against the Boston Celtics tonight and was expected to be lost to the team for three to six weeks. The regular season begins Oct. 15.

title: Robert Bond Weds Patricia Anne Good
description: Patricia Anne Good, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William H. Good of Amagansett, L. I., and Suffern, N. Y., was married yesterday in East Hampton, L. I., to Robert William Bond, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Bond of Northport, L. I.

title: Susan Nelson Harvard Bride
description: The marriage of Susan Alice Nelson, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James Walter Nelson of Bayside, Wis., to Glenn Brewster took place in Cambridge, Mass., at noon yesterday. The bridegroom is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Oliver Brewster of Essex Fells, N. J.

title: Andretti Bumped Off Pole for U.S Prix
description: WATKINS GLEN, N. Y., Oct, 5Mario Andretti, who will not win the world drivers' championship tomorrow in the United States Grand Prix, did not win the pole position for the race today when his new car met a guard rail for the first time.

title: On the Hudson: Circling
description: AS soon as I get on, I regret the whole thing; it was a whimsical idea gone terribly wrong, and my head is throbbing with goodseat anxiety. I'm in for 3 hours of travel, 35 miles of sights, cruising all the way around Manhattan on the Circle Line.

title: Chinese Program Set in Hackensack
description: HACKENSACK  The 80member National Chinese Opera Theater of Taiwan will perform at the Orrie de Nooyer Auditorium on Oct. 17. Festival 70, an activity of the North Jersey Cultural Council, is sponsor of the program.

title: The Art of Budget Cutting
description: The obsession with cutting the Federal budget, whatever its value in fighting inflation, has the virtue of directing public attention to the insides of a $305billion black box. Unfortunately, the lessons so far drawn from this closer inspection give little hope that future budgetary decisions will be better than those in the past.

title: Venezuela Resents American Pressures
description: CARACASOil has not dramatically changed life in Venezuela, not yet anyway, but there's a new spirit of independence, an urgent demand for recognition and fair treatment from the industrial powers, particularly the United States.

title: JEWS AGAIN FACE VIENNA PROTESTS
description: VIENNA, Oct. 5A former, convent, now equipped with a kosher kitchen and surrounded by armed guards, has become the latest symbol in a continuing controversy here over what to do with Soviet Jewish emigrants on their way to Israel.

title: Mrs. Ford Continues to Make Excellent Progress, Doctors Say
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 (UPI) Betty Ford marked the end of a week of hospitalization, for removal of her right breast to prevent the spread of cancer, by walking around in her suite at will today and eating a hearty breakfast of eggs, bacon and toast.

title: Margery McClure Is Married To John R. Parker in Bermuda
description: Christ Presbyterian Church to Warwick, Bernick, was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Margery Joan McClure, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Carl H. McClure 3d of Rye, N.Y., to John Randolph Parker. His parents are Mr. and Mrs. Lee Parker of Glen Burnie, Md.

title: Do the police prevent crime?
description: To many the question seems absurd: Even though the police spend most of their time on noncriminal matters  medical emergencies, family disputes, minor traffic violations, auto accidents and the likethey also arrested an estimated 1.8 million persons in 1973 for having committed one or more of the seven major crimes, including nearly 128,000 robbers, 200,000 assaulters and 434,000 burglars. It is hard to believe that if these were not arrested there would not have been more robberies, assaults and burglaries.

title: LEFKOWITZ VIGOR ON MILK DOUBTED
description: Robert Abrams, the Democratic candidate for Attorney General, yesterday questioned whether Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz ought to handle the Dairylea milk case, saying that sufficient facts have been produced that warrant consideration that a special prosecutor is needed to look into the whole affair.

title: BolotowskyA Triumph As Much for a Personality As for a Talent
description: THE new art season has already produced an agreeable surprise a retrospective of 91 works by Ilya Bolotowsky at the Guggenheim Museum. It is a surprise that in itself is surprising, for its subject is scarcely newcomer. Bolotowsky is 67 years old. He has been a prolific abstract painter since the early 1930's and has shown regularly in New York for 20 years. Yet at no point has he received anything like the attention that, on the evidence of the Guggenheim show, he has clearly deserved.

title: MAJOR DRUG RAID UNDER WAY HERE
description: A largescale roundup of alleged members of an international smuggling operation that has been bringing cocaine from Colombia to New York City was being carried out here yesterday by Federal and ??y lawenforcement authorities.

title: Lincoln Gains 483 Yards In Scoring 520 Victory
description: It took Lincoln a period to get its ground attack untracked yesterday, but when it did Midwood was left reeling. The Abes rolled up 483 yards rushing and crushed Midwood, 520, in a Public Schools Athletic League Brooklyn East Division II game at Midwood Field.

title: Susan P. Cooney, Editor, Affianced
description: Mr. and Mrs. Robert Bossert Cooney of Old Lyme, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Susan Park Cooney, to Carter Scott Evans, son of Mr. and Mrs. Carnot Wagener Evans of Darien, Conn.

title: Two Hearings This Week to Help Shape Final Review of Tocks Island Dam Study
description: TRENTON  Two public meetings this week may play a major role in determining whether the proposed and protested Tocks Island Dam, and its accompanying power, recreation and floodcontrol projects, will ever come to pass.

title: Swedish tales, an ancient city, the cruel sea
description: The Land Beyond

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was: 87919 Tickets matching the number win $10,000. Tickets with the five numbers in reverse win $1,000. Tickets with the first or lest four numbers in order win $225. Tickets with the first, middle or last three numbers in sequence win $25, Losing tickets are eligible for a special prizedrawn on Thursdays.

title: ExFliers to Salute Belgians
description: CRESSKILL  Although Louis Rabinowitz has done all the planning for the reunion, he is not at all sure that he will be able to recognize many of the 60 or so members of a World War II Belgian resistance group that is scheduled to arrive in New York on Friday.

title: Early Kick Provides Lynbrook's Margin
description: Lynbrook, the only one of seven teams in newly formed Nassau Conference VII to finish with a losing record last year, upset Valley Stream South yesterday, 76, on the first Saturday of conference play.

title: 2 AGENCIES DISPUTE PIPELINE REGULATION
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 (UPI)A jurisdictional battle within the Federal Government is preventing regulation or inspection of offshore oil and gas pipelines, a House committee reported today.

title: Routed Twice in a Row, Boston College Reverses Form by Trouncing Navy, 370
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Oct. 5The way Joe Glandorf played defensive end for Boston College in the Eagles' 370 rout of Navy today, it's hard to believe he was making his first start.

title: CLEVELAND SEEKS UTILITY SOLUTION
description: CLEVELAND, Oct. 5The future of this city's 60yearold municipal power plant is being studied by members of the city administration and city council.

title: League Adapts to Dolphins' Style
description: While people are starting to ask What's happened to the Miam Dolphins, winners of consecutive Super Bowls, Emerson Boozer of the New York Jets sees no change in them and he thinks that might be their problem.

title: Seize the Moment
description: If President Ford is not prepared to recommend a tough program of economic sacrifice and energy conservation until after the Noyember elections, he could lose some major psychological gains available to him now.

title: Robinson's Breakthrough: Does It Really Open New Doors?
description: To compare Frank Robinson's breakthrough as the first black major league manager in 1975 with Jackie Robinson's as a player in 1947 can be cruelly misleading and can obscure the true situation. Until and unless other actions are taken by baseball authorities on a large scalein giving black players a chance to manage teams in the minor leaguesthe appointment of Robinson as Cleveland's manager won't have much effect on the total picture.

title: Bar Hours a Mayoral Issue
description: EAST ST. LOUIS, Ill., Oct. 5 (UPI)Tony Palmyeri may not win his campaign for Mayor of East St. Louis, but he has found a popular issue to championkeep the bars open until 4 A.M. Mr. Palmeri, in a race against Mayor James E. Williams Sr. and Hermon Betts, says more visitors would be attracted to the city if taverns were allowed to remain open until 4 A.M. The current closing times are 2 A.M. on weekdays and 3 A.M. on weekends.

title: Opera: Turandot Debut
description: With the belated arrival at the Metropolitan Opera of Nancy Tatum, who made her Met debut on Friday night in the title role of Puccini's Turandot, opera in New York has acquired a dramatic soprano with a voice and interpretative power that make one sit up and listen.

title: Israel Philharmonic To Play in Trenton
description: TRENTONThe Israel Philharmonic Orchestra will appear here next Saturday night in a performance sponsored by the Jewish Federation of Trenton.

title: Dave Anderson
description: At the coronation of Frank Robinson last week as major league baseball's first black manager, Ted Bonda moved quietly through the ceremony. Not many people realized that he had created it.

title: Nonconformist Art By Soviet Emigres Is Shown at N.Y.U.
description: Four Soviet artists exhibited their work at New York University's Loeb Student Center last week to acquaint the American public with the type of art that was confiscated by Soviet authorities on Sept. 15 at an unofficial art show in Moscow.

title: Is Wall Street's Extra Half Hour a Success?
description: A million shares is a million shares, a delighted stockbroker said as he assessed the flow of trading that was conducted in the new 30minute caboose tacked onto the end of the normal 5hour10 A. M. to 3:30 P.M.daily trading session of the New York, American and several other stock exchanges last week.

title: Brown's Youthful Team Is Favored in the Ivy League
description: No one knows better than Cliff Stevenson, the soccer coach at Brown, that last year's freshmen can play varsity this season. Because of Brown's sophomoresand the departure of last year's senfors at Pennmost Ivy League coaches say Brown will dommate the league this season.

title: Japanese Halt StrippedCoal Bargaining
description: ASTORIA, Ore., Oct. 5Japanese sensitivity about a growing controversy over the stripmining of Western grazing lands for coal appears to have wrecked a littlepublicized agreement for the export of millions o?? tons a year of such coal through this small port.

title: Biting the Bullet...
description: After his grave warning that the exorbitant price of oil set by the international cartel is threatening the breakdown of world order and safety, President Ford has apparently ruled out gasoline rationing, the country's most immediately effective defense, as well as a gasoline tax increase. At the same time, he talks of asking Americans to bite the bullet.

title: Calendar of Dog Shows
description: Today Montgomery County K.C. allterrier show, Temple University Music Festival grounds, Butler Pike, Ambler, Pa.; 1,203 dogs; 9 A.M.

title: Chamber Chief Resigns
description: ROSTON, Oct. 5 (AP)James G. Kelso, executive vice president of the Greater Boston Chamber of Commerce, resigned Tuesday, after holding the post for 10 years.

title: Lawyer Registration Fees
description: BOSTON, Oct. 5 (AP)Massachusetts lawyers have until Dec. 1 to register with the newly created Board of Bar Overseers to maintain active practices. The state's estimated 17,000 lawyers are now required to pay annual registration fees. Part of the $20 charge will go into a fund to reimburse clients who file successful claims with the Clients' Security Board.

title: Editors' Choice
description: Fiction

title: South Africa, Italy Split Final Singles
description: JOHANNESBURG, South h Africa. Oct 5 (AP)Adriano Panatta salvaged a measure of pride for Italy today when he heat Bob Hewitt., 6.3, 66, 62, and prevented South

title: CommunityLed Renovation Advances on West Side
description: An unusual brownstone renovation project involving 11 buildings that were abandoned by their owners seven to ten years ago is under way on 95th Street between Columbus and Amsterdam Avenues.

title: Jobless Up, Market Down, President on Spot
description: His series of national meetings over, his advisers divided, President Ford must now present his program for reviving the stagnating economy and diminishing inflation. But as he prepared to go before a joint session of Congress Tuesday, the symptoms of malaise significantly worsened: Unemployment went up and the stock market down, both sharply.

title: Watergate and the Economy Are Only Part of It
description: The candidates for the governorships of New York and Connecticut have begun to show evidence of their broad campaign strategies, and all are acting with obvious awareness of the election's immovable backdrop: the economy and Watergate.

title: Tishman Selling Part Of Midtown Assemblage
description: The New York Telephone Company is expected to purchase a vacant Third Avenue blockfront that, until the recent slump in the real estate market, was regarded as a prime site for mixeduse redevelopment.

title: A LEADING LEFTIST IS SLAIN IN CHILE
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Ott, 5, (Reuters)  Security forces killed Miguel Enriquez, a leading leftist, during a twohour gun battle in a southwestern suburb of this capital today.

title: 99Yard Pass Play Helps Evander to 276 Triumph
description: A 99yard touchdown pass play from Marc Friendlich to Jeff Azzari, a Public Schools Athletic League record, highlighted Evander's 276 victory over Monroe yesterday at the loser's field. The contest was a Bronx Division encounter, the first for both teams, and moved Evander's wonlost record to 20 while Monroe is 02

title: Beverly Barclay, Executive, Wed
description: Beverly Black Barclay, an account executive with DancerFitzgeraldSample, Inc., the New York advertising agency, was married in Greenwich, Conn., yesterday afternoon to Cabal Hooker O'Malley, an assistant vice president of the United States Trust Company of New York.

title: In the People's House
description: Having entered the White House under unique circumstances, Gerald Ford has ever since belied his reputation as the most conventional of politicians. Consulting largely with himself, he aborted the judicial process and granted a blanket pardon to Richard Nixon. Now, on his own initiative and almost casually, he has tossed aside a century of Presidential practice and will appear before a Congressional committee and answer questions about the pardon.

title: Succoth Is Building Time for Jews
description: Like mushrooms after a heavy rain, they sprang up throughout the city last month in neighborhoods as diverse as the structures themselves.

title: DOMINICANS EASE CONSULATE SIEGE
description: SANTO DOMINGO, Dominican Republic, Oct. 5 (AP)Field telephones were set up by the police at the besieged Venezuelan consulate in Santo Domingo today, leading to speculation that the Government was ready to renew negotiations with leftist terrorists holding an American diplomat and six other hostages inside.

title: For Poland, the Zloties Outweigh the Ideology
description: BELGRADEThe prosperity of Communist Eastern Europe is coming to depend on businesslike if not entirely friendly relations with the United States.

title: Rutgers Shows Children'sBook Art
description: NEW BRUNSWICK  The fine art to be found in illustrations in children's books is the subject of a delightful and visually rewarding exhibition that is opening today at the Rutgers University Art Gallery.

title: Solutions to Last Week's Puzzles
description: RUSSELL McKEE: THE LAST WEST So many ways have been found to make rain that it's hard to reckon with them intelligently.... One crew of otherwise moderate men even got a flatcar and an old Civil War cannon and went about Kansas selling their cloudshooting services.

title: Cooke Got Malaria On African Visit; Is Rating at Home
description: Cardinal Cooke has been confined to his residence since Friday with a case of malaria contracted on his recent sixday visit to the heart of the drought area in West Africa.

title: New Weekend Farmers Harvest Vegetables With Varied Results
description: ATLANTAWell, I don't know what happened, sighed Virginia Woodhead, an Atlanta teacher, contemplating the wreckage of her venture into raising and canning her own homegrown vegetables.

title: Florida Conquers L.S.U. For Fourth in Row, 2414
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Oct. 5 (AP)Jimmy Fisher threw two touchdown passes to Lee McGriff and Florida's clutch defense rejected five scoring opportunities to lead the Gators past Louisiana State, 2414, today.

title: DATA ON MARIJUANA HINT AT SOME PERIL
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5 (AP) Preliminary data from a new Government study raise the possibility that marijuana may be more harmful than has been thought, the research director of the National Institute of Drug Abuse said today.

title: Any Complaints Against the State? Just Phone (800) 7928600
description: TRENTON  Anyone who thinks that he may be getting the runaround from state agencies will no longer have to fight City Hall. All he will have to do, the Byrne administration says, is call a new citizencomplaint office here.

title: Thomas Reefer, Elizabeth Dross Set June Bridal
description: The engagement has been announced of Elizabeth Harte Dross of Hawthorne, N. J., daughter of the late Mr. and Mrs. Hartman H. Dross, to Thomas Merrick Reefer, son of Mr. and Mrs. James Delno. Hooper Reefer of Kansas City, Mo. A June wedding is planned.

title: Puns and anagrams
description: ACROSS

title: A Bureaucrat's Apology
description: Last week we left the bureaucrat of culture alone in his office, with the door closed, writing a memo to God. Why is it, he is asking, that when I look at my calendar, I think of the titles of books by Solzhenitsyn? One Day in the Life of Ivan Denisovich, The First Circle, Cancer Ward, The Gulag Archipelago ... It is insupportable, really, this pumping on your selfpity as though it were an accordion. Besides, there's a plane to catch and a meeting to go to.

title: Malnutrition Is Up Sharply Among World's Children
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5In parts of rural Bangladesh, during relatively good times, villagers hope to eat one meal a day. This year, during the aftermath of the summer floods, many of them were eating only once every other day, sometimes only once in every three.

title: Two Women Join Ranks of State Police Trainees
description: SEA GIRTWhat will go down in history as a first for the State Police Academy occurred last week. Two women joined the ranks of 106 male candidates for appointments to the 53yearold force.

title: Foolish Pleasure Takes Champagne
description: Foolish Pleasure, the undefeated colt who campaigns in the silks of John Greer, had no trouble winning the $144,750 Champagne Stakes at Belmont Park yesterday for his seventh triumph. The onemile race for 2yearolds attracted a field of nine contestants, but as far as Foolish Pleasure was concerned, once he got rolling, he was all alone.

title: JoAnn Engelke Is Bride Here
description: The marriage of JoAnn Engelke, daughter of Mrs. Helen Engelke of Park Ridge, Ill., and John F. Engelke of Evanston, Ill., to Angus Macbeth, son of Mr. and Mrs. Norman Macbeth of Springfield, Vt., and Spring Valley, N. Y., took place here yesterday afternoon.

title: Employe Drinking Subject of Seminar
description: SEABROOKThe first in series of seminars on employe alcoholism programs will be held Tuesday at Seabrook House.

title: National League Gate Up in '74
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 5 (UPI) National League attendance in 1974 totaled nearly 17 million and was the second highest in league history.

title: He's One of Four Counselors, but Decidedly First Among Equals
description: As Gerald R. Ford tries to get his lagging Presidency off the ground, he is counting on the manifold talents of Robert Trowbridge Hartmann to help make it fly.

title: Wide Range of Propositions to Confront Voters on Crowded Ballot in November
description: TRENTON The Legislature is expected to approve tomorrow a $90million bond issue for lowandmoderatelypriced housing, thus adding still another issue to an already crowded November ballot. All told, the public will be asked to vote on five propositions on Nov. 5.

title: HallofFame Retriever, Age 2, Having a Top Year
description: Week after week, the names of Russell H. Klipple and his golden retriever, Moreland's Golden Tonka, U.D., appear in the obedience summaries, with the dog romping off with highscoring honors. She's in the golden retriever hall of fame, said Klipple. Last year, she was second highestscoring golden in America, with 102 points. The No. 1 had 129.

title: The round museum building impresses a critic as a maimed monument on a maimed Mall
description: WASHINGTON, D. C. IT is hard to know whether Washington does something to architects or architects do something to Washington. Perfectly respectable practitioners fall on their faces with alarming regularity, unstrung by the Capital's overblown scale and frequently overwrought grandeur. Even in the case of the most secure talent, something seems to go awry.

title: WHITE HOUSE AIDS TEXAS DEMOCRAZ
description: FORT WORTH, Oct. 5The White House, acting at the request of a Democrat, has requested a Republican Congressional candidate here to retract political statements he had attributed to President Ford.

title: French Films Dominate The New York Festival
description: FRENCHMEN may not know it but filmmaking is flourishing in France. That, at least, is the impression given by the selection committee for the 12th New York Film Festival, now in progress at Lincoln Center. Of the 21 programs, eight are French, including JeanPierre Melville's 1949 film adaptation of Jean Cocteau's Les Enfants Terribles, which is being given a retrospective showing at Alice Tully Hall tomorrow night (Oct. 7).

title: TV Has Fun With Robbery, Arson and Kidnapping. So Why Not Rape?
description: ISAT through one hundred and twenty minutes of rape the other night, thanks to the vagaries of television programing. It didn't bother me at all And that was what bothered me. First, CBS's detective adventure series, Hawaii FiveO, served up a story about an excop who rapes and strangles women, After that, NBC's copsandrobbers series, Police Story, gave us a drama about a rapist who repeatedly assaults a woman while her young daughter looks on.

title: INVESTING
description: In this era of tight money the Kennecott Copper Corporation is sitting pretty. It's cashrich, with prospects of becoming several times richer. But this abundance of liquidity may lead to problems it makes, Kennecott perhaps One of the best takeover candidates around.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTON  New institutions, like new babies, often arouse unrealistic expectations in the hearts of their parents, and that certainly seems to be happening to the group of new institutions that come under the collective description of Congressional budget reform?

title: Drivein Movies Go Dark as Costs Rise
description: CAMDENDrivein movie theaters, which made their New Jersey debut here four decades ago, are running into financial problems, and there are indications that many will no longer be. In business by next summer.

title: A Hospital's Annual Ball Gives Way To Economy
description: MANHASSETPart of the glitter and glamour of the North Shore social season is yet another victim of the economic crisis.

title: The Region/Continued
description: It is a year since the Arab oil embargo created long lines at gasoline stations and serious heating oil shortages throughout much of the United States. The Northeast suffered particularly severe shortages of gasoline.

title: And humility will make you peaceful
description: With engaging selfdepreciation, John K. Fairbank describes himself in these pages as a Veritable Pooh  Bah among the pundits. He complains of being known as a China expert, a title I wear like a hairshirt. Yet it is in that guise that the eminent historian and impresario of American scholarship on East Asia is presented in China Perceived, a collection of occasional articles and lectures that testify to his efforts over a period of more than two decades to break down what he calls the invincible ignorance of Americans about Asia.

title: Program Set to Aid Jamaica Bay Wildlife Refuge
description: The National Park Service, criticized sharply for the condition of the Jamaica Bay Wildlife Refuge, his announced a program for improvements.

title: STATE A.F.L.C.I,O: ACTS ON ECONOMY
description: KIAMESHA LAKE, N. Y., Oct. 5Although political endorsemente appear to have been the main concern of the 1,800 delegates who attended the annual convention of the New York State A.F.L.C.I.O. that ended here today, the delegates also passed numerous resolutions aimed at inflation and unemployment.

title: ALGERIAN ASSAILS WEST'S OIL STAND
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 5President Houari Boumediene of Algeria has told the United Nations that certain large industrial countires are launching a veritable offensive against the oil exporting countries.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: PurpleFaced Motorists
description: Purple is out and green is in on Chrysler care this year. It's just as well in the opinion of some Chrysler men who have had to deal with customers whose cars have peeling purple paint.

title: Upstate Area to Vote on Dissolving Village Status
description: ALBANYThe residents of Fort Covington, a tiny village on the Canadian border, will go to the polls in a special election on Tuesday to vote on whether to dissolve their village government anti thus save about 32 per cent on their yearly realestate tax bills.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Governor Wilson's office in Albany announced that the Governor was taking steps to lessen the possibility of coal shortages in New York. The announcement said that shortages of anthracite coal have already been reported from several regions of the state and that bituminous coal shortages may result from a strike of the United Mine Workers' whose contract expires Nov. 12.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: WEST POINT, N.Y., Oct. 5Army took advantage of two Penn State fumbles in the first three minutes today and ran off o a surprising early 140 lead before the Nittany Lions rallied for a 2114 victory.

title: Michigan Bars Chemical From River
description: LANSING, Mich, Oct. 5They Michigan Chemical Company was told yesterday by the State Department Of Natural Resources that it had 15 days to submit a plan to halt the discharge of a toxic fire retardant compund into a nearby river.

title: Susan Connor Wed To A. P. Donlevy
description: Susan. Cosgrove Connor and Andrew Peter Donlevy were married here yesterday morning in the Holy Family Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. Aloysius Jenko.

title: Veteran Traffic Officer To Lead Pulaski Parade
description: More than 100,000 PolishAmericans will march up Fifth Avenue today in the 38th annual Pulaslti paradeled by a New York City police officer who has directed traffic at busy midtown intersections for the last 23 years.

title: Ridgewood Halts Clifton on Shutout
description: Ridgewood snapped Clifton's winning streak at 19 games yesterday with a 70 upset in Ridgewood, marching 68 yards with the opening kickoff.

title: The Taste of the Color
description: The color now comes to the woodlands, to the trees along rural roadsides, even to the dooryard trees and shrubs. It changes, day to day, as though all the colors of the sylvan spectrum were spilled across the landscape.

title: Hospital Administrators Find Analogies Help in Solving Everyday Problems
description: NEWARKIn a program designed to help them solve everyday problems, hospital administrators are being taught to think like automobile mechanics, cooks and even baseball managers.

title: Kenneth Goalagong Dead at 44; Tennis Star's Father Hit by Car
description: HILLSTON, Australia, Oct. 5 (Reuters)Kenneth Goolagong, father of the tennis champion Evonne Goolagong, was struck by a car and killed here today in this town 450 miles west of Sydney. He was 44 years old,

title: Dance
description: THERE are dancers and dancers. You could draw up a history of ballet simply by recounting the exploits of its dancers. The famous dancers, the legendary ones, the diamondstudded stars, leave an indelible mark. More perhaps than any other performing artists, the star dancers seem to symbolize their art in the popular mind. Few people remember actors with such intensity: Burbage will never be as famous as Shakespeare, and even Olivier is not going to last as long as Beckett. Opera, too, has its big names. But not even Enrico Caruso or Maria Callas is as famous, or even as accepted, in the mass culture concept as Verdi or Wagner.

title: Letter from a Greek Village
description: LIA. On July 20, as Turkish troops were invading the island of Cyprus, this small village the northwest corner of Greece was preparing celebrate its most important holidaythe feast day of the Prophet Elias, patron saint of the village.

title: Thriving Calgary, Grown Wealthy on Oil, Adds Glamour to Western Canada
description: CALGARY, AlbertaWith oil gushing out of the ground all around it, with dozens of gleaming skyscrapers going up, and with a population that has doubled in the last 14 years, Calgary has become the glamour spot of western Canada, a crossroads of wealth and commerce.

title: Driver Is Injured In Track PileUp
description: SALEM, N. M., Oct. 5 (AP) A harness racing driver was injured when a horse went down on the track, causing five other horses to fall at Rockingham Park last night.

title: U.S. Health Ruling Challenged
description: TRENTON  A littlenoticed Federal regulation that discourages surprise inspections of health facilities is being challenged by New Jersey officials.

title: Cell Block Theater Giving Hope to Inmates
description: Michael Dalakian, an exconvict and drug addict now turned poet and playwright, said he was scared when he got out of prison the last time.

title: Five Killed as Blasts Shatter Two British Pubs
description: LONDON, Oct. 5Two explosions tonight shattered pubs popular with soldiers in Guildford, Surrey, 30 miles southwest of London. A police spokesman reported that five persons, three men and two women, were killed and 54 were injured.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Representatives of two grain companies, after meeting with President Ford and other Administration officials, have agreed to cancel a $500million shipment of wheat and corn to the Soviet Union. Secretary of Agriculture Earl L. Butz said the Government could have ordered the shipment suspended if the companies had not agreed to cooperate. The shipment, which included 35 million bushels of wheat and 19 million bushels of corn, was stopped by a hold order directed by President Ford. Dr. Butz said the President's action was meant to avoid export controls and keep world markets open through voluntary cooperation. [1:8.]

title: INQUIRIES SOARING BREAST CANCER
description: The publicity surrounding Betty Ford's surgery for breast cancer has motivated thousands of women around the country to seek appointments at free breast cancer detection centers.

title: What's Doing on the MISSISSIPPI COAST
description: HOLDING THE LINEMississippi's Gulf Coast runs for 50 miles, 25 of them ribboned by the world's longest manmade beach. The yearround resort area lies midway between Mobile, Ala., and New Orleans and comprises the communities of Pascagoula, Gautier, Ocean Springs, Biloxi, Gulfport, Long Beach, Pass Christian and Bay St. Louis. Not the least of its surprises, in these days of soaring travel costs, is the discovery that inflation seems to have touched the Gulf Coast more gently than most other regions.

title: Sugar's New Rival: HighFructose Corn Syrup
description: Not since the cyclamate ban five years ago has anything so stirred the industrial sweetener industry. Highfructose corn syrup, a sprucedup version of the familiar table product, has taken the spotlight as the leading alternative to highpriced cane sugar and beet sugar.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: In the battle of textile fibers, wool has been fighting a losing battle not only in the fabric mills but in the grazing fields as well.

title: Lawyer Registration Fees
description: BOSTON, Oct. 5 (AP)Massachusetts lawyers have until Dec. 1 to register with the newly created Board of Bar Overseers to maintain active practices. The state's estimated 17,000 lawyers are now required to pay annual registration fees. Part of the $20 charge will go into a fund to reimburse clients who file suecessful claims with the Clients' Security Board.

title: 2 Forms of Malnutrition Worry World Health Experts
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 5Public health experts worried about the consequences of food shortages in several regions of the world are particularly concerned over two serious forms of malnutrition.

title: Agency Helps First Offenders
