Unwilling to accept all the programs coming down the national feed from the Public Broadcasting Service these days, WNET/13 is foraging, either by itself or in consortiums with other stations, for alternative material that it hopes will prove more attractive to its urban audience, which represents at least 25 per cent of the total publicTV audience.

title: Votes in Congress
description: 1. Vote on Railroad Retirement Bill, which had been vetoed by the President and required a twothirds vote of those present for passage. Veto overridden, 72 to 1, Oct. 16.

title: Judith LaPook to Wed
description: Dr. and Mrs. Sidney LaPook of Great Neck, L. have announced the engagement of their daughter; Judith Anne LaPook, to Barry Behrer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Morton Behrer of Short Hills, N. J. The future bride, an alumna of Wellesley College, and her fianc, a graduate of Duke University, are in the third year at the New York University Law School. A December wedding is planned.

title: For the Traveler Who Been Everywhere: A Room With a Nurse
description: HERE in Paris can one find quiet room overlooking a garden of bright flowers and pinkblossomed cherry trees, where one can simply pop in on a moment's notice to find a room waiting? Where in Parisor anywhere else for that matter Cap one be served dinner in bed, soup to dastard, by a staff that seems to consist in the main of young and desirable maidens attendant on your every whim and desire, literally at your beck and call every minute of the day and night?

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: IN cutrate bars, it's known as watering the whisky. In the nation's busy coal fields, it's called layer loading. But the practice is essentially the same. Shipments of coal to electric utilities these days sometime contain layers of rock or dirt or a grade of coal lower than that ordered. The practice came to light last month when carloads of coal acceptable in tonnage failed to burn as hot as expected.

title: STAGE VIEW
description: Let's say you're at a party. The more talented raconteurs among the guests are apt to start things off with setpieces, long madeup jokes with calculated twists they have often used successfully before, artifices plain and complicated. You laugh, because the mechanics of the joke are tricky, because you're glad someone is doing the talking, because your first drink is watery and hasn't warmed you yet. Nothing, wrong with your laughter: The contrivances you're listening to are often pleasantly ingenious.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: FREEHOLD, N. J., Oct. 19 (UPI)The Standardbred Breeders and Owners Association of New Jersey saps its members will boycott Freehold Raceway beginning Monday unless authorities at the track agree to increase their purses.

title: Bread Costs, Pricesand ProfitsUp
description: WASHINGTON  White bread, one of the staples on the grocery list, has been a leader in the climb of food prices in the last two years. Other agricultural products have had their ups and downs  mostly ups  but bread has moved inexorably upward.

title: Randy Newman in Rare Form, Singing, Playing and Grousing
description: One of the things that make a Randy Newman concert such a pleasure are his betweensong remarks, and he was in rare form Friday night at Avery Fisher Hall, the first New York concert for the pop singer and song writer in two years,

title: Man! MEMO FROM A POBLISHER
description: The following was excerpted from Guidelines for Equal Treatment of the Sexes in McGrawHill Boole Company Publications, an 11page policy statement distributed to all editorial employes and the 8,000 authors on the publishing house's list for use in works of nonfictionsuch as textbooks, reference works, trade journals, educational materials and children's books.

title: Study of Arabic in U.S. Rose 50% in Last Year
description: Across the country, there has been sudden increase in the number of Americans enrolling in courses to study Arabic. Language schools and colleges with departments in Near East studies report a 50 per cent rise over last year in the number of students learning Arabic.

title: SHOP TALK
description: WESTFIELD  The calm and sane Scandinavian way of displaying wares prevails at Anne Nielsson's, a shop where Danish, Norwegian, Swedish and Finnish imports are beautifully arranged.

title: PHILIP D. BLOMBERG
description: Philip D. Blomberg, a lawyer, who retired in 1971 as executive vice president, secre tary and counsel of MillerWohl Company, ;Inc., a women's apparel chain, died yesterday in Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 73 years old and lived at 16 West 77th Street.

title: Film Bunuel believes that virtually every idea of the bourgeoisis should be tested with a little T.N.T. (Vincent Canby)
description: Le Fantome De La Liberte (The Spectre of Freedom) is Luis Buuel's 30th feature film and one of his most glorious assaults on the world what passes for reasonthe world we assume we see with our own eyessince L'Age D'Or, his first feature film made In 1930. At the age of 74 Buunel has outlived the Surrealist movement, with which he once identified himself, to create a cinema all his own, simultaneously classic and a little vulgar, always contemporary yet always somewhat dated, if only because this most passionate of film poets, having very early mastered the basics of filmmaking, has resolutely refused to clutter his movies with gratuitous style.

title: People/Business
description: To most people, robots are mostly outofthisworld characters found only in sciencefiction books and movies. However, they are the mainstay of a growing and prosperous business in Hackensack.

title: O.P.E.C. FOUNDER ATTACKS PROFITS
description: CARACAS. Venezuela, Oct.19 Venezuela's leading petroleum authority, Juan Pablo Perez Alfonzo, denounced international oil companies today for making unjust and exorbitant profits and urged oil producers to establish controls to protect consumers.

title: The Trade Bill Is Unlikely to Produce A Sudden Rush of Soviet Goods to the U.S.
description: MOSCOWFor months there has been no lack of speculation here about what the Soviet Union might do if it did not get the trade credits and mostfavorednation status promised by the Nixon Administration.

title: The City's Defenders  An International Mafia
description: The defenders of Venice, an Italian journalist remarked recently, are a peculiar kind of international mafia. They are scattered through many countries, operate a score of private committees; they maintain a tight network of telephone and mail communications, with friends in the major American and European media.

title: Ford, Campaigning in South, Urges G.O.P. to Adopt Truman's Fighting Spirit
description: GREENSBORO, N. C., Oct. 19 President Ford, alluding to signs of a major defeat for Republicans in next month's election, called on his party today to adopt the fighting spirit that Harry Truman, a Democrat, displayed in his successful Presidential campaign of 1948.

title: POINTS OF VIEW
description: When the sheiks and the Shah shut the oil valves year ago, they precipitated not only an international crisisthey also stimulated a conflict here in the United States between the need for more energy, quickly, and the national commitment to clean air, pure water and healthy land.

title: David Broughel to Marry Miss Wilcox
description: The engagement of Priscilla Trumbull Wilcox to David Bruce Broughel, son of Mr. and Mrs. James Driscoll Broughel, has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. William Walter Wilcox. Both families reside in West Hartford, Conn.

title: DeBakey Writing Book On Heart With Russian
description: HOUSTON, Tex., Oct. 19Dr. Michael E. DeBakey, the noted heart surgeon who is president of Baylor College of Medicine, and Dr. Boris Petrovsky, Minister of Health of the Soviet Union, announced here yesterday that they were collaborating on a textbook on emergency surgery on the heart and arteries. Both said it was the first such AmericanSoviet collaborative effort to write a textbook that they knew of.

title: Christine S. Jacobsen Is Married to Peter D. Scholtz
description: The Old First Presbyterian Church in Huntington, L. I., was the setting for the marriage of Christine Susan Jacobsen and Peter Dwight Scholtz yesterday afternoon. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Stanert Dransfield.

title: BQLI Bulletin Board
description: ART

title: Jesuit Editor Who Reported On Nixon Aide Is Dismissed
description: BOSTON, Oct. 19 (AP)The editor of the New England Jesuit newspaper who wrote about a possible church crackdown on priests in politics has been discharged.

title: Morristown to Be Host to Photography Fair
description: MORRISTOWNNew Jersey camera buffs will have an opportunity to examine the latest photographic equipment and techniques at a fair to be held at the Morristown Armory next weekend.

title: William and Mary Hands Rutgers Its First Loss, 2815
description: WILLIAMSBURG, Va., Oct. 19 (AP)John Gerdelman raced for three touchdowns today to spark William and Mary to a 2815 college football victory over previously unbeaten Rutgers.

title: World News Briefs
description: KHARTOUM, THE SUDAN, Oct. 19 (Reuters)A state of emergency was declared in the southern Sudan regional capital of Juba today following two days of student rioting that left two people dead, it was officially announced here.

title: Penn State Triumphs Over Syracuse, 3014
description: UNIVERSITY PARK, Pa., Oct. 19Syracuse opened against Penn State this afternoon as if determined to blitz its way to an upset victory. It scored on the first play from scrimmage on a 77yard pass that stunned hometeam rooters in the capacity crowd of 59,100.

title: Extortionist Demands $1Million. Alter Blasts at Utility in Oregon
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Oct. 19An extortionist who said that he had been responsible for a series of recent explosions that have damaged highvoltage transmission towers in Oregon demanded $1million today from the Bonneville Power Administration.

title: Miss Niska and Shadur Join Vespri
description: Maralin Niska and Lawrence Shadur entered the cast of the Metropolitan Opera production of Verdi's I Vespri Siciliani in the performance given yesterday afternoon. The remainder of the cast, which included Placido Dommingo and Paul Plishka, was familiar from previous performances, and the work was again conducted by James Levine.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: After 4 Years, 8 Former Ohio Guardsmen Go on Trial Tomorrow in Killings of 4 Students at Kent State
description: CLEVELAND, Oct. 19 (UPI)The alleged triggermen in the 1970 Kent State University shootings go on trial Monday, but questions about what really happened on the campus are likely to linger even after their fate is decided.

title: Fro Transactions
description: FOOTBALL

title: December Wedding For Nancy Kaplan
description: Mr. and Mrs. Stanley H. Kaplan of Brooklyn and Lords Valley, Pa., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Nancy Paula Kaplan, to Dr. Mark Richard Belsky, son of Dr. and Mrs. Maurice W. Belsky of Highland Paik, N.J. A December wedding is planned.

title: Philippine Crop Is Damaged
description: MANILA, Oct. 19 (AP)Two typhoons that battered the Philippines' main island of Luzon early this week damaged about $17.8 million worth of rice crops, the Government said today. The typhoons, Bess and Carmen, left at least 30 persons dead and seceral others missing.

title: ISRAELI FOLK GROUP AT THE FELT FORUM
description: Folk is apparently a flexibleword to the organizers of the Israeli Folk Festival '74, now at the Felt Forum. This year's collection, fot instance, includes a harmonica group, the Adler Trio, bent on playing a whole series of light classical pieces ending with that vaudevillian mouth organ delight, Sabre Dance.

title: Catholics and Jews Urged to Conduct Greater Dialogue
description: Archbishop Jean Jadot, the representative of Pope Paul VI in this country, called last week for a fuller, deeper and more open dialogue between Jews and Roman Catholics.

title: Picture Credits
description: 1MICHAEL GEIGER

title: Pilot Killed in Crash
description: CHESHIRE, Conn., Oct. 19 (AP)Ferdinand Schriever, 35 years old of Monroe died in the crash of an experimental plane here today, the police said.

title: 1,500 Whites in Boston Affirm Antibusing Stand
description: BOSTON, Oct. 19  About 1,500 white parents and their children from across the city and several of suburbs rallied in the neighborhood of Hyde Park today to affirm their united opposition to courtordered busing to achieve integration.

title: Young People Coming Home to Bed Study
description: They grew up in BedfordStuyvesant and then leftfor college and careers, to earn graduate degrees, to marry. Now, when they could be expected to head toward their quarter acre in suburbia, the young people have pulled a switch: they have moved back to BedfordStuyvesant.

title: FARMERS WILL GIVE BEEF TO HONDURAS
description: CUBA CITY, Wis., Oct. 19 (UPI)The Wisconsin National Farmers Organization, under fire for slaughtering hundreds of calves earlier this week in a protest over prices said today that the Federal Government had agreed to help ship some 1,000 calves to hurricanestricken Honduras.

title: RICHARD F. QUANDT, BANKING ADVISER, 75
description: Richard Frederick Quandt, a Hungarianborn banking official who retired in 1967 as adviser to the Industrial Bank of the Sudan, died Friday in Washington, where he lived. He was 75 years old.

title: Jack Benny Stricken
description: DALLAS, Oct. 19 (AP)Jack Benny, the 80yearold veteran showman, was taken ill last night as he prepared to do a showk at the Fairmont Hotel. Three doctors from the audience advised him not to perform, according to persons who were there.

title: ART
description: Nobody knew quite what to expect of Eight Contemporary Artists at the Museum of Modern Art. The title could have meant anything or anyone. The names of the artists seemed, when announced, to correspond to the injunction, When in doubt, diversify. The name of the organizer, Jennifer Licht, stood for sometitle of wide and generous sympathies. The space was all right. Beyond that, a blank on which all were free to fantasize.

title: AntiThieu Protesters Rush Assembly Steps
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sunday, Oct. 20 (AP)Hundreds of antiGovernment protesters today pelted the police with rocks, set a jeep on fire, and rushed up the steps of the National Assembly building in downtown Saigon.

title: Business Aids the Arts...And Itself
description: When foundations see their assets shrinking by onethird or more in Wall Street's bear market, as the Ford Foundation announced was its plight recently, and when munificent individual patrons suffer a similar fateas reportedly is the case with Rebekah Harkness, the sole support of a ballet company bearing her nameheads turn and fingers point to business to come to the rescue of the arts.

title: Cahill's DowntoEarth Course Is a Hit at Princeton
description: PRINCETONStudents in William T. Cahill's graduate course think that the former Governor is a good teacher, primarily because he lacks the scholarly airs of his colleagues on the Princeton faculty.

title: Thread's NewestTwist
description: Thread, the essential material in the construction of garments and other textile products, is belatedly catching up with the technology of new fibers.

title: MUSIC VIEW
description: To Pierre Boulez the world is made up of innovators and noninnovators. He, an innovator himself, is fascinated with the former and impatient with the latter. Innovation, a break from the past, a new look at thingsall that is, to Boulez, the raison retro of art. One wonders if the concept of quality enters into his thinking. He seems to be so fascinated with the new, or with art that at one time was pathbreaking, that all other considerations recede. The mere fact that a composer at one time or another broke away from the Establishment makes his music ipso facto important.

title: Fight Noise In Your Home
description: As we add more and more noisemating appliances and mechanized conveniences to our homes (washing machines, vacuum cleaners, television sets, hifi equipment, electric toys, air conditioners, etc.), and as houses are built closer and closer together with a corresponding increase in neighborhood traffic and other street noises, the increase in unwanted noise inside the home has become an annoying problem to many people: This problem is often aggravated by the fact that rooms are smaller and houses more compact than they used to be, with walls between rooms and apartments thin, ter.

title: James Mathis Plays Recital That Shows How Pianists Grow
description: James Mathis, who won all sorts of awards in the early part of his career, came to Alice Tully Hall on Friday night for his third recital here in a dozen years. Currently, the Texasborn pianist is teaching at Ohio State University in Columbus. He seems to have grown musically, to judge by reports on his previous appearances. Then his more virtuosic feats were admired. This time his playing in the more introspective, lyrical works came off more satisfactorily.

title: Late TV Listings
description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: A New Statesman editor can look at a queen
description: Elizabeth's life story is notorious for its bewildering problems, remarked J.E. Neale in the preface to his classic life, written in 1934. For more than 40 years Elizabeth I dazzled Europe with a carefullystaged display of queenly theatricals and her personal charm. Having vigorously executed six or seven galliards of a morning she would keep nervous councillors on their toes, as she veered between farsighted statesmanship and bouts of terrible hesitation. Her strategy of maintaining equilibrium  between Protestants and Catholics, Frenchmen and Spaniards, the young swordsmen of her circle and the more phlegmatic scribeswas the object of the closest scrutiny from all concerned. This enabled later generations of historians to supplement their researches among enormous amounts of state papers with snippets from the Frenth, the and other versions.

title: What Grand Rapids did for Jerry Fiordand vice versa
description: In his address to Congress shortly after taking over the Presidency, Gerald Ford twice mentioned his hometown, Grand Rapids. This was considerably more attention than Richard Nixon ever gave Whittier, Calif., or Lyndon Johnson gave Johnson City, Tex., in a major speech and it no doubt testified to Ford's real affection for the place where he grew up and that had kept him in Congress for 25 years.

title: Theater: Serban's Trilogy Is an Event
description: Most of the time I write about plays, good, bad or indifferent. Once in a while I get to write about the theater. It always sends shivers down the back of my typewriter. Now is one of those times.

title: Newbride to Beauvallon
description: DUBLIN, Oct. 19 (AP)Beauvallon, the 65 favorite, scored a sixlength victory today in the Newbride Consolation Stakes, a onemile test, on the Curragh turf track. Canadianowned Hurry Harriet, a 51 shot in the 11horse field, finished second. The winner earned about $2,500.

title: Six partial fictions Tatlin!
description: Reality is a fabric of many transparent films, suggests L'Abb Henri Breuil, the late French archeologist and pioneer of paleolithic art, who inhabits one of the six partial fictions in this lavishly original, cerebral and elusive first collection of stories by Guy Davenport. That is the only way we can perceive anything, the Abbe continues. We think it up. Reality touches our intuition to the quick. Each of these stories recreates an actual figure, another country, at another time; with the exception of Kafka, the subjects, millennia apart, range in obscurity from fairly (Heraclitus) to very (Adriaan van Hovendaal)and in each, Davenport thinks up the past again, imaginatively penetrates history,

title: Mrs. Rockefeller's Condition And Spirits Called Excellent
description: Margaretta Rockefeller was in excellent condition and spirits on the third day of recovery from breast surgery, the Memorial Hospital for Cancer and Allied Diseases reported yesterday.

title: Warrie L. Smith Wed To James David Price
description: Warrie Lynn Smith, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Warfield Smith of San Antonio, Tex., was married there at noon yesterday to James David Price, son of Mr. and Mrs. James D. Price of White Plains.

title: Larry Smith Is Example Of Redskin Now Idea
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19Nothing dramatizes the difference in philosophies between the Washington Redskins and. New York Giants, who will meet here tomorrow (1 P.M., Channel 2), more than the case of Larry Smith, the Redskin fullback.

title: Rockefeller Claim Called Contrary to a Tax Ruling
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19A leading tax lawyer said today that an argument used by Nelson A. Rockefeller to reduce his Federal income taxes conflicted with an established Internal Revenue Service ruling.

title: Pittsburgh Victor, 3511; Temple Routs Holy Cross
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 19 (AP) Tony Dorsett scored three touchdowns, including runs of 61 and 74 yards, and Billy Daniels threw two scoring passes as Pittsburgh crushed Boston College, 3611, today.

title: Pact Set to Save Road
description: CONCORD, N.H., Oct. 19 (AP) The Rockwell International Corporation has agreed to preserve the scenic road through Sandwich Notch, New Hampshire's last unprotected mountain pass, according to Representative James C. Cleveland. The New Hampshire Republican said Thursday that the company would preserve the road and 300 acres around the 600foot corridor. The company owns 12,000, acres of forest in the area.

title: ...And an Ear for Harmony
description: Lew R. Wasserman, chairman and chief executive officer of MCA, Inc. and of the reigning kings of Hollywood, is tired of people asserting that his entertainment complex is a oneman show.

title: Diagramless, 21 by 19
description: ACROSS

title: Sunday Observer
description: I go to the movies. Gary Cooper is in the next seat as usual, wearing his badge and Stetson. I am sick and tired of him. He grins and offers popcorn. What are we going to see tonight? he asks. The Sting, I say, and this time stay out of it, Coop.

title: Diehl, Battling to Stay on Tour, Leads Texas Golf by 4 Strokes
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Oct. 19 (AP)Terry Diehl, an obscure tour rookie fighting for his playing life, carded another sevenunderpar 65, set a season's recordlow score for 54 holes and swept into a fourstroke lead after today's third round of the $125,000 San AntonioTexas open golf tournament.

title: Choate Survives Hotchkiss Rally, 2120
description: LAKEVILLE, Conn., Oct. 19  Undefeated Choate scored its sixth straight victory today, 2120, but had to survive a fourthperiod scare from Hotchkiss to do it.

title: Music in Review
description: Gwyndolyn Mansfield, flutist; Joan Stein, pianist, and Maxine Neuman, cellist, are three fine musicians who formed the Walden Trio recently and as an ensemble made their New York debut last Sunday afternoon in Carnegie Recital Hall. They played to a packed auditorium, offering an unusually attractive program. A Haydn trio was followed by one by Bohuslav Martinu. Beethoven's Variations on a Theme from The Magic Flute for piano and cello led to the premiere of Joseph Turrin's Walden Trio. Hummel's Introduction and Theme and Variations on a Russian Folk Song completed the listing.

title: Haitian Gallery Comes to Atlantic Ave.
description: In an Atlantic Avenue brownstone whose facade has been covered with a vivid fourstoryhigh mural evocative of Haiti, a Brooklyn couple has opened a gallery devoted to the many styles of contemporary Haitian art.

title: Timbuktu Regains Charm After Horror
description: TIMBUKTU, Mali, Oct. 18 Timbuktu is the beautiful, changeless desert city of old once more, now that the drought is over and its victims have either left or died.

title: Betty Elder Sets Nuptials Dec. 28
description: The engagement of Betty Anne Elder, to Richard Bending Wilson, son of Mr. and Mrs. H. Clifton Wilson Jr, of Poughkeepsie, N.Y., has been announced by her father, Omar Franklin Elder Jr. of Greenwich, Conn. A Dec. 28 wedding is planned at the First Presbyterian Church in Greenwich.

title: Columbia Ties in Soccer
description: NEW HAVEN, Oct. 19Peter Spokes's second goal, with just five minutes left, gave Yale a 33 tie with Columbia in soccer today.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Brittany Named Best At Albany
description: ALBANY, Oct. 19  Ch. Ffynants Revelation, a Brittany spaniel with a Welsh name, romped off with the bestinshow honors for the fourth time today when he was selected at the 31st Albany Kennel Club fixture in. the Washington Street Armory.

title: Paula Bromberg Is Bride
description: The marriage of Paula C. Bromberg, daughter of Mrs. Helen Bromberg of Mount Vernon, N.Y., and the late Jacob Bromberg, to Dr. Irwin Weisbuch, a dermatologist on the staff of Beth Israel Hospital, took place here yesterday evening in the Fifth Avenue Synagogue. Rabbi Israel Miller performed the ceremony. The bride is an account executive with Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith.

title: What Night People Do In Suburban Suffolk
description: CORAM, L. I.Kathy Norton is a night person. Her personal clock does not start ticking until midnight.

title: Sydney Dunn Is Fiancee of Harry Reed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Stewart A. Dunn of Short Hills, N. J., and Point O'Woods, Fire Island, L. I., have announced the engagement of their daughter. Sydney. Louise. Dunn, to Harry Ferenbach Reed of Park City, Utah. He is the son of Dr. and Mrs. Howard L. Reed of Centerville, Delwand Point O'Woods.

title: Jewelry Making Is For Everyone
description: With a few pieces of metal and wire, and an assortment of basic hand toolspliers, hammers, soldering torch and visehobbyists in all parts of the country are creating uniquely artistic pieces of jewelry for personal use and for gift gluing.

title: A LowRise Planned For Coop In Coney I.
description: The city's first MitchellLama middleincome housing development with only twostory and threestory buildingsrather than the highrise towers that have come to symbolize the programis planned for construction in Coney Island.

title: Jean Buckley Married To Peter Jonathan Fritz
description: Jean Marie Buckley, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George Hollington Buckley of Old Westbury, L.I., and Peter Jonathan Fritz, son of Mr. and Mrs. Peter Fritz of Roslyn, L.I., and Lake Placid, N.Y., were married yesterday afternoon in the chapel of the Redeemer Lutheran Church in Flushing, Queens, by the pastor, the Rev. Robert F. Lindemann.

title: Kathleen Flynn Bride of James Nagle
description: Kathleen Mary Flynn, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. J. Gerard Flynn of Trumbull, Conn., and Pompano Beach Fla., was married yesterday afternoon to James William Nagle, son of Mr. and Mrs. John W. Nagle of Schenectady, N. Y.

title: Frankfurt's Fair a Window on East
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany By the hundreds West German students in blue jeans streamed to the Frankfurt book fair to learn about a country to which most of them have never beenEast Germany, the German Democratic Republic.

title: Mrs. Farenthold Honored
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N.Y., Oct. 19Frances Farenthold, the head of the National Women's Political Caucus, has been elected to an eightyear term on the Vassar College Board of Trustees. Mrs. Farenthold, a 1946 graduate of Vassar, was nominated by the college's alumnae organization last spring.

title: Amnesty Program Net to Date: 8% of Deserters, 1% of Evaders
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19 (UPI) One month after President Ford announced his amnesty program, only 8 per cent of the eligible deserters and 1 per cent of the draft evaders have shown up.

title: Clio and the Doctors
description: and other demographic records on every single person in the city.

title: WIZZARD OF BRITAIN ENDS FIRST U.S. TOUR
description: Roy Wood, allpurpose innovator of the British pop scene and founding member of both the Move and the Electric Light Orchestra, has a new band now called Wizzard. Early yesterday morning Wizzard concluded its first American tour with the second of two shows at the Academy of Music.

title: ARCHITECTURE VIEW
description: Prime downtown land attracts investment, and investment is concerned with the most foolproof way to make money, not with a city's quality or style. In the past, those who noted, the difference felt powerless against progress, which was given a kind of divine priority in the municipal scheme. But today people are surprisingly aware of the investment abuses in the hearts of their cities; they get out and picket and make feasibility studies and enlist publicity in the most resourceful fashion.

title: Wide Interest in Race For Grasso House Seat
description: BRISTOL, Conn,  In 1970, Thomas J. Meskill followed up two terms in Washington as the Representative of Connecticut's Sixth Congressional District with a victory as the state's first Republican Governor in 20 years.

title: Bail Commission Befriends the Friendless
description: EAST MEADOOWSheila Goldsmith, a student volunteer of the Long Island Bail Commission, looked across a table at the 18yearold youth awaiting trial in Nassau Jail here.

title: Gurney to Be Fingerprinted
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Oct. 19 (AP)Despite his argument that he is a prominent mane, with local roots, Senator Edward J. Gurney must be photographed and fingerprinted like any other defendant, United States District Judge Ben Krentzrnan said yesterday. He gave defendant Edward J. Gurney 15 days to comply. Mr. Gurney was indicted last July, on bribery, conspiracy and perjury charges.

title: Mountain Lakes Extends Streak to 21 Games, 346
description: Mountain Lakes extended New Jersey's longest winning streak to 21 games yesterday with a 346 romp over previously unbeaten Cedar Grove in Mountain Lakes.

title: Karpov and Korchnoi Take Draw in Game 13
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 19Anatoly Karpov and Viktor Korchnoi agreed this morning to a draw in their marathon 13th game of the final candidates match for the world chess championship after Korchnoi telephoned the draw offer to Karpov.

title: NEW BAIL PROGRAM RECEIVING PRAISE
description: We give defendants a second chanse, said Philip Leshin, director of the Bail Revaluation Program of the Department of Correction.

title: CHICAGO IS BEHIND ON MINORITY JOBS
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 19Chicago trails five other major American cities in minority hiring, according to a recent analysis by The Chicago Reporter, prizewinning monthly periodical on racial issues that is published by the Community Renewal Society, a churchfunded organization.

title: Of Aristotle, Atoms and a Retiring Sage
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Oct. 19 One Nobel laureate proposed that it may be possible to create a new form of matter that if one gives free rein to speculation, could be an unprecedented source of energy.

title: Democrats Seem Certain of 2 Court of Appeals Seats
description: Two weeks before the election, only one thing appears certain about the Court of Appeals racea Democrat will be elected to the state's highest court for the first time since 1967, when Judge Matthew Jasen ran with bipartisan support.

title: BRIDGE
description: Declarers at the bridgetable, like British prime ministers, often have to struggle along with the most slender of majorities. Both groups are liable to find that the problems they face are so complex and burdensome that they are relieved to move on to a new deal, or a new parliament.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Thomas J. Cuite, majority leader of the City Council, announced yesterday that the Beame administration had reversed its position and would permit the Gowanus Canal dredging project, in the works for 20 years, to go forward. Mr. Cuite said that the necessary certificate would be issued tomorrow by Budget Director Melvin N. Lechner and that work would begin immediately.

title: Sarah Ellen Hooper Married To Edward Schackford Mundy
description: Sarah Ellen Hooper and Edward Shackford Mundy were married yesterday afternoon in the Chapel of the Beloved Disciple of the Episcopal Church of the Heavenly Rest by the Rev. Dr. J. Burton Thomas.

title: The Turn in the Markets: Will It Last?
description: Last Monday, just before noon, two security analysts were walking along Wall Street. You're always skeptical at a turn, one analyst was overheard to muse. Enjoy it while it lasts, his companion advised.

title: Dr. Inselman Sets Nuptials
description: Mr. and Mrs. Alexander M. Inselman of Brooklyn have announced the engagement of their daughter, Dr. Laura Sue Inselman, to Lawrence Martin Krackov, son of Mr. and Mrs. Nathan Krackov of West Orange, N.J.

title: Plentiful Soccer Talent Makes. Coaches Choosy
description: To play collegiate soccer in the past, all a player had to do was kick the ball high and long. If he could kick accurately, he would be the star.

title: October Parade With Barbara Roan Is Done at Cubiculo
description: The fourth annual October Parade, Barbara Roan's, of course, marched into the Cubiculo Friday evening with a blare of trumpets, the clatter of empty, CocaCola tins and the bizarre cast of characters that will probably keep it off Fifth Avenue forever.

title: OFFICER DISMISSED IN A GRAFT CASE
description: Detective John F. McClean, member of the Police Department's special narcotics investigating unit for nearly 16 years, was dismissed from the force yesterday for giving $1,000 in graft money to Capt. Daniel Tange, a former head of the unit.

title: Cold Weather and Small Crowd at Pocono Take Zip Out of World Series of Racing
description: LONG POND, Pa., Oct. 19 With an oompahpah, German beer from Philadelphia and an empty Ferris wheel, the first World Series of Auto Racing got under way today at cold and deserted Pocono International Speedway.

title: CONGRESS REPORT ASKS TV COVERAGE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19The Senate, which last allowed still camera into its chamber in 1971, and the House, which permits news cameras only when the President or a dignitary makes a speech there, have been asked to experiment next year with live television and radio coverage of their floor debates.

title: Britain's Prime Minister Makes Ministry Changes
description: LONDON, Oct. 19 (UPI)Prime Minister Harold Wilson reshuffled 14 junior members in his Labor Government yesterday, the first change since his general election victory Oct. 10. But all key Cabinet posts remained unchanged.

title: Plight of the Fired Executive
description: HIGHLAND PARK, Ill.He's 41 years old and earning $37,000 a year, but suddenly he's fired.

title: Boston's Politicians Play A Large Role in the Chaos
description: BOSTONThe opponents of the Federal courtordered, statedrawn plan, enforced by city officials, to desegregate the independentlyrun public schools here by busing, hold their meetings in the City Council chambers, encouraged now by words of the President of the United States.

title: The Fight for the Integrated Orchestra
description: The Symphony of the New World has had a shaky time of it during its pathbreaking history, but it begins its 10th season of concerts this afternoon in Avery Fisher Hall with a larger schedule than usual and general optimism about its future. What has made the orchestra special, even unique, is the complete integration of its personnel. Among fully professional ensembles, it is the only one that has tried to give as large a place as possible to minority musiciansblacks, Puerto Ricans, Orientals. Today, 40 per cent of its 85 to 95 players are from these groups.

title: Skiers Give The Value Of Catskills Land a Lift
description: By the late nineteenfifties, the village of Hunter, about 20 miles northwest of Kingston, was on its way to becoming a ghost town.

title: Delaware Overtakes Lehigh, 147
description: BETHLEHEM, Pa., Oct. 19  Undefeated Delaware moved 36 yards for a touchdown early in the third quarter today to defeat a stubborn Lehigh team, 147. Nate Beasley scored the decisive touchdown on a 21yard run through center.

title: Dispute Over Queens Theater
description: The controversy over the future of the Queens Playhouse, Inc., entered a new phase last week when the group was threatened with eviction from its quarters in Flushing Meadow  Corona Park.

title: Jersey Plans Work, Put at $2.7Million, On Central Railroad
description: The New Jersey Department of Transportation has announced a $2.7million track and roadbed improvement program along 40 miles of the main line of the Central Railroad of New Jersey.

title: All God's Dangers
description: I was big enough to stretch my eyes at conditions and abominate what I seed

title: CAMERA VIEW
description: Anyone who takes a trip without a camera these days is definitely in the minority, yet this universal occupation which costs us time and money usually involves more innocent hope than preparation. If you are planning a tripwithcamera, think for a minute about what you really hope to bring back. It's not quite as elementary as taking socks so the shoes won't hurt.

title: Legislative Notes
description: TRENTONThe rambling and repetitive character of many of the Legislature's floor debates often generates occasional demands for new ground rules. The latest demandit comes from Assemblyman Carl A. Orechio, Republican of Essx, calls for time limits on individual remarks and on specific issues.At present, debate over a minor bill can go on for hours, ultimately leaving major measures untouched.

title: The Umpire Is Always Right, Except When He Is Proved Wrong
description: Joe Klein is the manager of a Texas Ranger farm team. A few weeks ago he asked, rhetorically as well as philosophically:

title: HorseBreeding Farms Grow at a Gallop
description: ESTELL MANOR  The breeding and raising of thoroughbred horses is a growing business in New Jersey, and more than 700 foals are expected to be born this year alone.

title: The Summary
description: Autumn's fruits are everywhere, even as the brilliance of the leaves begins to fade and fall. The bitter redoak acorns, still green and needing a second year to ripen, hang among the leathery maroon leaves. Bright scarlet bunchberries gleam among the scuffling golden leaves on the woodland floor. In the fencerow the inkdark pokeweed berries dangle on their ruddy stems, food for birds but not for man.

title: PariAm Grnes to Mexico
description: VIENNA, Oct. 19 (AP)Cables flew fast across the Atlantic today as the executive board of the PanAmerican Games Organization approved Mexico City as the site of the 1975 PanAmerican Games.

title: 6 Are Slain in Holdup at a Bakery in Connecticut
description: Six persons were shot to death last night by shotgunwielding robbers in a neighborhood bakery and pizza shop in New Britain, Conn.

title: CHINA PLAYS HOST TO U.S. IMPORTERS
description: TOKYO, Oct. 19China said last week that the United States was using foreign trade to control and plunder other countries. At the same time the Chinese were quietly trying to expand their trade with the United States through a threeman American business delegation in Peking.

title: B.Y.U. Triumphant, 4521
description: PROVO, Utah, Oct. 19 (UPI)  Gary Sheide threw for five first half touchdowns and 388 yards in the game, leading Brigham Young to a 4521 Western Athletic Conference victory over TexasEl Paso today.

title: Frank L. Stanley, 69, Is Dead; Louisville Defender Publisher
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Oct. 19 (AP)Frank L. Stanley, civilrights leader and owner and publisher of The Louisville Defender, a weekly newspaper, died early today at Jewish Hospital, apparently of a heart attack. He was 69 years old.

title: LABOR VOTE FUND OVER $7 MILLION
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19On ganized labor is spending red ord amounts of money thi?? year to help Congressional can didates, mostly Democrats, ge elected.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: West PointPepperell, Inc., a textile manufacturer, has leased the 45th, 46th and 47th floors of the McGrawHill Building on the Avenue of the Americas at 48th Street. The 25year lease, for 122,000 square feet, has an aggregate rental in excess of $40million.

title: Challenger Faces a 5Term Incumbent
description: PORT WASHINGTONWhen Edythe Layne was named by the Nassau County Republican party as its candidate in the Sixth Congressional District, some political observers called her an attractive sacrificial lamb.

title: Ford Swimming Pool Runs Into Inflation
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19 (AP)The Ford Administration's antiinflation campaign has sidetracked plans to build a new swimming pool at the White House with private contributions.

title: 3dGeneration Champion Is Best in Ramapo Show
description: The Ramapo Kennel Club has made a welcomed change, moving from the small, antiquated Paterson Armory to Mullers Park, in Oakland, N. J. Even nature contributed toward making the shift a success last Sunday. Rain that had been predicted never fell and the trees rimming the spacious grounds were in brilliant autumn foliage.

title: Trade Breakthrough
description: The extraordinary threeway tradeemigration agreement which the Ford Administration hag worked out with Congress and the Soviet Union has importance far beyond the core deal of an exchange of American trade concessions for free emigration of 60,000 or more Soviet Jews annually.

title: Pigeon Racers Swap Bird Stories
description: The impudent city pigeon with its incessant cooing and messy roosting is a solace of irritation to some people but there is another type of pigeon that is quite popular among certain people in Brooklyn and Queens. This is the homing pigeon, whose speed, endurance and uncanny skill in navigation, attract pigeon fanciers around the world.

title: To Beat Soaring Costs, Car Owners Turn to Prepaid Repair Plans
description: The soaring cost of car repairs has turned thousands of motorists to a new kind of insurancethe prepaid maintenance plan, covering charges for some automobile mechanical ailments the same way that prepaid medical plans cover doctor and hospital bills.

title: A gallery of bright women and pale men
description: As a novelist whose books tend to pivot on classic feminist issues, Gail Godwin will undoubtedly be shelved as yet another women's writer. But this would be a gross injustice. Godwin's appeal goes far beyond feminism, and the basis for this is her talent. Godwin is art extraordinarily good writer. Her new book, The Odd Woman, could be compared, in sensitivity and brilliance, to the best of Doris Lessing and Margaret Drabble (two writers who have vociferously rejected the feminist categorization of their work).

title: House Unit Sees World Famine; Asks Food and Population Action
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19 (AP) Mass starvation will occur throughout the world if food production is not intensified and population patterns are not changed, a House subcommittee said in a report released today.

title: Three fictions
description: New fictional conventions, like new clichs, are scabrous things, neither brittle with experiment nor comfortably worn by use. Like seconds in the Guinness Book of World Records, their users often validate the original achievement rather than themselves; the reader's attention turns to the worthy record holder. To get away with this fresh derivativeness, the writer must be very good, a dexterous fence. Failing, he makes the form safe for parody; succeeding, he gets the compliments offered the horseshoe thrower who wins without a ringer.

title: SOVIET GRAIN DEAL OF SMALLER SIZE APPROVED BY U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19The United States announced today that the Soviet Union would be permitted to buy 2.2 million metric tons of American grain through next June 30. The action came two weeks aften a larger grain deal was canceled at President Ford's request.

title: Best Seller List
description: Fiction

title: Welk did it his way
description: Lawrence Welk has a claim on the attention for two reasons. The first is attended with the public interest. The second, as Scott Fitzgerald put it, is only personal. As to the first, he has never had any doubts about what will play in Peoria whether Peoria is taken as a city of 125,000 in the center of Illinois or as a state of mind anywhere within the national boundaries. Just recently he has had to prove this all over again to those who acquire shrewdness concerning the state of the Union by reading the polls. In 1971, after 16 years on a national network every Saturday night he was, as he says, fired by A.B.C.

title: sly comedy of Victorian attitudes couched the story of a siege in the Raj's India.
description: Fiction

title: Criminals At Large
description: It's always relaxing to read one of H.R.F. Keating's Inspector Ghote stories, and so it is with BATS FLY UP FOR INSPECTOR GHOTE (Doubleday, $4.95). Ghote, as any reader of mystery fiction knows, is the little, introspective police officer in Bombay who is eternally assailed by selfdoubt. As Keating tells his exploits, it is all but a comedy of manners. Indian life in general is introduced; characters are fixed with shrewd touches; little elements of plot that seemingly are unrelated suddenly assume significance.

title: A lowlevel memoir of the Nixon White House
description: A few weeks after I joined Charles Colson's staff at the White House, right after my Yale graduation in 1971, Dwight Chapin called me up. He had heard about the memos I had written to President Nixon and Mr. Haldeman during my senior year at college and had been impressed by a piece of mine in The Wall Street Journal on campus unrest that Mr. Nixon had praised at a press conference; he wanted to get together with me. Several days later, I met. with Dwight in his office, a spotless, nopapersonthedesk, lime green Williamsburg room on the first floor of the White House West Wing. He struck me as polite, softspoken, wellmeaning and not very broadgauged. He asked what issues I thought would be important in the 1972 election year.

title: Trouble Comes Slowly in a Rural Bank
description: HUDSON, N. Y.Yes, there is mortgage money available in many small upstate cities and towns.

title: WESTCHESTER UNIT ON BURNS SEATED
description: WHITE PLAINS, Oct, 19Westchester County has decided to establish a burn unit, a facility for handling serious burn cases, at the County Medical Center in Valhalla.

title: F.T.C. Rejects a Proposal To Label Light Packages
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19 (UPI) The Federal Trade Commission has scrapped a proposal designed to stop the grocery industry from putting less food in packages and selling them for the same price.

title: In an OffYear, The Turnout Will Probably Be 'Way Off
description: Who will vote when Americans go to the polls two weeks from now in their first opportunity to react to the Watergate scandals and inflation? A recent survey predicts the turnout will be a lower percentage of the votingage population than in any offyear election since 1946. And, on the basis of past performance and uneven registration, the outcome will disproportionately reflect the views of whites and the middleaged.

title: College to Display StainedGlass Items
description: PEMBERTONAn unusual collection of stainedglass items executed by the late Nicola D'Ascenzo will be on display at Burlington County College from Nov. 4 through Dec. 31.

title: Early Learning
description: As reviewers we shy away from the massproduced, supermarketdistributed stiffboard books with pushpull tabs which pop up cartoon characters, telltime books with movable clock hands or Icanzipmyfly volumes under the guise of earlychildhood education. Most are of momentary fascination, of dubious value and disappointing durability. But you have to be careful; you never know when you're fonding another Pat the Bunny.

title: Singing With Your Supper
description: HACKENSACK  During the five years that Anthony May was managing director of the Rainbow Room and Rainbow Grill atop the RCA Building in New York, he often gazed north and west toward the Ramapo hills of New Jersey. Somewhere out there, he was convinced, he would eventually have his own restaurant.

title: Nets Lose By 111103 To Nuggets
description: DENVER, Oct. 19 (AP)Mike Green scored 23 points, pulled down 16 rebounds, blocked two shots and made three steals tonight to lead the Denver Nuggets to a 111103 American Basketball Association victory over the New York Nets.

title: American Prelate Elected To Council of World Synod
description: ROME, Oct. 19 (Reuters)Delegates to the world synod of Roman Catholic bishops today elected an American Archbishop in voting for a new permanent council to hold office until the next synod three years from now.

title: TORIES HUDDLING OVER LEADERSHIP
description: LONDON, Oct. 19The secret meetings have begun and the Conservative party is well into struggle over whether to pick a new leader.

title: Trailer City: All We Have to Sell Is New York
description: MOST tent and trailer campgrounds, set among scenic brooks and rolling green hills, are designed to attract vacationers. New Yorker Trailer City seems not to have been designed at all. Plop on the cluttered edge of a truck route in New Jersey, surrounded by gas stations, warehouses and railroad tracks, Trailer City has no clear swimming pools or coddled tennis courts; its chief bonuses are three outdoor phone booths, an icecube machine and a bathhouse that was once a trucking terminal.

title: POLICE WILL TRY 2 IN BRIBERY CASE
description: Bribery charges against two city policemen were dismissed in State Supreme Court last week for lack of corroborating evidence.

title: Amy Slade Wed to Philip Wheaton
description: Amy Bowles Slade, assistant director of the children's unit at the Connecticut Valley Hospital in Middletown, was married yesterday morning to Philip Damon Wheaton, president of Middlesex Community College in Middletown.

title: POLAND PLANNING WARSAW SUBWAY
description: WARSAW, Oct. 17After a half century of false starts, Polish leaders have decided that prospects for peace and prosperity finally warrant building a subway in Warsaw.

title: AROUND THE Garden
description: 1 Unless there is more rainfall, watering will be essential for new evergreens, shrubs and young trees

title: Mountain Lakes Marks 50th Year of Controlled Growth
description: MOUNTAIN LAKESThis borough, one of the most affluent in Morris County, is observing its 50th anniversary. Residents are honoring not only the pioneer settlers, who carved the community out of a swampy wilderness, but also those town fathers who warded off chaotic development by controlling growth.

title: Social Announcements
description: Births

title: Illinois, Mich. State Tie, 2121, on Grange Day
description: CHAMPAIGN, Ill., Oct. 19 (AP)  Charlie Baggett smashed for two touchdowns and passed for a third in a 21point Michigan State second quarter to lead the Spartans to a 2121 Big Ten football tie with Illinois today on Red Grange Day.

title: Protesters Opposing Bus Garage In Queens
description: Negotiations ate to continue this week between angry Queens Village residents and half a dozen city agencies over bus traffic to and from a Transit Authority garage that opened Sept. 8.

title: POORLAND CITIES TOO BIG, U.N. SAYS
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 19  Cities in the world's poor countries are growing faster than the local economies can afford, and belts of shantytowns around them are broadening even more quickly, a United Nations report says.

title: PAPUA NEW GUINEA FACING PROBLEMS
description: PORT MORESBY, Papua New GuineaThe road to full independence from Australia has become a tortuous obstacle course for Papua New Guinea, which became a selfgoverning territory last year. Plans to make Dec. 1 independence day have been abandoned and no new date has been set.

title: New & Novel
description: Days When The House Was Too Small

title: MISS VON BARTESH GIVES PIANO RECITAL
description: Seta Karakashian von Bartash can produce a lovely, singing tone at the keyboard, but for the first half of her program yesterday afternoon, she most often chose not to.

title: News Summary and Index
Marist Trounces Manhattan, 3314
description: Nigel Davis led Marist College to a 3314 victory over Manhattan yesterday at Gaelic Park in the Bronx.

title: Bishops Use Latin Less At a Synod
description: ROME, Oct. 19When the Roman Catholic Synod of Bishops opened last month, prelates felt compelled to struggle with the rigorous conjugations and unforgiving declensions of Latin.

title: Penn Beats Lafayette In 377 Rout
description: EASTON, Pa., Oct. 19Pennsylvania's quarterback, Marty Vaughn, passed for four touchdowns, a school record, as his team rolled over Lafayette College today, 377.

title: LABORERS FLEEING FARMS IN ANGOLA
description: CARMONA, Angola  When Armando Ossi quit his job as a coffee plantation laborer he knew that his year's contract had not been completed and that he would not have the money to buy the calves, chickens, pigs and tools he wanted for his own farm.

title: F. & M. Crushes Dickinson, 5413
description: LANCASTER, Pa., Oct. 19 Franklin and Marshall exploded for 26 points in the second quarter and went on to rout Dickinson, 5413, in a Middle Atlantic Conference game today.

title: California Bus Strike Ends
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 19 (AP) California's longest transit strike ended today as the 1,800vehicle Southern California Rapid Transit District resumed business. Some 685,000 comtnuters in four Los Angelesarea counties were without bus service during the 10week strike by drivers and mechanics.

title: Papuan Chewers of Betel Nut Warned of Cancer
description: PORT MORESBY, Papua New GuineaEach morning in the market place at Koki, a nearby village of huts on stilts beside the sea, tattooed Papuan women lay out a selection of wares, including smoked wallaby, dried fish and a root called tarom.

title: Fire Island Becomes a Living Classroom
description: SAILORS HAVEN, Fire IslandIt was fall, but the beach was teeming. Out where the waves broke, a group of youngsters hauled in a bucket of water so they could take the ocean's temperature. Just below the dunes, children using portable microscopes and checking books were identifying and cataloging species of shells and beach grass.

title: Experience Shows It Is Hard to Predict
description: The character of any country's judges is one test of its civilization. In a country as saturated in law as the United States, the choice of who is to sit on the bench assumes particular importanceand is bound to arouse contention from time to time, as it is doing in the Senate on the nomination of Gov. Thomas J. Meskill of Connecticut to the Federal Court ofAppeals.

title: Robin Rost Takes Medal Class Final
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Oct. 19 Robin Ann Rost, a 16yearold high school student from tional final of the Medal Class competition tonight at the Pennsylvania National Horse Show.

title: Hofstra Ties Fordham on Late Rally
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Oct. 19Bob Girolamo passed to Tom Calder for an 11yard touchdown and then threw for a twopoint conversion with only 2 minutes 16 seconds left in the game today to give Hofstra University a 2121 tie with Fordham.

title: Ridgewood Aiding Disabled Shoppers
description: RIDGEWOODThis statusproud Bergen County community now has what is said to be the first barrierfree business district in the state, and perhaps in the entire country. The innovations were officially unveiled to the town's residents yesterday during the course of a walking tour.

title: MRS. JAMES S. BROWN
description: Mrs. Margaret O'Brien Brown, wife of James S. Brown, a retired justice of the State Supreme Court, died yesterday in Brooklyn Hospital. She was 74 years old and lived at 579 Fourth Street, Brooklyn.

title: Cut Glass, $63.60, Takes Coast Race
Printers Ratify Contract At The Long Island Press
description: Members of Typographical Union No. 6 ratified a new twoyear contract agreement with The Long Island Press by a vote of 175 to 6 yesterday.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: FLEMINGTON, Oct. 20  The New Jersey swimming scene, which already has its queen in a national champion, Cathy Heddy of Summit, may soon be crowning a king in Mike Doyle, the youngest of three swimming brothers from this rural Hunterdon County community.

title: British Soldiers in Belfast Clash With Demonstrators
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Oct. 20 (AP)  Hundreds of demonstrators clashed with British troops on the outskirts of Belfast today in a protest over internment of guerrilla suspects without trial.

title: Energy: Choices ...
description: On the crest of increasingly familiarand agonizingdoomsday forecasts for the industrial world, the Ford Foundation has come along with an ambitious energy study which seenis to reach some strangely soothing conclusions.

title: Prayers Answered For Manager Dark
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Oct. 20 (AP)Manager Alvin Dark went home and prayed with his family, then met with the Oakland A's owner, Charles O. Finley, and told him, I want the job.

title: Supplementary OverCounter Listings
description: The following is a supplementary weekly list of mutual funds prepared by the National Association of Securities Dealers. The range shown reflects prices at which securities could have been sold (bid) or bought (asked) last Friday.

title: Sermons Urge Defeat of State CasinoGambling Plan
description: TRENTON, Oct. 20 (AP)The Rev. Kept Kiser asked his congregation today what business the state of New Jersey would have in operating gambling casinos and told them the answer was no business at all.

title: State G.O.P. Points To City With Alarm
description: Attempting to drum up votes for Governor Wilson and his running mates, the Republican state organization is, in effect, running against New York City in its lesspublicized local campaigns and literature. In Suffolk County, for example, Republican committeemen are distributing literature warning that if Governor Wilson is not elected, the City of New York will then be running the entire state of New York.

title: JAWORSKI THINKS TRIAL WILL SHOW NIXON'S FULL ROLE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct, 20 Leon Jaworski said today he. believed that the full story of Richard M. Nixon's role in the Watergate affair would emerge during the current trial of Mr, Nixon's former top assistants.

title: New Yorkers, Like Parisians, Become a More OutGoing People on Sundays
description: PARIS Juliette Greco sang I Hate Sundays, Charles Aznavour's prizewinning lyr, ics to a tune still popular here after two decades.

title: G. O. P. Seen Losing Ethnic Votes
description: HOMESTEAD, Pa.In 19772, the Committee to Reelect the President spawned a variety of heritage groups whose task was to firing a more narrow focus to the Republicans' campaign.

title: ... and Decisions
description: The Congress has successfully led the White House into reorganization of the energy research and development effort, creating a new, broadly based Federal agency to replace the anachronistic Atomic Energy Commission. The legislation now signed into law has the potential of breaking open the stranglehold which nuclear power interests have maintained over Federal spending in the energy field.

title: 2 HOLD 15 IN HOTEL 2 HOURS, RAPE ONE
description: Two gunmen early yesterday held 10 men and five women prisoners for more than two hours in the Chelsea Hotel, robbed all 15 and raped one of the women before freeing them and dashing off.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: WASHINGTONThe first exhibition in the new Gallery of the Archives of American Art, situated on the first floor of the Smithsonian Institution's National Portrait Gallery, will open Nov. 8 and will remain on view for nearly a year, according to the Smithsonian.

title: Monterrey Group: A Family of Wealth and Symbol of Economic Independence
description: MONTERREY, MexicoMention Monterrey and the Monterrey Group comes to mind; mention the Monterrey Group and a tightly knit family of wealthy and conservative businessmen comes to mind.

title: The Papers and the Public
description: BOSTON, Oct. 20  A notable element in President Ford's House testimony was the colder view he took of Richard Nixon. He played down the element of sympathy in the pardon decision. He said Mr. Nixon had left office in shame and disgrace, and had as good as admitted his guilt in taking the pardon.

title: Diehl, a Rookie, Takes Texas Open by One Shot
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Oct. 20 (AP)Terry Diehl, a hardluck rookie fighting to stay on the tour, lost a fourshot lead and then rallied for a onestroke victory over Mike Hill in the San AntonioTexas open golf tournament today.

title: Personal Finance: Check Costs
description: A few days ago, I received notice from the Chase Manhattan Bank that, effective November, they are changing to the minimumbalance method. As I read the notice I became quite angry, for a minimumbalance method will place me squarely in the category of those subject to monthly charges.

title: DRUG RING AGENTS SOUGHT ABROAD
description: TIJUANA, Mexico, Oct. 20A search spread from Mexico to South America and across California and into Canada today for the agents and top conspirators of a Mexican Mafia narcotics ring found operating inside Tijuana's notorious La Mesa Prison.

title: JAWORSKI THINKS TRIAL WILL SNOW NIXON'S FULL ROLE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20 Leon Jaworski said today he believed that the full story of Richard M. Nixon's role in the Watergate affair would emerge during the current trial of Mr. Nixon's former top assistants.

title: Busing Is a Step in Boston Ordeal
description: BOSTON, Oct. 20For this city's black community, the controversy over courtordered busing for a school integration plan is but one more step after years of struggle for better schooling.

title: VANDALISM STUNS ENGLEWOOD FLOCK
description: ENGLEWOOD, Oct 20Mayor Walter S. Taylor, pastor of Galilee United Methodist Church, urged his stunned and disbelieving congregation today not to fall into the trap of wishing ill to the vandal or vandals who burned and desecrated their church before dawn Saturday.

title: Helpful Neighbor's Slaying Recalled
description: The stocky muscular man choked and fought back tears yesterday as he described how his friend and neighbor, Rudolph Ferrezza, was shot and killed while responding to his calls for help as he was being robbed.

title: US. AIDE ARRIVES IN EAST GERMANY
description: BERLIN, Oct. 20The United States sent its first diplomatic representative to East Germany today to open the new American embassy in East Berlin, more than 25 years after the Communist state was founded.

title: Israel Girding to Handle Bigger Soviet Emigration
description: JERUSALEM, Oct. 20 (AP)Israel began today to make arrangements to cope with a possible new flood of immigrants following a Soviet pledge to the United States to allow more emigration. It is perhaps the most wonderful thing that we have heard in the past year, declared President Ephraim Katzir.

title: Ford Meeting Echeverria At Mexican Border Today
description: MEXICO CITY, Oct. 20Mexico's President, Luis Echeverria Alvarez, will give top priority to seeking a solution to the problem of illegal Mexican migrants in the United States when he meets President Ford at the Arizona border tomorrow, according to authoritative sources here.

title: Israeli President in Crash
description: JERUSALEM, Oct. 20 (Reuters)President Ephraim Katzir and his wife were slightly injured in a threecar accident tonight in which a man was killed, the President's office announced. The President's car and an army car collided on threelane highway just outside Tel Aviv, his office said.

title: C.U.N.Y. SUPPORTS PLEA BY FORDHAM
description: The City University joined yesterday with Fordham University's appeal for a speedy sale of Federal land for a major shopping mall next to the Jesuit institution's campus at Rose Hill in the Bronx.

title: Q's Defeat Nets' Five By 116110
description: SAN DIEGO, Oct. 20 (UPI) Travis Grant pumped in 44 points and Caldwell Jones added 22 with his 26 rebounds to spark the San Diego Conquistadors to a 116110 victory over the NeW York Nets in the American Basketball Association tonight.

title: Village Smithy, 22, Wins Contest
description: SOMERVILLE, Oct. 20 The oncefamiliar clang of the smithy's hammer echoed again in Somerset County yesterday as 25 of the state's top farriers competed in their third annual horseshoeforging contest.

title: MINORITY SETBACK IN EDUCATION SEEN
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 20  During the last decade, doors that were traditionally closed to minorities in the nation's institutions of higher learning began to open, and growing numbers of black, brown, red and yellow faces were seen on campus.

title: Issue and Debate
description: As the nation approaches the eve of a possible strike by its coal miners, concern is mounting within the steel and electricenergy communities over the disposition of existing stockpiles.

title: New Books
description: FICTION

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: As Europeans, we would like to respond to your Oct. 7 editorial in which you depict the crisis Western civilization is facing in the light of the oildelivery problem. You describe rather skillfully what a mess there is in Western Europe and say that the consequences for Western civilization may be dire unless the U.S. takes the lead, in this oil crisis.

title: Gaullist Decline
description: The electoral tidal wave that swept over France with President Charles de Gaulle and his successor, Georges Pompidou, has begun to recede rapidly with their deaths. That is the clear message of the six National Assembly byelections that were recently held in Gaullist strongholds where two former members of Mr. Pompidou's cabinet were defeated and four others were elected with muchreduced votes.

title: KISSINGER MAY SET STAGE FOR SUMMIT
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20 (UPI)Secretary of State Kissinger is expected to set the stage for a meeting late in November by President Ford and Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Communist party chief, when the Secretary visits Moscow this week, Administration of& cials said today.

title: Saxbe Backs F.B.I. Deletions in Hiss Case Files Sent to Scholar
description: Attorney General William B Saxbe was described yesterday as having reversed the spirit, if not the letter of a 15monthold policy l:y his predecessor Elliot L. Richardson, that had authorized scholarly access to investigatory files more than 15 years old, such as in the Alger Hiss case.

title: C.I.A. Said to Have Asked Funds for Chile Rightists in '75
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20The Central Intelligence Agency sought to finance an extreme rightwing opposition group in Chile six weeks before the overthrow of President Salvadore Allende Gossens in September, 1973, highly reliable sources said today.

title: Miss Budweiser Wins Final Race
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Oct. 20 (AP)Dean Chenoweth brought the unlimited hydroplane season to a close today by piloting Miss Budweiser to a narrow victory over the Pride of Pay 'n Pak in the Admiral's Cup race.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 35

title: Weather Reports and Forecast
Lucrative Polish Trade Is Luring U.S. Businessmen
description: WARSAW, Oct. 17With relations between Washington and Warsaw warmer than ever before, the United States Chamber of Commerce is teaching American businessmen here to scramble for Pokand's increasingly lucrative trade.

title: Mitchell Snaps Record With 40 Carries
description: The same people who brought you the travesty at. Shea Stadium last week produced, in some ways, an even worse travesty yesterday as the Jets withered before the Baltimore Colts, 3520, in the National Football League's Game of the Weak.

title: President Rejects Advice That He Drop Rockefeller
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20 President Ford indicated last night that some conservative Republicans had urged him to abandon Vice Presidentdesignate Nelson A. Rockefeller, but he said he did not take the advice seriously.

title: TOCKS DAM PUTS DAMPER ON FETE
description: DELAWARE WATER GAP, Pa., Oct. 20  The applejack flowed freely here today as this community sponsored its annual Oktoberfest, celebrating the plenitude of the harvest and commemorating the courtage of the settlers who colonized this region over two centuries ago.

title: Sculpture Reproduction, a Rising Battle
description: The controversy over the problematical fate suffered by the works of some of the major modern sculptors after their deaths now looms as a subject of intense concern among art scholars and specialists. Historians of modern sculpture, museum curators and art dealers are attempting to determine what, exactly, constitutes artistic authenticity in a period when unauthorized editions of bronze casts and other posthumous distortions of the artists' work amount to a small but highly profitable and completely unregulated industry.

title: FASHION TALK
description: Zandra Rhodes his tinted her hair green again. Last year, it was in more conventional pink to orange tones.

title: Redskins Block Punt, Steal 5 Passes
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 2OThe Washington Redskin band serenaded Sonny Jurgensen for the things he did today, and no musical tribute could have been more appropriate for a 243 Redskin victory over the New York Giants.

title: MOREAU D. BROWN
description: Moreau D. Brown, resident partner in Philadelphia of Brown Brothers Harriman & Co., private bankers, died Saturday at his home in Haverford, Pa. He was 69 years old.

title: Miss Palmer Wins. By Shot on Coast
description: SAN DIEGO Oct. 20 (AP)Sandra Palmer came from two strokes back on the final two holes to defeat Kathy McMullen and win the $35,000 Ladies Professional Golf Association Classic at Stardust Country Club today. Miss Palmer finished with a 71 for a 215 total, one shot ahead of Miss McMullen.

title: I.O.C. to Confront Amateurism Rules
description: VIENNA, Oct. 20  Bewailed by the diehards, the word amateur will be scrubbed from the Olympic lexicon as the 75th session of the International Olympi?? Committee opens tomorrow with the avowed intention of eradicating hypocrisy.

title: Shipping/Mails All Hours Given in Eastern Daylight Time
description: Today, Oct. 21

title: Major Bills in Congress
Smith Gets Islanders' 1st Shutout
description: LANDOVER, Md., Oct. 20 Reminded of their humble origin just two seasons ago, the New York Islanders posted the first shutout in their history tonight, defeating the Washington Capitals, an expansion club, 50, before 7,581 remarkably quiet fans.

title: H. S. Kreps Marries Susan Bette Dorfman
description: Susan Bette Dorfman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Martin S. Dorfman of Teaneck, N. J., was married here yesterday at noon, to Harry Steven Kreps, son of Mr. and Mrs. Myron Kreps, also of Teaneck. The ceremony at the St. Regis was performed by Rabbi Asher Reichel.

title: PENTAGON MEALS A$1MILLION ITEM
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20 The Defense Department, which is suggesting a reduction in the dining fare of enlisted personnel because of inflation, is spending $1million a year to feed topranking officers and officials in five private dining rooms in the Pentagon.

title: Jersey Roulette
description: United States Attorney Jonathan L. Goldstein has issued a sober warning to citizens of New Jersey who are being asked to vote next month on a constitutional amendment that would make their state the only one in the nation, except for Nevada, to authorize casino gambling.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE LAST DAYS OF LOUISIANA RED. By Ishmael Reed. 179 pages. Random House. $5.95.

title: Norton Simon, Inc., Increases Earnings and Sales in Quarter
description: Norton Simon, Inc., began its 1974 fiscal year with a rebound in earnings and sales, setting records for the first fiscal quarter, ended Sept. 30, the company reported yesterday.

title: Canucks Defeat Rangers
description: The New York Rangers improved their defense immensely last night. After giving up 17 goals in the first four games, they allowed the Vancouver Canucks just one in their first meeting of the season at Madison Square Garden. Now the bad news: the Rangers got none and lost 10.

title: C.V. MESEROLE JR., 56, INSURANCE OFFICIAL
description: Clinton V. Meserole Jr., a consultant to the insurance industry and former chairman of Pacific Insurance Company, died yesterday of cancer at his home, 70 Lydecker Street, Englewood, N. J. He was 56 years old.

title: Julien Bryan, Film Maker, Dies; Honored for His Documentaries
description: Julien H. Bryan, who made documentary films all over the world and until 10 years ago lectured at their showings in Town Hall and Carnegie Hall, died yesterday in Lawrence Hospital, Bronxville, N. Y. He was 75 years old and lived at 200 Boulder Trail in Bronxville.

title: Group Seeks to Void Pact Giving Recordings to Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20 (UPI) A group of journalists, historians and political scientists said today it would file suit in Federal District Court tomorrow seeking to void the agreement giving former President Richard M. Nixon ownership of White House tapes and documents involving his Administration.

title: President and Congress
description: Imbalance of power between the executive and legislative branches of the Federal Government has been subject of increasing concern through the years Vietnam and Watergate.

title: U.S. to Begin Talks With Spain on Use Of Military Bases
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20The United States and Spain will begin formal negotiations in Madrid on Nov. 4 on renewal of the agreement allowing American military forces to use Spanish bases.

title: MovieTV Industry Is a Top Customer Of Brooklyn Cabbie
description: In six clays, Louis Reznick's Checker cab earned him $690, even though he never once threw the flag on his meter.

title: Cheryl Rappaport, Teacher, Bride
description: The marriage of Cheryl Rappaport, a reading specialist with the Yonkers schools, to Mark J. Liebling, who is in his final year at the Albert Einstein College of Medicine, took place yesterday at Borers in Tarrytown, N. Y. Rabbi Maurfice Davis performed the ceremony. He was assisted by Cantor Raymond Smolover.

title: Foyt Takes Sprint and Point Lead
description: LONG POND, Pa., Oct. 20 A. J. Foyt won a $25,000 sprint car race today and took the lead in the selfproclaimed world series of auto racing at Pocono International Raceway.

title: Cards Win No. 6; Jets, Giants Lose
description: The St. Louis Cardinals were the National Football League's only undefeated team after the New England Patriots and Minnesota Vikings suffered their first losses yesterday. Joe Ferguson threw three touchdown passes to lead the Buffalo Bills to a 3028 triumph over the Patriots. The Detroit Lions topped the Vikings, 2016, for their first victory over Minnesota since 1967.
