description: HERZLIYA, IsraelIt would probably astonish most people to know that Israel counts on Argentina as potentially the largest remaining source of Jewish immigration that can answer this dynamic little country's Constant clamor for more people, above all an alreadyeducated elite.

title: Primary Reruns
description: As the result of successful court challenges of close Democratic primary election results, special elections will be held Monday in two Manhattan Assembly Districts.

title: Valdes Defeats Curto
description: Vinnie Curto of Boston entered the Madison Square Garden ring last night undefeated, with 17 victories in his two years of boxing as a pro.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Landmarks Preservation Commission requested the New York Public Library yesterday to reverse its decision to close the Jefferson Market Courthouse branch library on Nov. 18. The request, which is unusual for the commission, described the famous Victorian Gothic structure, completed by Calvert Vaux and Frederick C. Withers in 1877 and once described as one of the 10 most beautiful buildings in the country, as a focal point in the Greenwich Village community, contributing to the daily life and spirit of the area.

title: SARGENT PRESSED BY VIGOROUSRIVAL
description: BOSTON, Oct. 25This is not a good year, Gov. Francis W. Sargent is finding, to be a Republican and an incumbent.

title: Oil Fire Burning in Nigeria
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Oct. 23 (AP)An oilwell fire burned out of control today at ShellB.P. facilities in Nigeria's EastCentral State. A company spokesman said the blaze was believed to have been started by tampering with production facilities by unknown persons. ?? began last nighty.

title: Painting and Antique Markets Grow Soft As Britons Invest in Easily Portable Items
description: LONDON, Oct. 25The worldwide economic squeeze that has kept most financial markets in the doldrums has also depressed the London auction market for such traditional items as Impressionist paintings, fine wines and antique furniture.

title: AMEX PRICES OFF; OTC SHOWS GAIN
William B. Oliver, 63, Dies; Was FritoLay Chairman
description: William B. Oliver, who retired as chairman of FritoLay, Inc., in October, 1972, died in Dallas hospital Thursday. He was 63 years old and lived in Dallas and Honolulu.

title: Plane Lands Safely Upstate On FoamCovered Runway
description: ROME, N. Y. Oct. 25 (AP)An Allegheny Airlines DC9 carrying 99 persons made safe emergency landing on foamcovered runway here last night.

title: Security Is Pervasive at Arab Meeting
description: RABAT, Morocco, Oct. 25Xing Hussein of Jordan is being guarded by a small army of security men, the telephone number of President Anwar elSadat of Egypt is classified top secret, and not even the Moroccan Information Minister can get into the conference hall without the proper lapel button.

title: Kissinger Discusses Arms With Brezhnev Five Hours
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 25  Secretary of State Kissinger and Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Communist party leader, met for more than five hours today and talked almost exclusively about putting further curbs on each side's arsenal of offensive strategic weapons.

title: Time Catching Up With Neglected Timor
description: LAUMANA, Portuguese TimorFifteen years ago, after pausing for a mere four and a half centuries in coastal outposts, the Portuguese administration put through a road that ended four miles from this mountainside hamlet. The road  a rough Jeep track, then and nowstopped at a place called Quelicai, and there a couple of whitewashed buildings soon rose to house an administrator's family and office.

title: Arab Press Is Full of Reports Of New Kissinger Proposals
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Oct. 25As the Arab chiefs of stare gathered in Rabat, the Arab press has been full of accounts about the proposals reportedly made by Secretary of State Kissinger for partial settlement of the ArabIsraeli contlict.

title: Giants Have Chance For Obscure Mark
description: The New York Giants finally will be able to shout We're No. 1 about something tomorrow if Craig Morton plays against the Dallas Cowboys at Yale Bowl.

title: Air Force Fire ICBM Successfully From Plane
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 25The Air Force, in a step toward development of a strategic missile with mobility in the air and on land, has successfully testfired for the first time an intercontinental ballistic missile dropped from an airplane, the Defense Department announced today.

title: EDWARD G. REEVE
description: Edward G. Reeve, a retired management consultant of the Columbia Broadcasting Corporation and a past president of the Radio and Television Research Council, died Wednesday of a heart attack in Englewood ( N.J.) Hospital. He was 65 years old and lived at 199 Christie Heights Street, Leonia, N.J.

title: Airco Announces Price Increases For Gaseous Argon
description: The industrial gases division of Airco, Inc., increased yesterday prices on both liquid and bulk gaseous argon to an average price of $1.77 per 100 cubic feet. The price had been $1.35. A spokesman said the change was instituted to offset the rising cost for capital to expand argon capacity.

title: Fidelity Mortgage Investors Is Repaid on Major Loan
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Oct. 25 (AP)Fidelity Mortgage Investors said yesterday it had been repaid the principal amount on one o fits major loans, one of more than $7million on property in Louisiana.

title: SLAYING OF TWO LAID TO POLICE EMPLOYE
description: A 24yearolds civilian employe of the Police Department was arrested yesterday and charged in the murder last March of his wife and her infant daughter in their Brooklyn apartment.

title: A NursingHome Sale, Facing State Inquiry, Held Nonexistent
description: A $29million sale of nursing homes that faces two state investigations never really happened, one of the parties to the sale disclosed yesterday.

title: Reflections on West German Conservatism
description: LA CROIXVALMER, France  The Federal Republic of Germany survived the dramatic change from Chancellor Willy Brandt to Helmut Schmidt surprisingly well. The technical operation was smoothly done, not without pain but at least without shedding of blood.

title: Piccadilly and Trafalgar Plans Irk Britons
description: LONDON, Oct. 25So much of London has come downsome under bombs and some under bulldozers to be replaced by tinandglass boxes, that even modest proposals for changing the rest arouse grief and fury.

title: Unemployment Up Here Despite Decline in State
description: Unemployment worsened sharply in the city in September while it was easing in the suburbs and in the state as a whole, the State Department of Labor reported yesterday.

title: Students at Brooklyn Continue Their Protest
description: A planned student strike at Brooklyn College failed to materialize yesterday, though 200 students continued their weeklong protest of the school's choice for a chairman for the new Puerto Rican Studies Department.

title: 19 Injured on Hayride
description: RUSHVILLE, Ill., Oct. 25 (UPI)A tractor and two trailers pulling about 40 Western Illinois University students on a hayride last night jackknifed and caused the trailers to overturn, injuring 19 of the students, the state police said.

title: NEWS INDEX
Cells Taken From Body Fluids for Study
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 25A method of removing certain cells from body fluids for diagnosis or research is expected to make possible advances in medicine, particularly in immunology, and the treatment of various diseases. The process and devices were invented by Dr. Gerald M. Edelman, winner of a 1972 Nobel Prize, and three of his associates at Rockefeller University. His coinventors in Patent 3,843,324, granted this week, are Dr. John L. Wang, Dr. Urs S. Rutishauser and Clarke F. Millette.

title: American Brands Sets a Merger Deal
description: American Brands, Inc., formerly the American Tobacco Company, announced yesterday the terms under which it plans to acquire 100 per cent of Gallaher Limited, one of Britain's largest manufacturers of tobacco products.

title: People and Business
description: The chairman of the Tennessee Valley Authority said yesterday that he was hopeful that the overall use of electricity in the sevenstate region served by the authority could be reduced by about 20 per cent.

title: SWINE TALK
description: At long last, the Bordeaux wine scandal is coming before the bar of justice. After almost two years of innuendo, rumor and gossip, the whole issue is to be laid out in open court.

title: Dave Anderson
description: N'SELE, Zaire, Oct. 25For other boxers, the training ring is a steamy factory where they assemble their skills and strength. But for Muhammad Ali, it has always been a glorious stage. He entertains the spectators and himself, no matter what the backdrop. He has sparred in the glitter of Las Vegas night clubs, in a gloomy loft above a London pub, in a Tokyo martialarts arena, in a handball court in Dublin, in the dusty basement of the old Madison Square Garden, in Felt Forum of the new Madison Square Garden, in the humidity of a Houston convention hall, in the nostalgia of a walkup gym in Miami Beach, and in a log cabin at his Deer Lake, Pa., hideaway. Here near the Equator, his stage is cooled by 28 fans twirling below the white ceiling of the Congressional hall in Zaire's diplomatic retreat. Near the heavy bag, an American conga drum player beats a native rhythm. Looking up from the rows of pale green chairs and peering through the scalloped openair walls are the black faces of his new audience, the Zairians who stare in awe and admiration at the famous man.

title: Acute Vapidity in New York
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 25Turn off your brains, roll down your socks and let's play Campaign, the game that asks the question, Is anything really going on here, and if so how can you tell?

title: Thieu Foes Shrug at Aide's Resignation
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Oct. 25The resignation yesterday of one of President Nguyen Van Thieu's closest confidants appears to be a tactical victory for Premier Tran Thien Khiem, who suggested the move three weeks ago, wellplaced sources said.

title: Proxmire Accuses H.U.D. Of High Interest Rates
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 25 (UPI) The Department of Housing and Urban Development has improperly increased the interest rates that Congress established in its new housing program, Senator William Proxmire, Democrat of Wisconsin, said today.

title: Ray Is Asked About Contracts, Not Murder, on Witness Stand
description: MEMPHIS, Oct. 25James Earl Ray, who had pleaded guilty to the assassination of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., took the witness stand today in Federal court to ask for a new trial.

title: Books of The Times
description: STRICTLY SPEAKING. Will America Be the Death of English? By Edwin Newman. 193 pages. BobbsMerrill. $7.95.

title: Peru Attracts Oil Money Despite Socialist Policies
description: IQUITOS, Peru, Oct. 21Six years ago, a new military Government marched its troops into the installations of the International Petroleum Companythe Peruvian subsidiary of Exxonand handed the company a claim of $690million in excess profits.

title: U.S. TRADE DEFICIT PARED IN MONTH
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 25 (AP) A sharp drop in September in imported food, oil and cars trimmed the deficit in the United States' trade balance to its best position in five months, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Eaton Sets Joint Venture
description: CLEVELAND, Oct. 25 (UPI) Cyrus Eaton, the Cleveland industrialist, announced yesterday a $30million joint venture between the government of Yugoslavia and his company, Tower. International, Inc., for the development of a soymeal mill in that nation. Mr. Eaton said the soy mill was needed to upgrade the cattle in Yugoslavia, which is short on beef. He said his company would hire the prime contractor for the mill and help in obtaining financing for the mill and for its operation.

title: Kissinger Discusses Arms With Brezhnev Five Hours
description: MOSCOW. Oct. 25  Secretary of State Kissinger and Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Communist party leader, met for more than five hours today and talked almost exclusively about putting further curbs on each side's arsenal of offensive strategic weapons.

title: Armco Sets Dividend For Quarter and Year
description: Directors of the Armco Steel Corporation declared yesterday the regular quarterly dividend of 40 cents a share, plus a yearend extra of 60 cents a share. Both are payable Dec. 9 to share holders of record Nov. 8.

title: CASINOS BECOME EMOTIONAL ISSUE
Entertainment Events Today
description: Music

title: MCRANE GRANTED CHANCE OP VENUE
description: NEWARK, Oct. 25A Federal judge, reversing a decision made earlier this week, granted a change of venue inthe tax fraudconspiracy trial of former New Jersey Treasurer Joseph M. Mc Crane Jr.

title: Driver Praises Pacer
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Oct. 25 Bill Haughton, trainerdriver of Broadcaster B., the favorite in tonight's $84,116 Roosevelt Futurity for 2yearold pacers at Roosevelt Raceway, praised the consistency Of the young racer this morning.

title: Penguins, Hadfield Awaiting Rangers
description: The New York Rangers take to the road tonight for their first game of the season against the Pittsburgh Penguins in the Civic Arena (Channel 9, 7:30 P.M.) and for a reunion, sort of, with Vic Hadfield, their former captain. They will promplty return to Madison Square Garden to meet the Atlanta Flames tomorrow night.

title: Javits and Clark Clash as Mrs. Keating Mocks Them
description: Senator Jacob K. Javits and Ramsey Clark traded another round of angry accusations at a luncheon debate yesterday, but they were also laughed at as Barbara Keating, the Conservative party's candidate, belittled their differences and said they ought to wash their mouths out with soap.

title: Unemployment Up Here Despite Decline in State
description: Unemployment worsened sharply in the city in September while it was easing in the suburbs and in the state as a whole, the State Department of Labor reported yesterday.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: SEASONAL DIVIDENDS Two weekend events based in the Bronx will feature festivities ushering in a time of witchcraft and pumpkins. At the Bronx Zoo, the World of Darkness, the famous exhibition of nightprowling animals and something of a permanent Halloween show, will be specially reinforced tor a seasonal party today and tomorrow. Friendly hoot owls are expected to greet youngsters and their parents near the entrance, along with costumed hobgoblins and witches. Friends of the Zoo volunteers will also tell tales of bats, cats after dark, btish babies in the branches, owls and other creatures. The exhibition's flyway will give special bat demonstrations at 11 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: Market Place LIFO, FIFO and Comparability
description: The method by which costs are assigned to inventories in an infktionary era can be very significant when the cost of raw materials is a paramount factor in determining, profits.

title: Miss Furtseva Dies
description: Yekaterina A. Furtseva, the only woman in Soviet history to become a member of the ruling inner circle of the Communist party, died in Moscow yesterday of a heart attack. Miss Furtseva was Minister of Culture from 1960 to her death. Page 34.

title: Monmouth Offers Jersey Sweeps
COURIER FLIGHTS TO NIXON HALTEL
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 25President Ford has suspended special courier flights carrying secret briefing documents is former President Richard M Nixon, the White House announced today.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Carey Assails Reaction of State Agency To Meeting of Panel on Mental Health
description: Representative Hugh L. Carey, DemocraticLiberal candidate for Governor, assailed the State Department of Mental. Hygiene yesterday for what he called an attempt to muzzle a group of consumers and citizens on a state mental health task force that met here on Wednesday night and censured the head of the department.

title: Launch Sinks in Ganges
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, Oct. 25, (Reuters)Many of 200 people aboard a crowded passenger launch were feared to have drowned yesterday when the vessel sank near Faridpur in the Ganges Delta. Reports said some passengers swam ashore, but it was not known how many reached safety.

title: Art: William Bailey StillLifes
description: Stilllife painting can be many things. For some painters, a table top adorned with a few objects and a stray cloth is a sort of battlefield. For others, the same kind of subject may be treated as a dark, psychological mystery or, what is more commonly the case, a benign occasion for creating a pictorial design of felicitous harmonies. The stilllife is sometimes said to be the most abstract of pictorial subjects, but it nonetheless has a Rorschachlike capacity to reveal an artist's true interests.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 33

title: T. DOUGLAS ROBSON
description: T. Douglas Robson, president of Jacobs & Robson, Inc., textile concern, died Thursday at his home in Plandome, L.I. He was 57 years old.

title: Samuel Gubin, 67, Inventor of AirNavigation Devices
description: Samuel Gubin, an aerospace engineer and inventor, died of cancer in Washington Adventist Hospital on Oct. 15. He was 67 years old and lived in Rockville, Md.

title: Common Market Permits 8 Nations To Join Oil Plan
description: BRUSSELS, Oct. 25 (UPI) The European Common Market's Executive Commission gave approval today to eight of its nine member nations to join in an international oil policy with the United States, Japan, Canada and Norway.

title: Wisconsin G.O.P.Candid on Its Gloomy Prospects
description: MADISON, Wis.  Republicans are being unusually candid about their rather dismal prospects in the Nov. 5 election.

title: CLASSIFIED ADVERTISING INDEX
description: Page

title: Fog Over the Economy
description: The feastorfamine imbalances that plague the American economy are highlighted by the thirdquarter earnings reports now beginning to pile up from the automobile, oil and steel industries.

title: Janitor Wins $1Million
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Oct. 25 (UPI)  Angel M. Sarrano, a former migrant apple picker who works as a janitor in a fabric mill, yesterday won $1million in the Pennsylvania lottery. Mr. Sarrano, 49 years old, of Reading, Pa., is married but has no children.

title: British Take Tennis Cup From U. S.
description: DEESIDE, Wales, Oct. 25 (AP)Britain gained an unbeatable 40 lead in the Wightman Cup tennis competition tonight by winning a singles and a doubles match from the United States.

title: Chile Signs Agreement
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Oct 25 (UPI)Chile signed an agreement today to purchase 100,000 tons of wheat from the United States, the Foreign Ministry announced. Cost of the grain will be $17.1million.

title: GUARD IS CHARGED IN CHICAGO THEFTS
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 25 (UPI)The Federal Bureau of Investi gation today charged a sus pended guard of the Armorei Express Corporation with bur glary, larceny and the use explosive devices in the looting of $4million from the com pany's vault.

title: RAGTIME BY JASEN AT VILLAGE CORNER
description: When the Village Corner, a modest bar at Bleecker Street, and La Guardia Place, inaugurated a ragtime piano policy last month, Jim Smith, the owner, had great difficulty finding ragtimepiano specialists resident in New York, aside from the 91yearold Eubie Blake. But Mr. Smith has now unearthed oneDave Jasen, 3 37yearold pianist from Flushing, Queens, who not only plays the old piano rags but also composes new ones and is a walking (and sitting) encyclopedia of ragtime lore.

title: Political Access to Television: A Double Standard
description: After months of holding off network requests for exclusive interviews, President Ford has become available for television news specials just before the November elections and in a period when he has been actively campaigning for the election of Republicans to the Congress. The timing has left many broadcast officials with the feeling that the President, taking advantage of the news scrutiny to which his office and personal life are continually subjected, may be inviting air time for strictly political purposes. It has been widely observed that the President is always implicity a political figure when he appears on television in an election campaign period, even if should be in an innocuous context, such as conducting a tour of Camp David, Md., as he will be doing for ABCTV.

title: Cost of Farm Food At Record Levels; Middlemen Benefit
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 25 (UPI) The cost of a typical market basket of farmproduced foods hit a peak in September for the second straight month, an Agriculture Department report showed today. Farmers made less but the middlemen's margin reached a high, the agency said.

title: Antiques: A Busy Week in Wedgwood
description: It has been a busy week for Wedgwood collectors. Some flew to London (or sent bids) for Sotheby's sale on Tuesday, which included a highly prized and welldocumented first edition Wedgwood copy of the Portland vase, the third made of about 25 known to have been produced by the British potter about 1790.

title: Thursday's Fight
description: LOS ANGELESCarlos Palomino, 146 pounds, Los Angeles, knocked out Jos Miranda, 147, Tiajuana, Mexico, 6 rounds.

title: TRAINS TO DETROIT START THURSDAY
description: Some call it the Niagara Rainbow and others the Empire State Express; but it's the same train, and it will begin a new daily service between Grand Central Terminal and Detroit next Thursday.

title: Iran Aid for Africans
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 25Iran has given $1million to assist droughtstricken countries in the subSaharan region of Africa. The contribution was turned over this week to Secretary General Waldheim by Princess Ashraf Pahlevi, who is heading the Iranian delegation to the 29th General Assembly.

title: Denver School Busing Succeeds; Social Mixture Called a Factor
description: DENVER, Oct. 25  While Bostonians resisted, Denverites desegregated their schools this fall under a busing program that has caused some complaints and tension but no violence or overt displays of racial hatred.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Responding to protests about hardships caused for the aged, blind and disabled poor by the federal Supplemental Security Income Program, Governor Wilson announced a temporary program to meet their emergency needs.

title: Art: Renoir, Working and Having Fun
description: It is one of the curiosities of genetics that Auguste Renoir the painter should have fathered Jean Renoir the film director. On one level there is an obvious affinity: Some of Jean Renoir's outdoor scenes can be read as the continuation by other means of hif father's ambitions. But the Renoir who directed The Grand Illusion and The Rules of the Game is remarkable above all for his acute and unsparing social vision. That vision is astringent, rigorous, allcomprehending: As we watch, we shiver.

title: Mills Denies Congress Plan To Tax V.A. Compensation
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Oct. 25 (UPI)  Representative Wilbur D. Mills, Democrat of Arkansas, who is chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, said yesterday that Congress had no plans to put a tax on Veterans Administration compensation.

title: Repairs on East Side Road
description: Because of repairs, the Franklin D. Roosevelt Drive's southbound lanes from 14th Street to 23d Street will be closed through 6 A.M. Monday.

title: Police Without New Clues In Connecticut Slaying of 6
description: NEW BRITAIN, Conn., Oct. 25 (UPI)The police said today that there was nothing new in their investigation of six murders in a bakery during an apparent robbery last Saturday night.

title: BERTHA CARLSON
description: Bertha Heckman Carlson, the widow of Walter E. Carlson, who had been a compositor for The New York Times for 37 years at his retirement in 1961, died in Wyckoff Hospital, Brooklyn, on Thursday. She was 78 years old and lived in Richmond Hill, Queens.

title: Elderly Craftsmen: Their Mission Is to Learn, Then Teach
description: It was an unlikely group of missionaries sitting around a table in a sunny workshop above Lexington Avenue the other daygrayhaired women, most of them, some a little frail looking, but all with the same absorption in what they were doing.

title: 141 Colt Winner In Pace
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Oct. 25 Moving up fast on the outside in the closing yards, Shirleys Beau won more money tonight than in all 13 of his previous races by capturing the $84,116 Roosevelt Futurity pace before 15,729 fans at Roosevelt Raceway.

title: Citibank Cuts Its Key Loan Rate to 11%
description: The current downward trend In shortterm interest rates continued yesterday as the. First National City Bank announced a reduction id its base lending rate to 11 per cent, effective Monday.

title: Ballet: Lively Petrushka
description: One of Michel Fokine's revolutionary ideas in creating Petrushka in 1911 consisted of incorporating a crowd scene into the ballet. This was to be a group that moved about naturally and did not stand arrayed in the formal patterns of 19thcentury classic ballet.

title: G.M. Profit Slumps By 94% in Quarter
description: The announcement of gloomy figures from the auto industry continued yesterday as the General Motors Corporation, the No. 1 auto maker, reported that its earnings for the third quarter plummeted 94 per cent from the same period of 1973. Its earnings for the first nine months of the year were the lowest in 16 years.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Economic and Financial Committee10:30 A.M.

title: Music: Smith's Marathon
description: Robert Smith, who embarked two seasons ago on a journey through the complete harpsichord works of Francois Couperin, obviously relishes the pictorial and picturesque side of 17th and 18thcentury music. His witty and perceptive notes for the opening recital of his project's third season, on Thursday night at Carnegie Hall, made that evidentmore consistently evident, in fact, his playing, which could take a metronomic turn or fail to find enough contrast in mood, touch and tempo from one piece to another.

title: Fossils in Ethiopia Said to Show Man As Million Y ears Older Than Believed
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Oct. 25Anthropologists said today that they had found fossilized human remains three million to four million years old that, they predicted, would revolutionize thinking on the origins of man.

title: Knicks Losing Knack
description: The Boston Celtics and the Knicks are teams in trouble. For Boston the problems are temporary until the return of Dave Cowens and Don Nelson, but for the Knicks they may be permanent.

title: SUFFOLK REDUCES AID TO MOTORISTS
description: HAUPPAUGE, LI., Oct. 25 Citing budget problems, the Suffolk Police Commissioner said that starting next week members of his force would reduce assistance given stranded motorists on the Long Island Expressway or on county roads.

title: Stalled Train in Tunnel Delays L. I. R. R. Riders
description: Thousands of Long Island Rail Road commuters were delayed an hour or more during yesterday's evening rush hour, after the 4:22 train from New York to Port Washington stalled in the tunnel under the East River because of an equipment failure, delaying later trams out of Pennsylvania Station.

title: Miss or Mrs. Required In Little Rock Registration
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Oct. 25 (UPI)The Pulaski County Clerk Charles Jackson has been told in a temporary order issued yesterday in United States District Court to register women to vote in the Nov. 5 election under any name they desire to use as long as they are preceded by Miss or Mrs.

title: L. I. Day Clinic Offers Aid to Alcoholics
description: BRENTWOOD, L. I.; Oct. 25The days were usually just like the nights for Donald Laskystarting at the four walls, drinking a bottle of muscatel, as he puts it. But now he has something to do five days a week.

title: Damaged Ship Heads Here After Report of Flooding
description: MIAMI, Oct. 25. (UPI)  A damaged Gautemalan cargo ship found 150 moles northeast of Cape Canaveral continued to cruise toward her New York destination today despite a fivedegree list to port.

title: State Agrees to Speed Its Subsidies to 12 Bus Lines
description: TRENTON, Oct. 25  An agreement between the State Department of Transportation and 12 financially distressed bus lines on terms for steppedup state subsidy payments was reached late yesterday, insuring that commuter service for 40,000 passengers not end next Friday, as previously threatened by the 2 companies.

title: Sam Snead Leads Club Pros by Shot.
description: PINEHURST, N. C. Oct. 25 (AP)  Sam Snead shot a threeunderpar 70 and took a onestroke lead today in the seventh annual P.G.A. club professional championship.

title: Weather Reports and Forecast
description: Forecast

title: $19,530 Bet Payoff
description: CHARLES TOWN, W. Va., Oct. 25 (AP)One fan collected the biggest payoff today on a trizacta bet since it was started at the Charles Town race track. Picking the correct finish of the first three horses, he received $19,530 for a $2 wager.

title: Thursday's Fight
description: LOS ANGELESCarlos Palomino, 146 pounds, Los Angeles, knocked out Jose Miranda, 147, Tiajuana, Mexico, 6 rounds.

title: Yekaterina Furtseva Dead; ExSoviet Culture Minister
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 25Yekaterina A. Furtseva, the only woman in Soviet history to become a member of the ruling inner circle of the Communist party, died today of a heart attack. She was 63 years old.

title: Hugh L. Catey's Positions
description: Mr. Carey says the state, by letting its share of the financing of local school districts fall below 40 per cent, has not met its obligations to education. By assuming a greater share, he says, the state would shift the burden from the property to the income tax.

title: Celtics, Led by Havlicek, Subdue Hawks, 116109
description: BOSTON, Oct. 25 (UPI)John Havlicek, with 35 points, led the Boston Celtics to a 116109 triumph over the Atlanta Hawks tonight.

title: Thompson Halts Fraser
description: BRISBANE, Australia, Oct. 25 (AP)Hector Thompson of Australia stopped Alfonso (Peppermint) Frazer tonight when the Panamanian failed to answer thebell for the start of the eighth round of their scheduled 10round iunior welterweight fight. Thompson weighed 138 pounds and Frazer 140.

title: F. Shelton Farr, Founder Of Stock Brokerage Firm
description: F. Shelton Farr, founder and former senior partner of the commodity and stock brokerage firm of Farr & Co., now Farr Man & Co., Inc., 120 Broadway, died Wednesday in Rapallo, Italy, where he had lived for several years.

title: JERSEY CENTRAL GETS FEDERAL AID
description: TRENTON, Oct.The Federal Railroad Administrator announced today that the Department of Transportation had awarded in emergency grant of $1.245million to enable the Central Railroad of New Jersey. to meet operating expenses and to repair freight terminals in northern New Jersey.

title: Albert Vows Campaign To Oust Ford in 1976
description: TULSA, Okia., Oct. 25 (UPI)In a fiery speech that marked his first strongly partisan attack on Gerald R. Ford, House Speaker Carl Albert told a Democratic rally last night that the only war that the Democrats ejected to office this year want to start is the battle to oust the President from the White House.

title: Soviet Grain Crop In '74 Calculated At Below Target
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 25 (Reuters) Official statistics released today indicate that the Soviet Union will have a total grain harvest this year of under 200 Million tonsand possibly as much as 15 million tons below the target of 205.6 million tons.

title: College, School Results
description: FOOTBALL Colleges

title: Israelis Tighten Security At Airport After Warnings
description: TEL AVIV, Oct. 25 (UPI)Israeli officials tightened security at the international airport here today because of reports that Arab guerrillas planned attacks on foreign airliners as Arab leaders gathered in Morocco for a summit conference.

title: British Football
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE

title: Art Auctions Strained
description: The worldwide economic slump, while depressing most securities markets, has also squeezed the London auction market for such items as paintings, fine wines and antique furniture. But demand remains for objects easily transported abroadpostage stamps, gems and rare coins. Details on Page 43.

title: G.M.'s Net Plummets 94% in Quarter; Ford and Chrysler Set More Layoffs
Court Denies Bid to Stay WNCN Format Change
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 25The United States Court of Appeals today denied a motion to stay station WNCN's planned conversion from a classical to a rock format.

title: Notes on People
description: Wade Burger, the 39yearold son of Chief Justice Warren E. Burger, received his $26,871ayear job in the General Services Administration in violation of meritsystem requirements, and he should be removed from it, a House Civil Service subcommittee has concluded. A subcommittee spokesman said yesterday, that Mr. Burger had been selected for a job that was actually created for Min, and that no consideration had been given to four other applicants with higher seniority and more impressive qualifications. A former real estate salesman, Mr. Burger was given his job, as special assistant to the assistant, commissioner for space management in G.S.A., in 1970, shortly after his father was nominated as Chief Justice. The subcommittee's recommendation that Mr. Burger be removed will be forwarded to the Civil Service Commission when the Congress reconvenes, the subcommittee spokesman said. Mr. Burger, although still working at the agency, could not be reached for comment yesterday.

title: Addict Is Convicted In Village Slaying Of a Macy's Writer
description: A 39yearold heroin addict who told the police he had a $40aday habit was found guilty last night by a Manhattan Supreme Court jury of the fatal stabbing of a 28yearold advertising copywriter for Macy's last year in the hallway of her Greenwich Village apartment.

title: Spain Yields in Doctors' Strike, Ends Good Conduct Certificate
description: MADRID, Oct. 25Medical services in public hospitals and clinics returned to normal today after the Government yielded to 4,000 striking doctors and dropped its requirement that they have a good conduct certificate.

title: Reserve Approves Bank
description: The EuropeanAmerican Bank & Trust Company was approved yesterday as a member of the Federal Reserve System. The bank, which applied for membership Oct. 16, took over the branches and most of the business of Franklin National Bank on Oct. 8 when that bank was declared insolvent.

title: J. DALE PATTERSON
description: J. Dale Patterson, manager of galvanized and specialty sheet sales for the Bethlehem Steel Corporation, died Tuesday in Bethlehem, Pa., where he made his home. He was 57 years old.

title: City Proposes Four Rape Treatment Centers
description: Four centralized rape treatment centers, providing medical care and counseling for victims, will be established in New York City hospitals if the city can prove that the model project it is proposing deals effectively with what a Federal agency has designated a national priority issue.

title: Trevino Leads Golf By 2 Shots
description: NAGOYA, Japan, Oct. 25 (AP)  Lee Trevino stroked his way out of a threeway tie with a fiveunderpar 67 today and took sole possession of first place at the midway point of the $133,000 Tokai classic golf tournament.

title: Johnson Leaves Hospital
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 23 (UPI)Marques Johnson, a basketball star at the University of California, Los Angeles, was released from the hospital and will remain in school despite a case of hepatitis. Johnson, a 6foot6inch sophomore who was an occasional starter for the Bruins last season, entered the U.C.L.A. Medical Center a week ago.

title: Lefkowitz Charges Rival Slanders Him; Abrams Hits Back
description: State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz yesterday accused his opponent, Borough President Robert Abrams of the Bronx, of making slanderous statements about him, and he demanded a public apology.

title: Monmouth Offers Jersey Sweeps
ARAB ENVOYS BACK PALESTINIANS' BID TO GET WEST BANK
description: RABAT, Morocco, Oct. 25The foreign ministers of 19 Arab countries voted today to support the Palestine Liberation Organization's claim to control over all territories on the West Bank of the Jordan River that might be evacuated by Israel.

title: Piccadilly and Trafalgar Plans Irk Britons
description: LONDON, Oct. 25So much of London has come downsome under bombs and some under bulldozers to be replaced by tinandglass boxes, that even modest proposals for changing the rest arouse grief and fury.

title: ONADA TO LOWER TAX ON INCOMES
description: OTTAWA, Oct. 25  The Canadian Government announced today that income taxes would go down next year as a result of legislation, passed last year, linking levies to the consumer price index. Finance Minister John N. Turner said that about 225,000 Canadians in the lower brackets would be spared from paying any tax under the system, which is aimed at combating the effect Of inflation on the taxpayer.

title: New Jersey Sports Lenape Start Fast
description: STANHOPE, Oct. 25Rich Snyder has moved to Sussex County from Bergen County. It appears his ability to succeed also made the trip.

title: Kings, Paced by Walker, Beat Bulls Again 11291
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 25 (UPI) Jimmy Walker scored 14 of his gamehigh 20 points in the first period tonight to lead the Kansas CityOmaha Kings to a 11291 victory Over the Chicago Bulls. It was the third straight loss for the Bulls.

title: REGENTS TO ALLOW APPEALS ON BUSING
description: ALBANY, Oct. 25The State Board of Regents issued a statement on integration policy today that, for the first time, gives parents a procedure for challenging an integration busing order if they believe the bus ride would endanger their children's health and safety or lower the quality of their education.

title: Willie the Shake, and the 12 Dancing Rabbits
description: The following is adapted from speech delivered at Ithaca College's School of Communications by Rod Serling, who is a television writer and producer and who sometimes appears in commercials.

title: Kuhn Doubts Lure Of Pay Television
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 25 (AP)Bowie Kuhn, the commissioner of baseball, said today it would be unthinkable for professional baseball to let the lure of pay cable television jeopardize our relationships with our broadcast friends.

title: The Theater: Tent of the Underdogs
description: Whatever happened to the political theater? It is curious that at a time of considerable national torment, of social reevaluation, economic chaos and political polarization, we have so little political satire. An impressionist may daringly do a husky and ingratiating impersonation of former President Richard M. Nixon on the Johnny Carson show, but it is really no more impressive, convincing or likely than the impression he offers of Mr. Carson himself. And it is certainly no more cutting.

title: 11 Cited for Contempt in School Strike
description: LNG BRANCH, Oct. 25Judge Merritt Lane Jr. tonight cited 11 persons for contempt of court for defying for the second dayan order he had issuedin Superior Court prohibiting a strike by teachers, custodians and clerical workers against the schools here.

title: OCCIDENTAL'S NET INCREASES 296.4%
description: The Mobil Oil Corporation, the Occidental Petroleum Corporation and the Getty Oil Company added their names yesterday to the list of oil companies reporting higher earnings for the third quarter.

title: LEON KROLL, 89, ACADEMIC ARTIST
description: Leon Kroll, artist and muralist, died yesterday in the Addison Gilbert Hospital in Gloucester, Mass. He was 89 years old and had lived in Gloucester and at 15 West 67th Street here for many years.

title: THOMAS J. LEA
description: Thomas J. Lea, who retired in 1967 as vice president of John P. Maguire & Co., Inc., an independent factoring organization, died Wednesday at his home, 200 East 66th Street. He was 73 years old.

title: Nets Triumph; Erving Gets 37
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., Oct. 25 The New York Nets put together their best game of the young American Basketball Association season tonight and defeated the San Antonio Spurs, 11393, before 7,167 fans at Nassau Coliseum.

title: WILLIAM CHESTER, CARDIOLOGIST, DIES
description: Dr. William Chester, emeritus director of cardiology and medicine at United Hospital in Port Chester, N.Y., died Thursday in that hospital. He was 70 years old and lived in Mamaroneck, N.Y., and Palm Beach, Fla.

title: General Phone Suffers Its First Deficit
Penguins, Hadfield Awaiting Rangers
description: The New York Rangers take to the road tonight for their first game of the season against the Pittsburgh Penguins in the Civic Arena (Channel 9, 7:30 P.M.) and for a reunion, sort of, with Vic Hadfield, their former captain. They will promplty return to Madison Square Garden to meet the Atlanta Flames tomorrow night.

title: Henry Ruth's Tasks
description: To their credit, Attorney General Saxbe and the White House moved quickly on Leon Jaworski's recommendation that Henry S. Ruth Jr. be named Watergate special prosecutor. Mr. Ruth is a highly esteemed and dedicated public servant who has already earned the gratitude the American people and the loyalty of the Watergate special prosecution staff. Not the least of his services to the country was the feat of keeping the staff together the wake of the Saturday Night Massacre, which, under less able interim leadership, could have devastated the extraordinarily able operation Archibald Cox had put together.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yester day was:

title: EnglishMade Engines
description: Almost all cars in Formula One Grand Prix auto races use CosworthFord V8 engines made in England.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Minimum Milk Price Up 2c a Gallon.

title: SUICIDE DIVERTS A TOUR BY CAREY
description: Representative Hugh L. Carey just missed an episode of violence in midtown yesterday when a man who had hijacked a shipment of methadone from Roosevelt Hospital shot himself in the head.

title: OFFICER SUSPECT IN HOLDUP KILLING
description: An Elizabeth police officer, faced with a possible murder indictment, will be called before a Union County grand jury within two weeks in an investigation of the shooting of a bystander during the attempted holdup of a tavern.

title: BLACKS TELL FORD HE WEAKENS LAW
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 25  A group of black civil rights leaders told President Ford in blunt language today that his recent public statement on the Boston school violence had the effect of encouraging whites to violate the law.

title: Dismissed Over Flippant Tone
description: PARIS, Oct. 25The director general of one of France's most popular radio stations was dismissed yesterday because the Government found the station's broadcasts flippant.

title: School Bus Driver Blames Brakes in Crash Fatal to 7
description: ROCKMART, Ga., Oct. 25 (AP)  The driver of the school bus involved in a collision with a train that killed seven children told investigators today that the brakes had failed as the bus approached a rural grade crossing.

title: CYPRUS SAYS TURKS BROKE TRUCE AGAIN
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Oct. 25The Government accused Turkey today of breaking the ceasefire for the second day in succession by advancing to occupy positions south of the eastcoast port of Famagusta.

title: Bridge: Gail Moss to Be President Of New York Association
The Stage: Puppets and Pyrotechnics
description: Much of what pretends to We children's theater is addressed to parents who willingly embrace almost anything that reminds them of socalled adult theater. What they should be looking for, of course, is something that would remind them of the pleasure of being children. One rare such experience is provided by Professor Bedlam's Punch and Judy, an uproarious entertainment for children (of all ages) and adults (of all ages), playing every Saturday at 3 P.M. at the Evergreen Theater, 53 East 11th Street.

title: Jaworski in Favor Of Public's Hearing White House Tapes
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 25 (UPI) Leon Jaworski, whose resignation as the special Watergate prosecutor takes effect tomorrow, said today he thought that the American public should hear the Nixon White House tapes, but said obscene language might ketp some of them off radio and television.

title: 21 Cars Derailed Upstate
description: STONY BROOK, N. Y. Oct. 25 (AP)A locomotive and 21 freight cars derailed from Delaware & Hudson track near here today, sending two of the cars into the Hudsoii River, authorities said. No injuries were reported. Warren County deputy sheriffs said the derailment had resulted from bad track conditions.

title: KayserRoth Fills 2 Top Posts From Younger Executive Ranks
description: The KayserRoth Corporation, the country's largest apparel producer, yesterday named two of its younger executives to be its new president and executive vice president.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: SHOP TALK
description: Of all the decorative arts, the jeweler's is probably the most difficult. He can't be too offbeat: nobody wants an expensive bauble that's going to look dated in a year or two. The classics are safe investments, of course, but one can get very bored with circle pins or animals with emerald eyes.

title: Europe's Oil Fund
description: Both the integration of Europe and a solution to the world's excruciating oilmoney problem should be brought a step nearer by agreement of the nine Common Market countries on a collective effort to help their weaker members finance oilpayments deficits.

title: Announce expansion of only bank plan in U.S. that allows both checks and top interest at same time How a Tree Checking Account Can Actually Lose You $500 a Year
description: CHICAGO  Millions of Americans today consider themselves lucky to have a socalled free checking account. But what they don't realize is that many are actually letting 3100, $300, even $500 or more in hard cash slip through their fingers every year. This is because, although the checks arefree, their account isn't earning them one cent in interest.

title: The Port Authority Loses Some of Its Financial Glow
description: The developing dispute ove?? the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, its chairman Dr. William J. Ronan, and it. decision to delay work on a New Jersey mass  transi?? project has occurred at a time when the agency is experienc?? ing unusual financial head winds.

title: Labor Department Finds Union Raises Larger Than in '73
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 25Union workers, freed from controls and intent on catching up with the cost of living, are winning larger wage Increases this year than last.

title: 165,000 Letters Are Sent To Correct Guide to Voting
description: CAMDEN, Oct. 25 (UPI)The Camden County Clerk's office began sending letters today to 165,000 voters, correcting mistake on instructions for voting on six referendum questions on sample ballots sent out earlier this week.

title: Pro Trainactions
description: BUFFALD (AFC)Signed Rex Karn, safety, free agent. Placed on injured reserve list John Skorupan, Rich Lewis, linebackers.

title: ARAB ENVOYS BACK PALESTINIANS' BID TO GET WEST BANK
INDIA OPTIMISTIC ON KISSINGER VISIT
description: NEW DELHI, Oct. 25Nearly three, yesrs after India's relations with the United States were strained by the anger surrounding, the India  Pakistan war, Secretary of State Kissinger is set to arrive in India Sunday for a tuteeday visit that is expected to buoy the friendship between the nations.

title: Governor Wilson's Actions
description: Governor Wilson has asked the Task Force on State Aid for Elementary and Secondary Schools to submit recommendations to him for further alterations in the aid formula to make the program more equitable.

title: AIR FORCE MAY JUNK SOME OLDER PLANES
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 25 (UPI) The Air Force may have to discard some of its older planes because oil companies say they will not make special fuels for the service any more, according to Air Force sources.

title: REGENTS TO ALLOW APPEALS ON BUSING
description: ALBANY, Oct. 25The State Board of Regents issued a statement on integration policy today not, for the first time gives a procedure for challenging an integration busing order if they believe the bus ride would endanger their children's health and safety or lower the quality of their education.

title: Fossils in Ethiopia Said to Show Man As Million Years Older Than Believed
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Oct. 25Anthropologists said today that they had found fossilized human remains three million to four million years old that, they predicted, would revolutionize thinking on the origins of man.

title: Murray Fenster, Survivor Of Dachau, Hero in Korea
description: Murray Fenster, one of the first survivors of the Dachau and Auschwitz Nazi concentration camps to arrive here as a displaced person in 1946, died last Saturday at a hospital in Brooklyn. He was 491 years old and lived in Seaford, L.I.

title: PROTEST BY PRESS IS ON RISE IN SEOUL
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Oct. 25National daily newspapers and press agencies in South Korea today closed their ranks and pressed the Government of President Park Chung Hee to end press restrictions.

title: 11 Russians to Review U.S. Election Campaigns
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 25 (Reuters)  Eleven Soviet youths are making a twoweek study of the American election process.

title: Flames Tied, 22, By North Stars
description: ATLANTA, Oct. 25 (UPI)Fred Stanfield's first goal of the season, a 25foot drive from the left boards, gave the Minnesota North Stars a 22 tie with the Atlanta Flames tonight in a national Hockey League.

title: EDWARD N. DEAN
description: Edward N. Dean, former chairman of the board of the First Jersey National Bank in Jersey City, died Thursday evening at the age of 68. He lived at 11 Greene Drive, Roslyn, L.I.

title: Voter Confusion Is Seen On 2 State Bond Issues
description: State bond issues dealing with the quality of housing and preservation of open spaces in New Jersey appeared this week to be in danger of becoming ensnared on election day in an atmosphere of voter mistrust of additional government spending and confusion over the number of complicated propositions on the ballot.

title: World Fish Supply Too Depleted to Fill Needs of the Hungry
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 25New England haddock has been a staple of American fish markets since Colonial days. Today the fish are so scarce that stocks are endangered and commercial fishermen are forbidden to seek them anywhere off the East Coast.

title: 30 Killed on Portuguese Isle
description: LISBON, Oct. 25 (Reuters)More than 30 people were killed Wednesday in a landslide that swept through a ravine on the Portuguese island of so Tome off the African coast, the Portuguese Lusitania news agency said today.

title: World Fish Supply Too Depleted to Fill Needs of the Hungry
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 25New England haddock has been a staple of American fish markets since Colonial days. Today the fish are so scarce that stocks are endangered and commercial fishermen are forbidden to seek them anywhere off the East oast.

title: Udella Stops Molledo
description: MILAN, Italy, Oct. 25 (AP) Franco Udella of Italy knocked out Pedro Molledo of Spain in thefifth round tonight at Milan's Indoor Sports Palace and won the European flyweight boxing championship. Udella weighed 111 pounds and Molledo 112.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Stock Prices Are Steady Despite PrimeRate Cut
description: Despite another cut in the prime interest rate and an improvement in the nation's foreign trade deficit, stock prices closed practically unchanged in lighter trading yesterday.

title: Hard Hats Reassess Their Political Views
description: Derek Wilkinson was taking a break from his Manhattan construction job one day last week, swigging beer with a couple of friends, when the subject of politics kid patriotism was raised.

title: POLICE FIND BODY OF MISSING COED
description: The police of Syracuse, announced that a body unearthed at a suburban sewage, plant, yesterday was that of Karen Levy of Cherry Hill, N.J., an 18yearold Syracuse University freshman who disappeared from the campus nearly two years ago after accepting a ride from a stranger.

title: Two Inmates Are Reported Missing From Greenhaven
description: Two inmates were reported missing from the maximum security Greenhaven Correctional Center in Stormville. N. Y., last night, but prison officials said they did not know if the men had escaped or were still in the facility.

title: Council Decision to Raise Pay May Cost Newark Tax Revenue granted by State
description: NEWARK  A confrontation affecting Newark taxpayers has developed between the City Council and three members of the Essex County legislative delegation.

title: MUSIC VIEW
description: Today's enormous outpouring of classical music from professional concerts, college and community orchestras, opera houses, as well as from records and radio, is a phenomenon strictly of our time. The Music Appreciation industry in America and Europe has also worked to increase distribution by offering, along with the music itself, technical explanations designed for laymen. In no earlier epoch has the ear been so helpfully drenched. And yet, the criticism of it all, the reporting of musical events by knowing and skeptical minds, has not, as an art itself, grown by what it feeds on.

title: For senior citizens, hassled parents, factory workers
description: The riddle of the Sphinx was: What goes on four legs in the morning, two legs in the afternoon and three legs in the evening? The answer, of course, was man, who crawls on all fours as a baby, walks upright as an adult and hobbles about with a cane in his dotage. The answer still holds, but today the senior citizen perambulates not on three legs but on three wheels. His vehicle is the adult tricycle or threewheeler, an overblown version of the familiar children's trike. Sales of adult trikes are currently booming. Nobody has exact figures, but one industry source estimates that around 150,000 of them will be sold in 1974. According to William B. Laighton Jr., advertising manager of Columbia, possibly the oldest bike maker in the U.S.: It looks to me as if it's going to be fantastic. We're not even putting the threewheeler in some of our catalogues because we can't make them fast enough.

title: An eco  freak for overnor?
description: DENVER, Colo.Richard Lamm does not exude an iota of the cowboy image, a physicalpolitical quality which has tended to cling to the men who have been elected Governor of Colorado for almost a century. His voice snaps instead of drawls, and sometimes his fastmoving tongue becomes tied up by his faster moving mind. Lamm's body is lean (he jogs) and his hair silver, but the almost cherubic contours of his face and his questioning eyes bear absolutely no resemblance to the weathered head and steely gaze of the Marlboro man.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor: Although one cannot disagree with the, fashionable logic of W. Donald Georgen's thesis in Inflation, a Time to Think of Switching to LIFO (Oct. 13), I believe that he has minimized the inherent risk and omitted some major considerations involved in changing methods of inventory valuation.

title: Pittsburgh Tops Navy By 1311
description: ANNAPOLIS, Oct. 26 (AP) Tony Dorsett, Pittsburgh's star back, made up for three fumbles with a 108yard rushing performance and a clutch touchdown todgy the Panthers beat Navy, 1311.

title: Manhattan Tops Fordham in Run
description: Pete Squires, Tony Colon and Pete Gaughn led Manhattan College to a 2134 crosscountry victory over Fordham yesterday at Van Cortlandt Park, the Bronx.

title: SadFaced Dog Cited for Heroism In Saving Boy From Rattlesnake
description: A mixedbreed dog, who risked his life to save a 6yearold boy, Donald Essig, from a rattlesnake, is America's dog hero of the year.We chose Skippy from the Orange County Animal Shelter because he looked the saddest of all the dogs there,s said Mrs. Gary Essig of Santa Ana, Caif. He looked as if he was crying. Skippy didn't even bark for quite a long time.

title: Epilogue A Glance Back at Some Major Stories
description: No Dissent

title: A Search for Creative Solitude in Georgia
Jaworski And Sirica
description: Leon Jaworski has resigned as the spetial Watergate prosecutor, saying his job was done Judge John J. Sirica Is presiding over the second Watergate trial he did so much to bring about. A little silence is now in order from both gentlemen.

title: Legislative Notes
description: TRENTON The threat of having stateowned automobiles towed away finally made an impact last week, when about 200 such vehicles were turned in to a central motor pool here.

title: Future Social Events
description: Hobnob With Goblins Oct. 29Adults, find a child (one who is less than 13 years old), yours or someone else's, so that you'll be able to take a Halloween preview walk through the Haunted Greenhouse at the New York Botanical Garden. There'll be so many devilish plants to see, the devil'sbackbone, devil'sshoestrings and devil'swalkingstick, that only young imps can guide you safely. You'll have to beware of the deadly nightshade, the stinging nettle. And never mind about all this plant conversationbe careful what you say to the venus flytrap; it might snap back. BUt there'll also be the good witch hazel so no one will really need to be scared by an owl or a raven or strange eerie soundsthey'll be electronic. At the end of the trail, refreshments (make reservations in advance) will, be found. Put on Halloween clothes if you like. The preview is $5 for an adult, the child is free. The next two days admission is $1 for adults, 50 cents for children. All proceeds will help the student horticulturist program.

title: Malachy Wienges To Wed Miss Falk
description: Mr. and Mrs. Robert H. Falk of Far Hills, N.J., have announced the engagement of Mr. Falk's daughter, Noreen Evelyn Falk, to Malachy Joseph Wienges of is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Malachy Joseph Wienges of Floral Park, L.I., and Hudson Beach Estates, Fla.

title: Penn State 2112 Victor Over W. Va.
description: MORGANTOWN, W. Va., Oct. 26 (AP)Penn State converted a pair of West Virginia errors into touchdowns as the 10thranked Nittany Lions downed the Mountaineers, 2112, today.

title: Consumption Has Been Cut, but Much More Is Needed
description: The greatest search for oil in history, for alternative sources to the Middle East fields where most of the world's known reserves now lie, is under way as a direct result of the quadrupled oil prices that have beggared many national economies in the past year.

title: Equus Makes A Star Of Firth
description: When Peter Firth, stark naked onstage at the Plymouth Theater, acts out the atrocity of blinding six horses, the impact on the audience is one of palpable terror. The scene, made all the more terrifying by the sounds of pain that accompany it, is one of the numbing peaks of Peter Shaffer's new play Equus, which opened last Thursday.

title: Remembering Anne Sexton
description: Yes! Yes! We'll live! Anne Sexton wrote in my copy of Live or Dieher third book of poems and the one that earned her the Pulitzer Prize. She wrote that inscription last June, only four months before she took her life on Oct. 4. 1974.

title: Liking People Key For Aspiring M.D.'s
description: NEWARK  The narrow, but crucial, difference between acceptance and rejection by New Jersey's medical college is often not the applicant's grades, but his interest in people.

title: DANCE VIEW
description: The Paul Taylor Dance Company's recent weeklong season at the Alvin Theater brought a rather surprising guest artist to Broadway: Rudolf Nureyev, dancing thhe leading role in Taylor's work Aureole. Nureyev is no stranger. to the piece. He has performed Aureole with the Royal Danish Ballet in Copenhagen and, even more daringly, with the Taylor Company itself, first in Mexico and last year in London. And of course Nureyev is no stranger to modemdance: the Moor in The Moor's Pavane has long been in his repertory, and he has had roles created for him by Glen Tetley and such European modernclassicists as Rudi Van Dantzig, Maurice Bjart and Roland Petit. But somehow for such a prince of the classic ballet to appear with an American company in New Yorkwell, it seemed just a little as if the Queen of England had confessed to the odd republican sentiment.

title: Pro Football No. 1 Scorer Is a Trooper
description: Question: the nation's hardest  running, highest  scoring professional football player is (A) O. J. Simpson; (B) Larry Csonka; (C) Mercury Morris; (D) a 21  year  old Toledo women? Answer: a 21yearold Toledo woman named Linda Jefferson, who, in two years as a halfback for the Toledo Troopers, has rushed 173 times for 2,174 yards (a 12.5 average) and has scored 43 touchdowns (every fourth. time she carries the ball).

title: Search for 2 Fliers Ends
description: SAN DIEGO, Oct. 26 (UPI) The Navy has called off the search for two pilots whose plane crashed off the California coast Thursday between San Clemente and the Santa Catalina Islands. Search craft located debris from the TA4 Skyhawk, which plunged into the Pacific carrying Lieut. Eric Johnson, 25 years old, of San Diego and Lieut. (j.g.) Paul E. Kane, 26, of Hamden, Conn.

title: Palestinian Is Accorded Full Rights
description: RABAT, Morocco, Oct. 28 One after another they emerged from their limousines: the presidents and premiers in dark business suits, the sultans and sheiks in flowing robes and, to the greatest applause of allYasir Arafat, the leader of the Palestine Liberation Organization.

title: He Is a Hockey Player, 17, Black and Convicted of Manslaughter
description: As a mirror reflection of American life, the most popular sport in America is professional football: brutal, precise, competitive and highly standardized. In football, as in much of American society, the competitor is The Enemy, and the allconsuming passion is to win, often at any cost.

title: Rockefeller Circle Gave Javits $38,050
description: Senator Jacob K. Javits, who has been criticized by his opponent for accepting a $18,000 campaign contribution from Nelson A. Rockefeller and refusing to disqualify himself from the vote on Mr. Rockefeller's confirmation for Vice President, has received $38,050 in contributions from Rockefeller family members and associates.

title: Richmond Taken, 417
description: BLACKSBURG, Va., Oct. 26 (UPI)Virginia Tech's quarterback, Bruce Arians ran for touchdowns of 5 and 7 yards and the Gobbler defense produced one touchdown and set up another today in a 417 rout of Richmond.

title: Foreclosure Begun At Queens Project
description: Foreclosure proceedings have begun against a major residential development under construction in Bayside, Queens, and the office of the State Attorney General has intervened in the financial negotiations over the project on behalf of condominium unit purchasers who are seeking refunds of their deposits.

title: Foreman Hits. 220, Ali 216 at WeighIn
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, Oct. 26 In the largest, loudest and latest weighin in heavyweight boxing history, the world champion George Foreman, tipped the scales at 220 pounds tonight and the challenger, Muhammad Ali, registered 216 pounds.

title: PATH Link Faces Reshaping
description: PLAINFIELDThe abrupt sidetracking of the longtalked  about PATH rapidtransit link between Newark and Plainfield opens the way for a possible drastic reshaping of plans, including the hopes for a better connection to Newark International Airport.

title: Pianist it A Passion For the New
description: Paul Jacobs, pianist, is playing a recital tonight at Alice Tully Hall and he is on the spot.

title: HORACE C. JEFFERS
description: Horace C. Jeffers, senior partner in the law firm of Jeffers & Dillon in Morristown, N. L, died yesterday in Morristown Memorial Hospital. He was 77 years old and lived in Flanders, N. J.

title: Recital
description: In the two decades that she has been performing in New York, Helen Boatwright has sung many kinds of music, but until Friday night she had not sung a lieder recital here. That gap she filled in at Town Hall by offering a program of lieder by Schumann, Wolf, Joseph Marx, Hermann Reutter and andCharles Ives.

title: Diana Kehrig Wed To Robert Walker
description: Diana Lydia Kehrig, a soprano with the New York City Opera, and Robert Charles, the company's financial administrator, were married yesterday afternoon in St. Thomas' Episcopal Church by the Rev. J. L. Douglas Ousley.

title: Richard Dreyfuss Has Already Written His Oscar Speech
description: Perhaps it is best to say right off that I despise the Sean  Connery  is  JamesBond syndrome (remember those awful advertisements?). In other words, I'm tired of reading about actors who supposedly are the characters they play. But after sitting in a Drake Hotel suite for three hours with the hottest actor of the year, Richard Dreyfuss, while he nervously scratches his head, and rubs his hands together, and cracks his knuckles, and chain smokes, and talks in machinegun bursts, and cackles like a hyena, all very intensely, it is, hard not to think, at least a little bit, that Richard Dreyfuss is Duddy Kravitz.

title: Design
description: When Larry Kramer, the writer and producer of the film, Women in Love, moved back to New York from abroad two years ago, he needed a place in which he could work and entertain and house his collection of books and records. His choice was a twobedroom apartment on Washington Square.

title: Finals an Issue at Ft. Lee High
description: FORT LEEFor five years now, seniors at Fort Lee High School have been exempt from yearend examinations in a policy that made the oncedreaded finals extinct. But last week, the local Board of Education indicated that it was having second thoughts on the policy and, after consultation with a committee of high school class officers, asked the administration to revise it.

title: Knicks Conquer Celtics
description: The longtime Boston CelticKnick rivalry sold out Madison Square Garden last night. But the crowd of 19,964 didn't see the real Celtics. And the Knicks weren't the same struggling Knicks. They overwhelmed Boston, 9786, for their third victory in five games.

title: Early Rain and Early Frost Are the 1974 Culprits in the U.S.
description: WASHINGTON  Although modern technology has profoundly transformed agriculture, the weather remains the dominant factor affecting yeartoyear variations in food output. For most of the past quartercentury, substantial food reserves have been buffer against the vagaries of climate, but those supplies are now depleted and the weather may replace pollution as the principal global environmental concern.

title: General Voted Ski Chief
description: STOCKHOLM, Oct. 26 (UPI) Gen. Stig Synnergren, the supreme commander of the Swedish armed forces was voted today, the chairman of the Swedish Ski Association. Synnergren, a ski fan for years, took office after Nils Stenberg declined a new term.

title: Enrollment Mark Set at Brookdale
description: LINCROFT  Brookdale Community College started its sixth academic year with the highest enrollment in its history. A total of 6,816 students enrolled for the fall term, representing a 5 per cent increase over last year, when 6,459 fulland parttime students enrolled.

title: The Comfort behind The Joy of Sex
description: Dr. George Goggins (Peter Sellers) and his lissome accomplice (would you believe Sophia Loren?) are running down the Mall from Buckingham Palace, in the garden of which the Ultimate Aphrodisiacenough to liberalize the superego of every man, woman and child on the earth's surfacehas just exploded. Behind them a great spreading throaty chuckle that grew to a roar and was punctuated by whoops, like rocks thrown up from a volcano as it moves into full activity, attests to the orgasmic liberation of the Sovereign and a thousand peers and bureaucrats, who were gathered for stuffedshirt ritual when the Molotov cocktail was hurled. Dr. Goggins has foreseen the import of this event:

title: Mark Wolfson to Wed Robin Fishner in June
description: Mr. and Mrs. Haney Fishner of Hackensack, N.J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Robin Sue Fishner to Mark Barry Wolfson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Herman Wolfson of Syosset, L.I.

title: Fiscal Experts See the City In Severe Financial Crisis
description: The government of New York City is in deeper economic trouble today than it has been in at any time since the Great Depression of the nineteenthirties.

title: BHUTTO REBUFFED ON MOSCOW VISIT
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 26  Prime Minister Zulfikar Ali Bhutto flew home today after three day of talks with the Soviet leaders, who refused to accept his proposal that South Asia be turned into a nuclearfree zone.

title: F.B.I. Data: How Much Is Too Much?
description: The policies of the Federal Bureau of Investigation for collecting and disseminating information are coming under significant outside review for the first time in the Bureau's history. During recent months Justice Department officials, Congressional committees and the General Accounting Office have begun inquiring into F.B.I. practices, generally with the cooperation of F.B.I. Director Clarence Kelley.

title: Zoot Sims Shares McKenna Spotlight At Michael's Pub
description: In his previous appearance at Michael's Pub, Dave McKenna, the jazz pianist, has been largely on his own  with, at the most, the accompaniment of bass and drums. During his current run at the East 55th Street restaurant, however, Mr. McKenna has been joined by Zoot Sims, the saxophonist, as well as by a bassist, Major Holly, and a drummer, Ray Mosca.

title: KENT JURY LEANS TO CONSERVATISM
description: CLEVELAND, Oct. 26  A jury molded in the conservative image of middle America will decide the guilt or innocence of eight former Ohio National Guardsmen charged in connection with the Kent State shootings of May 4, 1970.

title: U.S. and Soviet Officials See Joint Research Gains
description: WASHINGTON, Oct 26 (AP) American and Soviet officials involved in science and technology exchange programs announced today that substantial progress had been made.

title: North Stars Beaten As Defense Excels
description: UNIONDALE, L I. Oct. 26 The Islanders' dream line, a combination of players that would provide some scoring punch, materialized tonight as New York defeated the Minnesota North Stars, 4.0, before 12,331 fans in Nassau Coliseum.

title: Homosexual Church Accepted By Council
description: The Metropolitan Community Church in Brooklyn Heights, a church for homosexuals, was accepted unanimously last week as a member of the Brooklyn Division of the Council of Churches of the City of New York.

title: Ford Goes for a Swim and Walk at Camp David
description: THURMONT, Md., Oct. 26 (AP)President Ford spent a relaxing fall weekend at his Camp David, Md., mountaintop retreat. He went for a swim, this morning in the heated pool, and walked amid the fall foliage of the surrounding woods.

title: EVERS IS ACCUSED OF TAPPING FUNDS
description: JACKSON, Miss., Oct 26The Federal Government says it has evidence that Mayor Charles Evers of Fayette, Miss., diverted to his own use part of the more than $100,000 he collected for the Fayette Emergency Fund in a nationwide plea to help the small town pay its debts.

title: Silver, Pewter Back on Display
description: When the Brooklyn Museums encyclopedic collection of silverware and pewter went back on display recently after a fiveyear hiatus, the timing had more to do with shifting demands on museum space than with patriotism. But the glittering array of silver, pewter and toleware is an appropriate part of the museum's bicentennial program because many of the works are marked by distinctively American styles.

title: STOL Craft a Resort Asset
description: ATLANTIC CITY  Some day, the Penn Central Railroad may revive, the Nelly Bly, once a crack train between New York and this re. sort. Until then, tourists and convention delegateseven Miss America hopefulswill have to rely on their own cars, limousine services, buses or what are simply known as Allegheny Commuters.

title: Nets Rout Sounds as Kenon Stars
description: MEMPHIS, Oct. 26 (AP)Larry Kenon scored 25 points tonight to lead the New York Nets to a 10491 victory over the Memphis Sounds and their third straight triumph in the American Basketball Association.

title: Taft Turns Fumble Into Victory
description: KENT, Conn., Oct. 26With the score tied at 1414, Kent fumbled the ball today on its own 5yard line with a minute left in the game and Taft recovered. Three plays later, Jim Shepard plunged over from the 1yard line to give undefeated Taft its sixth victory, 2214.

title: St. Paul's Wins, 146
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L.I., Oct. 26A 15yearold freshman, Joe Proetta, was the difference as undefeated St. Paul's won its fifth game, 146, over Friends Academy It was the first loss for the home team in five contests.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: WINTER is still almost two months away, but it has already arrived on the economic sceneand is becoming more chilling with each passing day. Despite the contrary proclamations of the Administration's wordsmiths in Washington, a recession has indeed been under way in the American economy for at least the last 10 months and may not even be at its midpoint yet.

title: Arabs Urge Palestinians And Hussein to End Feud
description: RABAT, Morocco, Oct. 26The summit conference of Arab heads of state opened here today with an attack on American policies in the Middle East and an appeal to the Palestinians and King Hussein of Jordan to bury their differences.

title: MostFavoredNationhood
description: The prospect that the United States may reduce customs duties on imports from the Soviet Union under a tacit understanding about easier Soviet emigration has focused attention again on whether the Russians would take advantage of freer access to the American market by substantially increasing their exports.

title: Puccini, a hunter of good libretti
description: Enthusiasm runs high as the musical world celebrates the 50th anniversary of the death of Giacomo Puccini. Both the Metropolitan and the New York City Operas are devoting a whopping 25 per cent of their performances in the 197475 season to Puccini's works in tribute, says the Met, to this beloved composer. Students and Pucciniites have already raided the music libraries, and readers today find Puccini's space on the shelf between Prokofiev and Purcell bare of books.

title: East End Groin Plan Scored
description: The Army Corps of Engineers, with the approval of a Federal judge, plans to begin construction of six beach groins in Moriches Inlet off Westhampton Beach without obtaining an environmental impact statement for the project.

title: Jetport in Barrens Called Dead Issue
description: POMONA  Kemble Widmer, head of the state's Bureau of Geology, told the Pinelands Preservation Conference last week that the airlines have lost interest in the Pine Barrens and that a plan for an international jetport there was dead.

title: Retailers Attract Foreign Bargain Hunters
description: Early next month a troubled, longestablished American retailer, Bond Industries, which operates the Bond clothing stores, will be taken over by a Dutch holding company.

title: Digging London: VisitorVolunteers Join Archeological Effort
Wedding Ring Theft Suspect
description: NEW ORLEANS, Oct. 26 (UPI)The police said this week that they had arrested a man who entered a Woman's home on her 74th birthday and forced her to put soap and water on her hands so he could remove her $1,100 wedding ring. The police identified him as Harold Fedison Sr., 41, and said he had been charged with participating in an aggravated burglary at the home of Amalie Edwards.

title: Ballet: Bujones Excels in Coppelia
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 26The appearance of the great Latvian dancer Mikhail Baryshnikov with the American Ballet Theater has had a number of side effects, all, it seems, beneficial. It appears that the company's present season at the Kennedy Center is doing better at the box office than any of its predeassors. And the competition of the formidable Mr. Baryshnikov is proving salutary Mr his new American colleagues.

title: Lowering the Boom on the Vacation Tax Dodge
description: SAY you're a doctor, and you'd like to take a little trip to Acapulco. Or a lawyer, architect, engineer who's itching for a cozy Caribbean cruise or a tour of sunny Spain. You can get it tax deductible, courtesy of a loophole in the tax laws and clutch of specialized travel companies that operate educational tours.

title: Four novels
description: Pity the poor storyteller. With American literary taste captive to the academic bureaucracy and creative writing programs filling the land with taxsupported purists, unselfconscious vulgarity is increasingly hard to come by and the other kind even harder to live with.

title: Byrne Vetoes a Bill Requiring Newspapers to Publish Paid Notices of Acquittals
description: TRENTONThe idea was a simple one, Governor Byrne thought it was unconstitutional.

title: Growing up in prewar Ireland
description: Anyone expecting an archeological Gothic will be disappointed; others should be exbilarated by this short, elegiac novel from Ireeland. It is a story about two boys growing up in the Irish countryside just before the outbreak of World War I. Although they live in the same village they are worlds apart. Alexander Moore, who tells the story, is born into the landed gentry, the lonely child of a loveless marriage. With a ravishing bitch of a mother and an ineffectual, disappointed father, the boy soon withdraws into a kind of polite autism, numbly recording his circumstances: Their words rolled past me up and down the polished length of the table. Their conversations were always the same, like some terrible game ... They never raised their voices, the words dropped malevolent and cool from their wellbred mouths. Green ringlets of apple peel fell from my mother's fingers onto her plate.

title: Miss Wenk Bride Of Ensign Thomas
description: In the First Congregational Church in Old Greenwich, Conn., yesterday evening, Wendy Waycott Wenk, daughter of Mrs. Robb M. DeGraff of Wilmington, Del., and Robert A. Wenk of Stamford, Conn., became the bride of Ensign David Elmore Thomas, U.S.N.

title: Elizabeth Hayes, Will Be a Bride
description: Mr. and Mrs. Thomas CVton Hayes Jr. of Charlotte, N.C., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Elizabeth Spencer Hayes, to Edward Allen Prichard, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Prichard Jr. of Versailles, Ky.

title: Two That Tease But Only One That Works
