title: Chou Meets Aide of Hanoi
description: PEKING, Oct. 27 (Agence FrancePresse)Premier Chou Enlai received deputy Premier Le Thanh Nghi of North Vietnam in a Peking hospital today, Hsinhua, the official press agency, reported.

title: Clark Accuses Javits of Failing To Provide Moral Leadership
description: Ramsey Clark, the Democratic candidate for the United States Senate, kept up his attacks yesterday on Senator Jacob K. Javits, charging him with failure to provide moral leadership, while the incumbent Senator campaigned in a low key in appearances at a Manhattan synagogue and at Coop City.

title: And Now, the High Cost of TrickorTreat
description: Climbing sugar prices have sent candy prices spiraling to as much as twice as high as they were last Year, and to Thursday night's marauding Halloween hobgoblins and witches, this may mean skimpy pickings of trickortreat sweets.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 33

title: CASE IS SETTLED BY WADDELL & REED
description: KANSAS CITY, Oct. 27 (AP)  Waddell & Reed, Inc., of Kansas City, manager of one of the country's largest groups of mutual investing funds, has agreed to pay $1million into them in settlement of a fraud complaint brought by the Federal Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: NEW DOCTOR ASKS MORE NIXON TESTS
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Oct 27 A new consulting surgeon recommended today that former President Richard M. Nixon undergo `further relatively sophisticated tests to determine whether he needs an operation to prevent lifethreatening complications from blood clots in his phlebitisdamaged left leg.

title: Zionist Group Headed By New York Woman
description: BOSTON, Oct. 27Faye Schenk of New York was elected president today of the American Zionist Federation, which represents Zionist groups in the United States. She succeeds Rabbi Israel Miller of New York, who has assumed the post of chairman of the Conference of Presidents of Major American Jewish Organizations.

title: Third Suspect Is Jailed In Killing of State Trooper
description: ONEIDA, N.Y., Oct. 27 (AP) A 34yearold Queens man was arrested today in connection with the murder of a State trooper last week. He was the third New York City man to be charged with the crime.

title: 2,577 Row In Charles River Event
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Oct. 27The Head of the Charles, one of the largest singleday participant sporting events in the world, took place today on the Charles River with competitors from as far away as Nebraska and Florida. A total of 2,577 competed.

title: Briefs On The Arts
description: The International Business Machines Corporation has agreed to underwrite a bicentennial exhibition, America on Stage, opening in the middle of next year at the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts. Refleeting the history and development of the performing arts in the United States from colonial days to the present, the display, to be housed in the center's Atriurn and the North Gallery, will cover theater, dance and music. It is expected to be the most extensive exhibition since the center opened in 1971, according to Roger L. Stevens, chairman of Kennedy Center. Gene Baro will be project director. Designers of the exhibition are Staples & Charles of Washington.

title: India Seeking New Medicines To Combat Revived Diseases
description: NEW DELHI, Oct. 27India is desperately seeking new drugs to combat smallpox, cholera, malaria and tuberculosis, cases of which are increasing at an alarming rate and defying traditional vaccines and medicines.

title: Weather Reports and Forecast
description: Mostly sunny skies and slightly warmer temperatures are forecast for the Northeast and Middle Atlantic States, while partly cloudy skies and cooler temperatures are expected across the upper Mississippi Valley, the Southern and Central Plains States through the northern Rockies and the Pacific Northwest. Scattered showers are expected to develop in the western Ohio Valley and also in the Central Plains States. Rain is also expected from the Plateau Region to the Rockies and the Pacific Northwest.

title: Massapequa Tops West Hills in Polo
description: WEST HILLS. L. I., Oct. 27 The Massapequa women's polo team defeated West Hills, 43, today in the Cornell challenge match. Massapequa will meet Cornell for the championship at Ithaca Nov. 22.

title: Penalties Hurt in 2013 Defeat
description: The Jets, who from time to time have paid a few pennies for their outspoken thoughts on officiating have not played well enough this season to cry about the officials in their laughable losses.

title: British Football
description: By Reuters

title: Watergate's Third Crime
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27The man who appointed himself to be judge of the Watergate trial announced from the bench last week that he was not trying to try this case on strict rules of evidence.

title: News Summary and Index MONDAY, OCTOBER 28, 1974
description: International

title: Food Shortage Is Linked To Nixon's farm Policies
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27 (AP) The National Farmers Union says farm policies carried out in the first five years of the Nixon Administration are directly responsible for the present world food shortage and threatened famines.

title: Beame Praises Role Of Women in Business
description: About 500 people attending ceremonies dedicating the Joseph C. Nugent Building at Marymount Manhattan College yeserday heard Mayor Beame say he was delighted to see the growing influx of women into business careers.

title: 2 Independents Seek Seat From 9th District
description: Two independents are running for Congress in the Ninth DistrictHerbert H. Shaw, a 44year old operating engineer from North Bergen whose namet wil appear on the ballot with the slogan Politicians Are Crooks, and Robert W. Funsch, a 42yearold academician from Englewood who says right now we need honesty in government.

title: Cowboys Win, 217; Morton Impressive
description: NEW HAVEN, Oct. 27 Craig Morton pumped life into the New York Giants' offense today, but Drew Pearson, a wide receiver, threw the surprising pass that produced the crucial points in the Dallas Cowboys' 217 victory at Yale Bowl.

title: POLICE FORCE PUT ON BOMBING ALERT
description: City detectives from the bomb section worked around the clock yesterday, sifting debris and fragments from the sites of the five bombings that shook banking and corporate centers in Manhattan early Saturday.

title: Trudeau's Wife, on TV, Tells of Emotional Crisis
description: OTTAWA, Oct. 27In a candid interview for a Canadian television program tonight, Margaret Trudeau told how the frightening strains of being the young wife of a Prime Minister had contributed to her recent hospitalization for psychiatric treatment.

title: Coaches Who Ruts Up Scores: Some Regretful, Some Ebullient
description: Some college coaches profess sorrow and anguish when their teams run all over opponents and then some openly admit happiness with onesided victories that prove nothing but doubtlessly help recruiting bigger and better players who will run up future scores.

title: Most Markets Open
description: Stock exchanges and most major commodity markets will be open as usual today, Veterans Day. Federal agencies and post offices will be closed, as will banks in New Jersey. Banks in Ne York and Connecticut, however, will remain open as those states, and 39 others, will observe Veterans Day on Nov. 11, its traditional date.

title: About New York
description: There is a folklore about shopping on the Lower East Side, and while the folklore has changed over the years, the quality of the folklore has not.

title: Stockton Triumphs In Australia
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Oct. 27 (AP)Dick Stockton, a fastrising young American tennis star, won the South Pacific hardcourt tennis tournament today, beating Geoff Masters of Australia, 62, 63, 62.

title: Phoebe Jonas Married
description: Phoebe Ann Jonas, dough ter of Mr. and Mrs. Leonard Jonas of Woodmere, L. I., was married last evening to William Thomas Flynn, son of Mrs. Monte Kromberg of Hewlett, L. I., and the late Edward B. Flynn of Hewlett. The ceremony was performed at the Inwood (L. I.) Country Club by Rabbi Allen Block.

title: Karriot S. Curtis, Golfer Set Up Cup Prize in 1932
description: BOSTON, Oct. 27 (AP)Harriot Sumner Curtis, a former national golf champion and a civilrights activist, died Friday at her home in Manchester, Mass. She was 93 years old.

title: Zack Clayton Is Candidate For Referee
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, Oct. 27 Zack Clayton, the chairman of the Pennsylvania Athletic Commission and a longtime referee, loomed today as the foremost candidate to be the referee for the George ForemanMuhammad All world heavyweight championship fight here Wednesday morning (Tuesday night in New York).

title: Pomeranian Get Toy Dog Award
description: Ch. Fancy Gold Dancer of Oakridge, a 1yearold Pomeranian owned by Mrs. Walter M. Jeffords Jr. and Michael Wolf of Christiana, Pa., took the top award yesterday at the Progressive Dog Show.

title: Unbeaten Team In 7th Victory
description: ST. LOUIS, Oct. 27In the Cardinals' locker room, a joyful one after a 2320 victory today over the Redskins, Ernie McMillan was telling how great it is to play on this St. Louis team compared with the 13 others he's been aboard. We've got good people, enthusiastic people, said the 36yearold, 255pound offensive tackle who lost 25 pounds for this good season.

title: 2 Districts in City to Hold Special Elections Today
description: In response to court challen ges the Board of Elections wil hold special primary elections today for Democratic candi dates in the 68th Assembly District on the Upper East Sid( and in the 72d Assembly Dis trict in East Harlem. Polls it the two districts will open al 6 A.M. and close at 9 P.M.

title: WILLIAM C. SEITZ, ART SCHOLAR, DIES
description: Dr. William Chapin Seitz, art scholar, professor and former curator at the Museum of Modern Art here, died Saturday night of cancer at Martha Jefferson Hospital in Charlottesville, Va. He was 60 years old.

title: BENNETT SIEGELSTEIN
description: Bennett E. Siegelstein, a reAired New York lawyer and an Assemblyman in 190304, died Saturday in Miami Beach, where he lived. His age was 93.

title: Stage: Noonan's Where Do We Go From Here?
description: There are indubitably some dangerously hilarious moments in John Ford Noonan's Where Do We Go From Here?, which opened last night at the Newman Theater in the New York Shakespeare Festival's complex on Lafayette Street. The moments are hilarious because they will make you laugh, and dangerous because you might be deluded into thinking you were seeing a better play than you actually are.

title: SOVIET BALLERINA SEEKS TO CO WEST
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 27Kaleriya Fedicheva, a leading ballerina in the Kirov company of Leningrad, is seeking to emigrate to the West, having married an American dancer, but is being blocked by Soviet authorities, who also allegedly tried to thwart her marriage, friends disclosed tonight.

title: PARENTS ANGERED BY SCHOOL STRIKE
description: LONG BRANCH, Oct. 27Parents, angered by the virtual shutdown of this city's school system for a week, met with teachers today and then began to organize an effort to move the Board of Education toward a settlement with three striking unions.

title: 5 of 22 Hostages Freed by Convicts In a Dutch Prison
description: THE HAGUE, Oct. 27Fou?? armed convicts, one of them a Palestinian guerrilla, today released five of the 22 hostages they had been holding in the chapel of a prison in Scheven ingen, near the Hague, since last night.

title: Race Walk to Kniston
description: The 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A. sponsored the 20kilometer (12 miles) race walk in Central Park yesterday as part of its 100th anniversary. and the winner in the field of 35 competitors was Dr. John Kniston of the New York Athletic Club. His time for the twolap circle around the park was 1 hour 36 minutes 29.6 seconds. Second was Ray Somers, also of the New York A. C., in 1:36.52 and third was Dave Romansky of the Shore A, C., 1:37.46.

title: Puerto Rican Freedom
description: The five bombs exploded in Manhattan over the weekend will damage the cause of independence for Puerto Rico far more than they damaged the banks and other properties in the target areas. It is worth noting that the official Independence party in Puerto Rico, which polled only 4 per cent of the votes in the last elections, promptly dissociated itself from the bombings and also disavowed the Puerto Rican independence rally in Madison Square Garden yesterday.

title: The Bishops Rebuffed
description: ROME, Oct. 27The second Vatican Council, that great assembly of all Roman Catholic bishops called together in 1962 by Pope John XXIII and concluded in 1965 under Paul VI, proclaimed the principle of collegiality, that the bishops together with the Pope have supreme and full power over the universal church.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: BRONX GIRL, 16, HELD IN MOTHER'S KILLING
description: A 16yearold girl allegedly stabbed her mother to death yesterday during a dispute in bar in the Bronx and then put up a struggle with the two police officers who arrested her, the police said.

title: Advertising
description: Top executives of some of the largest advertising agencies see the fourth quarter shaping up as pretty good.

title: An EverPlagued King Hussein ibn Talal
description: RABAT, Morocco, Oct. 27 When King Hussein of Jordan arrived at the opening session of the Arab summit conference here yesterday, he drew a burst of warm applause from the crowd assembled outside the conference hall. Looking pleased and mildly surprised by the enthusiastic reception, he broke into a wide grin and waved as he strode up the red carpet and into the hall. Given his ambiguous position in the Arab world, the King could just as easily have been booedor worse. It would not have been the first times.

title: Poll Finds Economy and Taxes Are the Voters' Main Worries
description: The low state of the economy and the high state of taxes are strongly preoccupying New Yorkers who next week will be choosing a Governor, a United States Senator, the state's 39 Congressmen and all 210 members of both houses of the Legislature.

title: Carol Weisbein Bride of Dr. Spero
description: Carol Weisbein, a psychiatric social worker and faculty staff member of the Albert Einstein College of Medicine, was married at noon yesterday to Dr. Gary N. Spero, a psychiatrist here.

title: Greek Premier Pledges Closer Ties With West
description: SALONIKA, Greece, Oct. 27 (AP) Premier Constantine Caramanlis told a crowd of 100,000 today that his government would strengthen Greece's ties with Western Europe because history and ideological orientation place her in the West.

title: Miniature Golf Course to Replace Juice Bar in East Side Building
description: The Department of Consumer Affairs has granted a license for operation of an 18hole miniature golf course inside an East Side Building that once housed a juice bardiscothque that aroused the anger of residents of the neighborhood.

title: WILLIAM ACKERMAN, U.S. RESEARCH AIDE
description: William C. Ackerman, since 1972 assistant coordinator of research of the Congressional Research Service of the Library of Congress, died Saturday in Washington. He was 66 Oars old and lived in Bethesda, Md.

title: Jersey vs. Port Agency
description: When the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey announced 10 days ago that it was temporarily shelving a proposed $300million extension of PATH, New Jersey officials denounced the decision. Their reaction, however, was motivated not just by concern for the future of the railroad but also by their longstanding fear that the Port Authority was trying to get out of its pledge to help the state with all its transit problems.

title: Drivers Vote to Return
description: LORDSTOWN, Ohio, Oct. 27 (AP)About 400 striking drivers at Anchor Motor Freight voted today to return to their jobs and end a walkout that has snarled the delivery of 5,000 Chevrolet Vegas at the Chevrolet assembly plant here.

title: Buffalo, Once So Proud, Is in a Financial Crisis
description: BUFFALO,  A city on the brink of bankruptcy, like a family in financial straits, does what it can to make ends meet. It looks for new sources of revenue while cutting costs at home. In Buffalo, this has had some bizarre results.

title: MANSFIELD, SIMON SPLIT ON ECONOMY
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 27Secretary of the Treasury William E. Simon predicted today that the postelection Congress would pass legislation taxing away some of the windfall profits of the oil industry but Mike Mansfield, the Senate majority leader, predicted it would not.

title: Bridge: Cayne and McKellar Teams Pitted in. Knockout Play Here
description: Teams captained by Jim Cayne of New York City and Arch McKellar of Millwood, N.Y., clashed here yesterday in the final of the Regional Knockout Team Championship, at the New York Hilton.

title: Chess: Karpov Grinds Toward Victory As He Takes Another Draw
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 27  Although Anatoly Karpov ran the string of moves out to 67 in the adjourned 16th game of the final Candidates Match for the world championship yesterday, he could make no use of the advantage he enjoyed when play broke off Friday night and he had to agree to a draw with Viktor Korchnoi here in the Central Chess Club.

title: Sports Today
description: BOXING

title: Voluntary Mental Groups Ask More Planning Power
description: Many of the city's outstanding voluntary agencies, in sharp criticism of the State Department of Mental Hygiene, have opened a drive to force the department to give them more power in planning services for the mentally handicapped.

title: The Ballet: Cinderella
description: In his own quiet way, Andre Eglevsky is a cultural resource that serves both the public and the ballet dancers who make New York their home. His Eglevsky Ballet Company dances extensively in the counties surrounding the city, providing excellently conceived productions of classics and allowing people to see New Yorkbased dancers whose companies do not tour locally. On Saturday he presented Cinderella in Suffern, Rockland County, with the musical support of the Hudson Valley Philharmonic.

title: British Football
description: RUGBY LEAGUE

title: PROF. JOHN P. HUGHES
description: Dr. John P. Hughes, professor of linguistics at St. Peter's College, died Saturday in Doylestown (Pa.) Hospital of a heart attack. He was 54 years old and lived in Doylestown.

title: Buffalo, Once So Proud, Is in a Financial Crisis
description: BUFFALOA city on the brink of bankruptcy, like a family in financial straits, does what it can to make ends meet. It looks for new sources of revenue while cutting costs at home. In Buffalo, this has had some bizarre results.

title: Elizabeth Blum Wed in Suburb
description: Elizabeth Ann Blum, who is completing work on a doctorate in psychology at New York University, was married yesterday afternoon to Dr. Henry Berger, a psychologist in Scarsdale, N. Y.

title: Group Near Columbia Prefers Its Garage to a Public Library
description: A community group in Morningside Heights, putting its parking convenience and safety above the scholarly life to characteristic of the neighborhood, has won reconsideration of a city plan to replace an allnight garage with a new branch library.

title: U.S. SEEN LAGGING IN ASIAN BANK AID
description: MANILA  As far as the Asian Development Bank is concerned, the United States has cast itself in the role of a begrudging exspouse who is always behind in his alimony payments.

title: Salmonella. Found In Cider Produced At Montvale Farm
description: State Health Department officials have reported an outbreak of salmonella poisoning in residents who said they had drunk apple cider produced at De Piero's Farm in Montvale.

title: Christopher Wins At The Hill Show
description: NORTH SALEM, N.Y., Oct. 27Christopher, a 6yearold bay gelding owned and ridden by Kelli Cleavenger of Arcadia, Calif., scored 10 points to win the localworking hunter championship today at the concluding session of the twoday The Hill horse show.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: Manhattan Democrats Face Easy Congressional Rapes
description: I wouldn't exactly say that Pm the underdog, Representative Edward I. Koch said the other day, assessing his chances for reelection in the 18th Congressional District on the East Side.

title: Candidates Across U.S. Focus on Ecology
description: In New York, rival aspirants for the United States Senate vie in displaying concern for the environment. In Alaska, differing views about oil pipeline development resound. In California, candidates are questioned about their positions on a controversial dam. In Hawaii, debate simmers over proposals to limit growth.

title: Rises in U.S. Crops Of Potatoes and Rice Cut Domestic Costs
description: Increased crop harvests throughout the country last summer hails cut domestic potato prices in half and brought a 20 per dent reduction in the cost of rice, both of which had risen sharply last year, when worldwide shortages made the export market more lucrative.

title: FEW OIL CONCERNS IN JAPAN PROFIT
description: TOKYO, Oct. 27Japan's oil companies, in sharp contrast to highly profitable United States oil concerns, have been taking heavy losses since the oil crisis began a year ago.

title: Trudeau's Wife, on TV, Tells of Emotional Crisis
description: OTTAWA, Oct. 27In a candid interview for a Canadian television program tonight, Margaret Trudeau told how the frightening strains of being the young wife of a Prime Minister had contributed to her recent hospitalization for psychiatric treatment.

title: Quilts Mde of Castoff Jeans
description: It's like sleeping under a blanket of stars. That's how Jane Gersten describes her handmade, starappliqued denim quilts.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The owner of a West Side liquor store was killed by holdup men early yesterday as he left with the night's receipts.

title: MERGER DEAL SET BY GENERAL MILLS
description: General Mills, Inc., the diversified food company, and the General Interiors Corporation, a furniture maker, announced an agreement in principle last night to merge the two companies.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Oct. 27The way Frank Elm figures it, he's now where he should have been 13 years ago. Elm was named coach recently of the new intercollegiate women's swimming team at Rutgers.

title: Sabres Win on Rebound
description: BUFFALO, Oct. 27 (UPI)A puck that bounced off a Buffalo rookie, Danny Gare, into the Montreal net tonight helped the Sabres to a 32 victory over the Canadiens in a National Hockey League gime.

title: Concert: Trifles as Gems
description: Since the Concentus Musicus of Vienna stands for what may be the most nearly authentic performances of Baroque music one can hear nowadays, and since there are untold numbers of music lovers who care for such things, it was hardly surprising that Tully Hall was filled Saturday night for the Austrian ensemble's concert there.

title: Hussein and Arafat Seek Showdown at Arab Talks
description: RABAT, Morocco, Oct. 27King Hussein of Jordan and the Palestinian leader Yasir Arafat, taking equally adamant positions, told Arab leaders today that they had to choose between them and could not hope for a compromise in their conflict.

title: GROUP SCORES U.S. ON FUND SNARING
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 27 The American Jewish Committee accused the Federal Government today of using revenuesharing funds as a way avoiding its responsibilities the poor and to minority groups.

title: Quarter Nets Up Average of 28% At 853 Concerns
description: Corporate net profits of 853 corporations exceeded $9billion in the third quarter, an average gain of 28 per cent over the yearago period, according to economists of the First National City Bank.

title: WILLIAM E. TAYLOR
description: William E. Taylor, a vice president of the Garfinckel division of Garfinckel, Brooks Bros., Miller & Rhoas, Inc., department and specialty stores, died yesterday in a Washington hospital. He was 52 years old and lived in Washington.

title: Shipments at Highs For Machine Tools, Both New and Used
description: The machine tool industry continued its recordbreaking pace through September, according to figures released over the weekend by the National Machine Tool Builders' Association.

title: KISSINGER LEAVES MOSCOW HOPEFUL ON ARMS ACCORD
description: NEW DELHI, Oct. 27Secretary of State Kissinger left Moscow today believing that his three days of talks with Leonid I. Brezhnev had moved the United States and the Soviet Union substantially closer to a longsought formula for limiting still further their arsenals of strategic missiles and bombers.

title: Bhutto Home From Soviet
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Oct. 27 (Reuters)Prime Minister Zulfikar Ali Bhutto returned here today after a visit to the Soviet Union, which he said would help Pakistan establish better relations with her neighbors and other nations. He had stopped over for a day in Teheran on the way home.

title: Frederick A. O. Schwarz Dies; Senior Partner in Polk, Davis
description: Frederick A. O. Schwarz, senior partner in the New York law firms of Davis, Polk & Wardwell, died yesterday of cancer at his home here. He was 72 years old.

title: Poll Finds Added Worry On Crime and Its Control
Statements on Credit In Skanish Proposed
description: The city's Department of Consumer Affairs has proposed regulation that would require merchants to give Spanishspeaking customers a written explanation in Spanish of all credit transactions.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: While everyone recognizes that an antiinflationary program will require suffering, all potentially effective programs are enmeshed in controversy over how the suffering is to be shared. To overcome this impasse, both Congress and the President should make clear that the first priority is to stop the inflation with a minimum of overall suffering, and the second is to allocate that suffering fairly. I propose the following method.

title: CITY TO TAKE OVER 3 SCHOOL REGIONS IN FISCAL TROUBLE
description: For the first time since the start of school decentralization in 1970, the city's central Board of Education is planning to take over the fiscal management of at least three local districts because of abuses and loose practices that, it says, may have resulted in the waste or misuse of millions of dollars.

title: Theater: Gertrude Stein, With Music
description: Al Carmine's musical version of Gertrude Stein's Listen to Me is a play on words, particularly on words of one syllable, as in the statementnot a questionWhat is a word of one syllable. The subsurface, deeply buried, has to do with people in pairs, specifically a couple named Sweet William and Lillian. The surface is a primer lessonan exercisein linguistics, with sidelong comments about the dissimulating aspects of theater. Curtain, says an actress and there is curtain.

title: LNG Spheres Delayed
description: The PittsburghDes Moines Steel Company said ysterday in Pittsburgh, that it had run into substantial delays in fabricating liquefied natural gas spheres for the General Dynamics Corporation under a $110million contract.

title: Poll Finds 60% Are Critical Of U.S. Intervention in Chile
description: The American public believes it was wrong of the United States to intervene in Chile and try to destabilize the Govenunent, a Harris poll survey yesterday indicated. Sixty per cent of a sample opposed the action, 18 per cent supported it and the rest had no opinion.

title: Chess: Monday Illness Again Strikes Karpov, Delaying the Match
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 28 For the second time, the official physician for the final candidates match for the world championship granted Anatoly Karpov a postponement. Thus the game between Karpov and Viktor Korchnoi, which had been schduled for 5 P.M. today was reset for the same time Wednesday.

title: Bengala Waive Ernst
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 28 (UPI)The Cincinnati Bengals, waived Mike Ernst, thirdstring quarterback, today just a few hours after he was charged with possession of a narcotic. Cincinnati police spokesman, Tom Brinkmoeller, said the narcotic was listed in the police report as cocaine.

title: PIANO GRACE SHOWN BY BROOKS IN DEBUT
description: There were so many admirable qualities in the playing of Robert Brooks, a young midwestern pianist who made his New York debut at Town Hall on Saturday, that it almost seems petulant to carp about his limitations. His schooling is excellent, his approach is direct and unmannered, he can produce the most graceful of keyboard tones, his playing is briskly articulated, dependably accurate. One guesses that he is a superior chamber musician.

title: Labor and A.M.A. Top List In '74 Spending on Politics
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 (AP) The political trust run by the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Orgapizations has spent $1.4million on politics this year, Its latest campaign finance reports show.

title: LEVITT AUDIT FAULTS PROCESSING OF TAXES
description: Cdetroller Arthur Levitt issued an audit report yesterday indicating that the state was losing hundreds of thousands of dollars a year because of slugg?? by the State Bank of Amy in processing income tax withholding payments.

title: Nixon to Have Surgery This Morning
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Oct. 28 Former President Richard M. Nixon will undergo urgent surgery at 5:30 A.M. Pacific standard time (8:30 A.M. New York time) tomorrow to clamp off a vein in his thigh, and thereby prevent a clot from running away and lodging in his lung, Mr. Nixon's doctors said tonight.

title: Ford Signs Bill to Study Foreign Investing in U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 (AP)President Ford signed a bill today that provides for comprehensive studies of foreign investments in the United States.

title: Impresarios Differ On Fight TV Gate
description: The George ForemanMuhammad All fight in Zaire tonight will make the Guineas Book of World Records as either the best or the worst in regard to the television gate.

title: CLASSIFIED ADVERTISING INDEX
description: Page

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Steelers Conquer Falcons
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 28 (AP) With Terry Bradshaw back at quarterback and Franco Harris rushing for 141 yards and the winning touchdown, the Pittsburgh Steelers posted a 2417 victory over the Atlanta Falcons in the National Football League tonight.

title: Jet Definition of Depression: 7 More Games to Go
description: The Jets have completed the first half of their dismal season and the most depressing prospect facing them is they have another half to go.

title: EXPORTS FROM U.S. TO SOVIET INCREASE
description: A survey by the Conference Board reported yesterday that exports from the United States to the Soviet Union jumped from $162million in 1971 to $1.2billion last year. Exports to Communist China in 1972, following dtente with Peking, were above $60million and rose sharply to $680million last year. Before 1972, United States exports to China were negligible. Imports to the United States from the Communist countries also increased in the period, thought not quite so spectacularly.

title: Panel Debates Artists Rights, From Income Tax to Royalties
description: Would paying artists royalties on the resale of their work adversely affect the market for their art?

title: Butz Assails Restrictive Food Actions
description: Secretary of Agriculture Earl L. Butz, charged here yesterday that the Interstate Commerce Commission, Congress, the Administration and business were pursuing and advocating restrictive practices that hamper full food production and the stabilization of food prices.

title: New MigrantWorker Bill Would Make Farmers Supervise Their Crew Chiefs
description: The adoption last week of a bill to regulate migrantworker crew leaders has set the/stage for a showdown on a more sweeping measure that would place ultimate responsibility for crew leaders' activities on the farmers who employ them.

title: Patriot Sacrifices Knee in Triumph
description: Should the New England Patriots reach the Super Bowl in January, and they appear to have as good a chance as anyone right now they are sure to vote a full share of the spoils to Bob Windsor, theis tight end who will not be with them that day. Windsor sacrifioed one knee to the cause on Sunday in Bloomington, Minn., as the Patriots upset the Vikings 1714, for what one Boston writer described as the greatest victory in the history of the franchise.

title: ARAB LEADERS ISSUE CALL FOR A PALESTINIAN STATE; ARAFAT GIVEN MAIN ROLE
description: RABAT, Morocco, Oct. 28Arab heads of state, including King Hussein of Jordan, called unanimously today for the creation of an independent Palestinian state on any Palestinian land that is liberated from Israeli occupation.

title: CITY TO TAKE OVER3 SCHOOL REGIONSIN FISCAL TROUBLE
description: For the first time since the start of school decentralization in 1970, the city's central Board of Education is planning to take over the fiscal management of at least three local districts because of abuses and loose practices that, it says, may have resulted in the waste or misuse of millions of dollars.

title: Reporter's Notebook: Kissinger and Leningrad Affair
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 27  As Secretary of State Kissinger arrived for lunch at the United States Ambassador's residence here, he was asked jokingly by an American newsman whether the rumors were true that he had been meeting with Leonid I. Brezhnev for the last three days.

title: Veterans Day for Some
description: The sunny skies and warm temperatures made it a glorious day for a parade yesterday, but, there were no marching bands, streaming flags or cheering crowds along Fifth Avenue to celebrate Veterans Day.

title: SOVIET SPACESHIP SENT TOWARD MOON
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 28 (Reuters) The Soviet Union launched today another in its series of unmanned spaceships, the press agency Tass reported.

title: Shipping/Mails All Hours Given In Easterr Standard Times
description: Today, Oct. 29

title: F.D.U. 41 Soccer Victor
description: TEANECK, N. J., Oct. 28 Ruben Molinares, a sophomore forward, scored two goals today to lead undefeated Fairleigh Dickinson University to a 41 soccer victory over Rutgers.

title: Seymour E. Harris, Economist And Adviser to Presidents, Dies
description: LA JOLLA, Calif., Oct. 28 (UPI)Dr. Seymour E. Harris, an influential political economist and adviser to Presidents Kennedy and Johnson, died yesterday at Veterans Hospital in San Diego. He was 77 years old.

title: HEARSTS REJECTED MICKEY COHEN OFFER
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 28 (UPI)The parents of Patricia Burst rejected an offer to have underworld figures bring the young fugitive back by force because they had found the plans too dangerous, an attorney for the Hearst family said today.

title: 4 Seized, 5th Sought in Slaying Of Bronx Youth in White Plains
description: WHITE PLAINS, Oct. 28 (UPI) Four men were arrested early today in connection with the murder of a 19yearold Bronx youth whose. bullet riddled body was found last week floating in a stream here.

title: State MentalHealth Chief Rows to TaskForce Plea
description: Dr. Alan D. Miller, the State Commissioner of Mental Hygiene, acceded yesterday to the demand of a statewide mentalhealth task force that he appear on Thursday before an emergency meeting scheduled by the task force without permission of the state agency.

title: Lugar Gives Bayh Tough Race for Indiana Senate Seat
description: NEW ALBANY, Ind., Oct. 28 When Mayor Richard G. Lugar of Indianapolis was introduced last week to the 200 members of the Southern Indiania Home Builders Association, they applauded loudly and (third of them rose and applaud. ed even harder.

title: Writ of Habeas Corpus Sought In New Effort to Free Sherwin
description: FREEHOLD, Oct. 28Representative James J. Howard, Democrat of the Third District nursed a cold for several day?? after Congress recessed this month and kept his campaign talks brief.

title: 78Car Crash in Kuwait Fog
description: KUWAIT, Oct. 28 (Reuters) Seventyeight cars collided on a fogbound road north of here yesterday, injuring 15 people, officials reported today.

title: Vasquez Outpoints Large at Forum
description: Davey Vasquez of the Bronx, the eighth  ranked bantamweight in the world, survived a knockdown in the opening minute of the first round last night at the Felt Forum to score Lunanimoue 10round decision over Earl Large of Clovis, New. Mexico.

title: STUDENTS IN SEOUL ROUTED BY TEAR GAS
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Oct. 28 (AP)Policemen used tear gas against 2,000 students today as thousands of other protestors demonstrated against the Government. No injuries or arrests were reported.

title: Bridge: 2 Star and 4 young Experts Win Regional Team Tourney
description: Two established, stars, teamed with four lesserknown young experts to win the Metropolitan Regional Knockout Team Championship at the New York Hilton Hotel here Sunday. The winners were Jim Cayne and Peter Weichsel of New York, both winners of many international titles, together with Weichsel's wife, Nancy, Carl Lindcnman of New York, Jim Rosenbloom of Scarsdale, N. Y., and Steve Sion of Boston.

title: Gold Price Climbs To FiveMonth High In London Trading
description: BRUSSELS, Oct. 28 (UPI)Gold continues its weeklong climb today, soaring to another fivemonth high on the London bullion market, where it closed $4.50 higher than Friday, at $168 an ounce.

title: Hunger in U.S. a Problem of Want Amid Plenty
description: SWEET HOME, Ark.The house was a faded gray, squatting in the dust beside crumbling macadam street.

title: Cyprus Greeks, EmptyHanded, Go Home to Unknown
description: ABOARD THE PATRA, En Route to Cyprus, Oct. 28As long as we find four walls and a roof to shelter the kids, that will be enough, said Panayotis Prokopiou as he gazed out at the rainspattered deck. We do believe there's no place like homeno matter what the home is like.

title: ITALIANS PRESSED BY REDS' LEADER
description: ROME, Oct. 28The secretary of Italy's Communist party, Enrico Berlinguer, today challenged Italy's political establishment either to find an effective solution to the country's problems,or accept his Party's proposals for a method of government.

title: 2 Assembly Candidates Win in Special Elections
description: Two Manhattan candidates, candidates, whose victories in the September Democratic primary were voided after legal challenges, won their races by increased margins yesterday in special courtordered elections.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Wrecked Plane Found in Inlet

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Indians Occupying a Camp Shoot Girl, 9
description: EAGLE BAY, N.Y., Oct. 28 (AP)Two white persons, including a 9yearold girl, were shot and wounded tonight after Indians occupying a camp near here shot at passing automobiles they claimed had fired at them.

title: STEELE EXPECTING NEW U.S. OIL PLAN
description: HARTFORD, Oct. 28Representative Robert H. Steele, who has sued the United States to equalize oil prices in various parts of the country, said he expected the Ford Administration to announce tomorrow a program doing just that.

title: Sandman's Aggressive Defense of Nixon Imperils His Chances of Reelection
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Oct. 28Charles W. Sandman Jr., the Republican Representative who was Richard M. Nixon's most pugnacious apologist, is in setons danger of being unseated in next week's Second CongresSional District election because of his defense of the former President.

title: SAUDI CUT IN PRICE OF OIL IS AWAITED
description: RABAT, Morocco, Oct. 28Saudi Arabia plans to announce shortly a modest reduction in the price of her oil and the freezing of the price at the new level for a year an informed Arab source said here today.

title: U.S. Wins Backgammon Cup
description: After three days of play in London in the finals for the world cup for backgammon, the Americans yesterday won 24 to 12. England nearly caught up with the Americans halfway through, but finally admitted defeat in the sixth round. The Americans, captained by Barclay Cooke, received the cup and the 4,000 given by the Clermont Club. Claude Beer, United States world backgammon champion, was the only unbeaten player.

title: German Power Unit And Oil Company Set Merger Terms
description: ESSEN, West Germany, Oct. 28 (Reuters)The West German Government's plan to create a giant new national oil and energy concern took shape today with the announcement of terms of a merger between the big power combine, Veba, A.G., and the oil company, Gelsenberg, A.G.

title: HARRY WOLSKY
description: Harry Wolsky, founder and president of the corporation of his name, stair builders in Springfield Gardens, Queens, died yesterday in North Shore Hospital, Manhasset, L.I. He was 75 years old and lived in Laurelton, Queens.

title: Giant Defense Has Scoring Key
description: As Roy Hilton rumbled toward the Dallas goal after recovering a fumble last Sunday at Yale Bowl, a wall of blueshined bodyguards formed on each side of him.

title: 2 SOLDIERS MED BY ULSTER BOMB
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Oct. 28Two British soldiers were killed and 31 persons injured by a bomb that exploded in a parked truck near an army camp at Ballykinler, 20 miles south of here.

title: KeyCountry Action
description: The chief danger of a turn from stagflation to world depression lies in the temptation for the oilconsuming countries to try to export their collective $60 to $80billion in oilpayments deficits to each other. Adoption of import curbs, export subsidies, currency devaluation or domestic deflation by an oil  importing country to balance its trade is possible but it could only lead to retaliatory trade restrictions and a shrinking volume of world business.

title: Aged Find Brand New World in New Home
description: Anna Langwell and Bertha Bailyn could not see each other very well, but the trip was a long and a strange one, so they kept saying each other's names so that one would always know the other was nearby.

title: Hanoi Group Leaves China
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Oct. 28 (Agence France  Presse) Deputy Premier Le Thanh Nghi and his delegation left Peking today to return to Hanoi after signing an economic and military aid agreement with China, the North Vietnamese news agency reported.

title: Kopechne Speculation Irks Kennedy
description: BOSTON, Oct. 28 (AP)Senator Edward M. Kennedy says that one of the worst results of the Chappaquiddick incident has been ugly speculation about conduct between him and Mary Jo Kopechne.

title: Poll Finds Added Worry On Crime and Its Control
description: A widespread feeling that crime has become worse in. the state and that the state admin istration has not acquitted itself well on lawandorder Matters is indicated by a survey of voter attitudes commissioned by The New York Times.

title: Meredith Protests Vote Rule
description: JACKSON, Miss., Oct. 28 (AP)  A threejudge Federal court heard charges today that Mississippi gave a new interpretation to its election laws to deny James H. Meredith, the civil rights figure, a place on its Nov. 5 ballot. Mr. Meredith, who first sought the Fourth District Congressional post as a Democratic candidate and withdrew to run as an independent, charged that the State Election Commission and the Mississippi Supreme Court had broken new legal ground in refusing to let him run as an independent.

title: AIDE TO BEAME WINS VOTEVIOLATION CASE
description: Sidney Baumgartner, a suspended assistant to Mayor Beame, was cleared yesterday in State Supreme Court, Queens, of charges of election law violation.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Arab heads of state including Jordan's King Hussein have unanimously issued declaration calling for the creation of an independent Palestinian state and recognizing the Palestine Liberation Organization as the sole legitimate representative of the Palestine people. The decision was a victory for Yasir Arafat, the Palestinian leader. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: Egypt Says Soviet Will Take Big Role In Aiding Economy
description: CAIRO, Oct. 28 (AP)The Soviet Union, Egypt's major military and economic backer until a year ago, has agreed to resume a leading role in the Egyptian economy, Planning Minister Ismail Sabry Abdullah said today.

title: Packaging Voters for Candidates, TVStyle
description: The pictureon the television screen shows Senator Abraham A. Ribicoff, the Connecticut Democrat, with his wife behind a shopping cart in, a supermarket aisle. A slow succession of still photographs focuses the viewer's attention on 30 seconds of studiorecorded words:

title: Dolphin in the Swim at Northport
description: NORTHPORT, L.I., Oct. 28 a dolphin was sighted in the harbor here at 9 A.M. today, and by late this afternoon, grownups and children on Main Street and nearly everywhere else in this small village on Long Island's North Shore were asking, How is he?

title: Advertising
description: HOT SPRINGS, Va., Oct. 28 On the surface at least, the 65th annual meeting of the Association of National Advertisers that started here today is no different than others held in recent years except that the weather is great.

title: A TRENTON MAN, 69, KILLED BY ROBBERS
description: TRENTON, N.J., Oct. 28(UPI)  A 69yearold retired kitchen worker was beaten to death today by robbers in his apartment and his bedridden wife was critically injured the police said.

title: Slaying Conviction Upheld
description: JACKSON, Miss., Oct. 28 (UPI)The Mississippi Supreme Court refused today to overturn the murder conviction of a member of the Republic of New Africa, a black nationalist group, in the 1971 slaying of a Jackson police officer. Thomas Edward Norman, also known as Hekima Ana, and 10 other blacks were arrested on various state and Federal charges after a gun battle in 1971 with law enforcement officers. He and two other members of the group were convicted of murder and sentenced to life imprisonment.

title: LAYOFFS BY G.M. SPUR JOB SEARCH
description: WHITE PLAINS, Oct. 28Westchester County government and labor leaders moved today to find jobs for the 2,000 automobile workers in North Tarrytown who will be unemployed after Nov. 11.

title: Mobutu Gives Garden Party
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, Oct. 28 On a garden path, 10 yards from where four leopards paced their cage, Zaire President Mobutu Sese Seko met for small talk this morning with George Foreman and Muhammad All on the eve of their world heavyweight championship fig is tomorrow night.

title: U.S. Ending Food for Peace Despite Rising Hunger Abroad
description: When World War II ended, Washington embarked on an unusual and farreaching program to feed millions of hungry people overseas, most of whom paid little or nothing for the basic foodstuffs they received.

title: State Issues: Approach Differson Help for Poor
description: New York's next Governor will face demands that easily approximate $100  million a year or more in new state and local costs for the 10 per cent of the people who are poorand at the same time Federal action to slash welfare reimbursement by Millions of dollarn.On other social problems, he must cope with increasing furore over the release into coinmunities of thousands of patients from state mental hospitalsamid charges of madequate aftercare and conflict over how such care should be provided.Bernard. M. Shiffman, executive vice president of the Community Council of Greater Now York, says socialwork leaders have been urging increased state supplements to help aged, blind and disabled poor on Supplemental Security Income rolls to cope with inflation.

title: Notes on People Rev. Billy James Hargis Is Ailing
description: The Rev. Billy James Hargis, the evangelist who has devoted himself since 1948 to his antiCommunist Christian Crusade, is giving up most of his work because of failing health. Mr. Hargis said in Tulsa, Okla., that he would have to resign as presidfmt of Tulsa Christian College, which he founded five years ago, and as minister of the Church of the Christian Crusade.

title: Fourth Suspect Charged
description: DELAND, Fla., Oct. 28 (AP) The police arrested a fourth man today in the kidnapping and slaying of a De Land disk jockey, and said the arrest wrapped up their investigation. Willie James Gillyard was charged with kidnapping and taken into custody in the murder of Fred West, 21 years old.

title: Beame Signs PayRise Bill For the Board of Education
description: Mayor Beanie yesterday signed into law a bill raising by $15 a day the $100 per diem pay of members of the Board of Education and the maximum compensation to $29,000 a year. This was the first salary increase for Board of Education members in five years.

title: ELTON P. HALL
description: TRAVERSE CITY, Mich., Oct. 28 (AP)Elton P. Hall, publisher of the Traverse City RecordEagle and a vice president of Ottaway Newspapers, Inc., died today, apparently of a heart attack. He was 61 years old.

title: Brezlinev Rules Out West Berlin Shift
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 28Leonid I. Brezhnev the Soviet leader, today warned Chancellor Helmut Schmidt of West Germany against seeking a more favorable interpretation of the 1971 fourpower agreement on West Berlin and demanded instead its strict observance.

title: Business Briefs
description: A new rule to make it easier for stockbrokers to deal in gold and silver was proposed yesterday by the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Brezhnev Rules Out West Berlin Shift
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 28Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet leader, today warned Chancellor Helmut Schmidt of West Germany against seeking a more favorable interpretation of the 1971 fourpower agreement on West Berlin and demanded instead its strict observance.

title: PAKISTAN URGING ATOMFREE ZONE
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 28Pakistan asked today that the General Assembly declare South Asia a zone free of nuclear weapons and invite the countries in that region to meet promptly and agree on arrangements for putting the declaration into effect.

title: POLICE BEDEVILED BY BOMB THREATS
description: A wave of telephoned bomb threats, attributed by the police to cranks inspired by Saturday's bombings in Manhattan, bedeviled precinct policemen and members of the bomb section and emergency service section yesterday. A terrorist group identifying its members as Puerto Rican nationalists said it had set off the bombs.

title: Buffalo Jobless Rate Below 7% Is Projected
description: Buffalo's unemployment rate is likely to fall below 7 per cent this month, a drop from the 9.4 per cent level of July, according to State Labor. Department estimates.

title: Following Reynolds, Lorillard Is Raising Price of Cigarettes
description: The Loews Corporation said yesterday that over the weekend its Lorillard division sent notice to its customers that it would raise the list price of all its domestic taxpaid cigarette brands by 70 cents a thousand, effective next Monday. Lorillard's brands include Kent, Old Gold, Newport and True. This action followed a move by R. J. Reynolds Industries, Inc., late last Friday when it announced plans for raising wholesale prices by 10 cents a carton, effective yesterday.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page It.

title: ARCHERS RAISE FOOD FOR HUNGRY
description: JERSEY CITY, Oct. 28About 150 people, including Mayor Paul T. Jordan, trudged through the streets of this city today in a march against hunger, and raised more than $4,000 to provide food for elderly residents and for supplemental feeding programs for lowincome pregnant women and infants.

title: German Oil Merger
description: West Germany announced yesterday terms of a mergcr between Veba, A. G., the big power combine, and Gelsenberg, A.G., an oil cothpany as part of the Government's plan to create a giant new national oil and energy concern, Details on Page. 53.

title: Bomb Blasts Car Of British Official In Midlands City
description: LONDON, Oct. 28  The wife and son of a British Government minister were badly shaken by a bomb that exploded tonight in a car outside their home in Birmingham, 110 miles northwest of here.

title: Alarmlnstaller Held In Theft of $25,000 Ring
description: An employe of a protection company was charged yesterday with stealing a diamond ring ;valued at $25,000 after installing a burglaralarm system in a Woodmere, L.I. home.

title: Louis Saillant Is Dead at 73; Headed W.F.T.U. for 24 Years
description: PARIS, Oct. 28Louis Saillant, for 24 years head of the Communistrun World Federation of Trade Unions, died here today in a hospital of a heart attack. He was 73 years old.

title: Missing Girl found Dead
description: SUMMIT PARK, Utah, Oct. 28  A police chief's daughter who had been missing more than a week was found dead by deer hunters yesterday, shot and strangled. An autopsy to day established her identity as Melissa Smith, 17 years old, daughter of Chief Louis Smith of Midvale Utah.

title: 2 ROBBERS SLAY A PIZZA WORKER
description: A 31yearold counterman at a pizzaandfriedchicken stand in the Bronx was shot to death yesterday afternoon by two young robbers he thought were joking when they demanded money, the police said.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: The Theater Development Furnd has named Mrs. Anna Crouse as acting executive director during the absence of Hugh Southern, who recently was appointed acting program director of the New York State Council on the Arts.

title: Heritage Dancers Bring Folklore to L.I.
description: There is a healthy fresh glow to the dances and dancers of Agnes de Mlle's Heritage Dance Theater. This may not necessarily be to everyone's taste. Too apple pie, a member of the audience was overheard to remark when the young company appeared in Great Neck, L. I., Sunday night under the auspices of the North Shore Community Arts Center.

title: Music: Bolet's Wizardry
description: Jorge Bolet's standing among connoisseurs of pianism is so exalted these days that his recitals take on the air of lecturedemonstrations by a renowned surgeon. One almost expects to see people pull out clip boards and take notes.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: BOWERY BONANZA The Off Off Broadway season is off to a gallop, judging by three early entries. In addition to the Corner Loft's trio of short works by Michael Shurtleff and the WPA Theater's smashing revival of Craig's Wife there is a grand package by the Jean Cocteau Repertory.

title: Policeman IF acing Departmental Trial On Graffiti Charge
description: A 28yearold police officer goes on departmental trial today charged with defacing the lavatory walls of a Brooklyn police station where he was said to have been caught pen in hand by detectives stakedout round the clock by the precinct commander.

title: RABBI JECHIEL CHARLOP
description: Rabbi Jechiel M. Charlop, spiritual director of the Bronx Jewish Center for 46 years until it closed in 1971, died yesterday at his home, 190 East 206th Street, the Bronx. His age was 73.

title: SCHOOLS PICKETED IN LONG BRANCH
description: LONG BRANCH, Oct. 28More than 250 angry parents picketed the Board of Education headquarters here this afternoon demanding that the city's 10 public schools be closed. until a strike of teachers, secre. taries and custodians was settled.

title: HUNT TELLS COURT HE HID FULL TRUTH
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28E. Howard Hunt Jr., one of the seven men who were allegedly paid off to keep silent about the Watergate breakin, testified today that he had continued to withhold the entire truth until his appearance in court this morning.

title: DEVELOPING NATIONS INCREASE EXPORTS
description: GENEVA Oct. 28 (Reuters)  Developing countries increased their exports to apparently unprecedented levels last year, but it is questionable whether they can maintain such progress in the face of world economic difficulties, a major international trade organization said today.

title: For ForwardLooking Kindergartners, Career Education
description: Career education is creeping into the nursery schools and kindergartens, somewhere between show and tell and juice and cookies.

title: Wife of Dominick Aide Backs Senator's Rival
description: The wife of the campaign chairman of Senator Peter H. Dominick, Republican of Colorado, announced Sunday that she had formed a group of 20 Republicans to back Gary Hart, the Senator's opponent on Nov. 5.

title: F.D.U. 41 Soccer Victor
description: TEANECK, N. J., Oct. 28 Ruben Molinares, a sophomore forward, scored two goals today to lead undefeated Fairleigh Dickinson University to a 41 soccer victory over Rutgers.

title: Governor and Policemen Attend Rites for Trooper
description: PHOENIX, N. Y., Oct. 28 (AP)  Governor Wilson and hundreds of police officers from throughout New York and several surrounding states led mourners today at a funeral service for a state trooper who was killed in the line of duty last week.

title: The People's Libraries
description: Even in the light of extreme budgetary stringency, the threatened closing of three major neighborhood branch libraries raises serious questions concerning the city's approach to fiscal planning and public service policy. At a time when the improvement of urban education is a matter of the highest priority, the curtailment of library services would be a calamity.

title: A Sleepy Town in Mexico, the Center of the Oil Boom, Is Content to Leave the Gushing to the Oil Wells
description: VILLAHERMOSA, Mexico, Oct. 25Gas flares light up the evening sky around Villa hermosa like the camp fires of a besieging army.

title: U.S. Rider Scores in Jumpoff
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 (AP) Rodney Jenkins arid Number One Spy got the United States off to a fast start in the international open jumper class at the Washington International horse show today.

title: JAMES CULLEN, 62, LEO KING SULLEN
description: James A. Cullen, chairman of the King Kullen Grocery Co., Inc., and son of its founder who originated the supermarket style of grocery store, died yesterday at his home, 40 Thomhedge Road, Heliport, L. I. He was 62 years old.

title: HUNT TELLS COURT HE HID FULL TRUTH
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28E. Howard Hunt Jr., one of the seven men who were allegedly paid off to keep silent about the Watergate breakin, testified today that he had continued to withhold the entire truth until his appearance in court this morning.

title: ARAB LEADERS ISSUE CALL FOR A PALESTINIANS TATE; ARAFAT GIVEN MAIN ROLE
description: RABAT, Morocco, Oct. 28Arab heads of state, including King Hussein of Jordan, called unanimously today for the creation of an independent Palestinian state on any Palestinian land that is liberated from Israeli occupation.

title: L. I. Druggist Says Police Raided His Home Illegally
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Oct. 28A Roosevelt pharmacist asked the Nassau County Board of Supervisors today to investigate the search of his home by 11 county policemen last Friday without a warrant.

title: Winstons From Spain
description: Winston will become the first American cigarette to be manufactured in Spain, under a licensing agreement signed by the R. J. Reynolds Tobacco Company and Spain's Tabacalera, S.A.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: 2 NEW U.S. RULES COULD FORCE CUT IN GASOLINE PRICE
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28The Federal Energy Administration published today two regulations that could force some international oil companies to reduce gasoline and oil prices temporarily by a penny or two gallon.

title: U.S. Ending Food for Peace Despite Rising Hunger Abroad
description: When World War II ended, Washington embarked on an unusual and farreaching program to feed millions of hungry people overseas, most of whom paid little or nothing for the basic foodstuffs they received.

title: Hunger in U.S. a Problem of Want Amid Plenty
description: SWEET HOME, Ark.The house was a faded gray, squatting in the dust beside a crumbling macadam street.

title: A New Geopolitics
description: Not, everything happening these days is bad. Into the arcane science of geopolitics is creeping a longterm trend that could even be considered benign, a change in the list of factors that add up to national power.

title: Nixon Off Social List, Rockefeller Is Added
description: WASHINGTON, Oct, 28 (AP)Richard M. Nixon is not only out of the White House; he is out of the green book:

title: Energy And Transit
description: One year after last winter's gasoline shortages began to be felt across most of America, the unthinkable has happened, Many of those who had to desert their automobiles and turn to mass transit hay remained as transit riders, even though gasoline is plentiful again (probably not for long).

title: Man Who Patin Alarm Held in Theft of Ring
description: An employe of a protection company was charged yesterday with stealing a diamond ring valued at $25,000 after installing a burglaralarm system in a Woodmere, L.I. home.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Arab heads of state including Jordan's King Hussein have unanimously issued a declaration calling for the creation of an independent Palestinian state and recognizing the Palestine Liberation Organization as the sole legitimate representative of the Palestine people. The decision was a victory for Yasir Arafat, the Palestinian leader. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: Head of Puerto Rican Studies Approved at Brooklyn College
description: The Board of Higher Education last night approved, by a vote of 6 to 3, the appointment of Dr. Elba Lugo de LuisDeza as head of the department of Puerto Rican studies at Brooklyn College. Three members abstained.

title: $800.Million Saudi Bid For Aramco Is Reported
description: The Saudi Arabian Government has offered $800million to complete a takeover of the Arabian American Oil Company, according to a Beirut newspaper, Al Anwar.

title: Music: Piano Literature
description: Paul Jacobs has long been respected as one of the leading newmusic pianists in town. Last season he added some indefinable combination of fable and notoriety to his reputation by selflessly informing the world, publicly and persistently, of the inadequacies of one MarieFrancoise Bucquet, a French specialist in contemporary piano literature, who had four lavishly publicized Tully Hall recitals.

title: DEBATE ON CYPRUS IS OPENED BY U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 28The General Assembly opened a debate on the Cyprus issue today, and the Cypriote delegate urged the assembly to demand the immediate withdrawal of all foreign armed forces from the island.

title: Union Oil's Profit Up 57% in Quarter
Theater: Arthur Miller's All My Sons
description: A new theater is a cause for joy, and when that theater is a transformed cinema, the joy, at least for theaterlovers, is tinged with a certain sense of irony. So many theaters across the city have been cannibalized into einemas, it, is interesting to be reminded that such transmogrifications can be a twoway traffic.

title: Ford Signs Proclamations
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 (AP) President Ford signed today proclamations designating Oct. 27 to Nov. 2 as American Education Week and National Parkinson Week.

title: $8Million in Bogus $100 Bills Seized
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 28 (AP) Secret Service agents have confiscated more than $8million worth of bogus $100 bills in what they called the largest seizure of counterfeit money in American history.

title: Islanders Turn Back Seals, 101
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Oct. 28  The California Golden Seals, who fought the Philadelphia Flyers for a 41 victory last Friday night, amassing a record  breaking 232 minutes of combined penalties, lay dead for the New York Islanders tonight with hardly a punch. The Islanders beat them, 101.

title: Army Plan to Freeze Birds Assailed
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 (UPI) Environmentalists have opened a fight with the Army over a plan to kill 14 million blackbirds this winter by spraying them with a chemical that will cause them to freeze to death.

title: Tornado in Beaumont, Tex.
description: BEAUMONT, Tex., Oct. 28 (UPI)A Tornado struck two blocks in northern Beaumont today, heavily damaging a service station, several businesses and homes. The twister dropped from a thunderstorm at 1:50 P.M. and struck the service station and other businesses. It then moved into an adjoining residential block where it damaged several homes and toppled many trees, blocking one street.

title: American Olympians
description: It was frontpage news the other day when Henry Kissinger arrived in Moscow, although at the time he had not done anything but, arrive, which lot of other people do every day without getting a line in the papers.

title: Clark and Davits Trade Campaign Insults Again
description: Jacob K. Javits accused Ramsey Clark yesterday of being incompetent in foreign affairs. Mr. Clark accused Senator Javits of being too close to big business and the military establishment.

title: Hawk Rookie Is Turning Heads on N.B.A. Circuit
description: Before the National Basketball Association season began this year, Bill Walton had been conceded rookieoftheyear honors. The big redhaired Portland Trail Blazer was a household word in college basketball last season when John Edward Drew was a sophomore tucked away at. Gardner Webb, a college in the hill country of North Carolina with a male student population of 983. Drew, a hardship case, signed with, the Atlanta Hawks, got a license to shoot from Coach Cotton Fitzsimmons, and now Walton has some unexpected competition.

title: Referendum Sought On Salary Increase For Newark Aides
description: NEWARK, Oct. 28A Newark urologist has obtained 8,300 registered voters' signatures on petitions calling for a referendum on raises recently voted the Mayor and the ninemember City Council.

title: GRAND JURY CHARGES TWO NAMED IN THEFT
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 28 (UPI)Two suspects in the theft of $4.3million from a vault here were indicted today by a Cook County grind jury on charges of having participated in a multi  million  dollar stolen goods ring.

title: CRIME FIGURE GETS TERM FOR CONTEMPT
description: James Napoli, reputed to be one of the five leading Mafia chieftains in the Metropolitan area, was sentenced to six months in prison and a $1,000 fine for criminal contempt before a Manhattan grand jury that five years ago was investigating the fixing of fights at Madison Square Garden.

title: QE2 Hits Cherbourg Pier; Rip in Hull Delays Voyage
description: CHERBOURG, France, Oct. 28 (AP)The liner Queen Elizabeth 2 was driven against a pier while trying to sail from Cherbourg in a high wind last night, tearing her hull open and delayng the departure for New York for at least 48 hours, company officials said today.

title: SEATBELT LINKAGE NOT REQUIRED NOW
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 (AP) President ford signed a motor vehicle and school bus safety bill today that does away with the mandatory seatbelt interlock system, which has been a source of controversy.

title: SUGAR FUTURES CONTINUE SURGE
description: Amid growing doubts about how much further the rise could go, there was another upsurge in world sugar prices yesterday. The London sugar market again set the pace as a British sugar trade house estimated a deficit in sugar supplies for the coming year.

title: Black Muslims Are Urging a Combining of Economic Resources
description: ATLANTA  The nation's largest black enterprise, the Nation of Islam, is advocating the pooling of resources within the black economic community, regardless of religious viewpoints, as an alternative to possible closing of black businesses at a time of general economic problems.

title: Wood, Field & Stream
description: MONTAUK, L. I.Red as fire, the sun was slipping behind a low, narrow band of dark clouds in the west when Al Ristori and I pounded out of the Montauk Basin in his 22foot Mako and headed for Shagwong Reef.

title: A.M.A. UNIT VOTES ADVERTISING HALT
description: The board of trustees of the American Medical Association has voted to recommend to the A.M.A. House of Delegates that all advertising be discontinued in the association's 14 journals, magazines and newsletters.

title: Orr, Esposito Get Hot So Bruins Start Moving
description: Suddenly, there's Orr! And Esposito! Last week, when National Hockey League fans looked at the scoring leaders, the familiar names of Bobby Orr and Phil Esposito were hardly to be found. But then the Boston Bruin stars went on a rampage, Orr getting three goals in one game and 10 points while Esposito tallied 6 points.

title: Contract Awards
description: The International Harvester Company has sold 2,000 truck tractors to the Ministry of Roads of Iran for more than $50million.

title: U.S. Experts Said to Fear Fuel Crisis in Coal Strike
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 (UPI) Government energy experts believe that a strike by coal miners this winter would lead to a worse fuel crisis than the one caused by last year's oil embargo, according to a memorandum made public today by a public interest group.

title: Holiday is Observed and Unobserved
description: The sunny skies and warm temperatures made it a glorious day for a parade yesterday, but there were no marching bands, streaming flags or cheering crowds along Fifth Avenue in New York City to celebrate Veteran's Day.

title: Photocopying Splits Publishers Libraries
description: Authors and publishers are locked in a battle with the country's libraries over the photocopying of copyrighted materials, and both sides agre that the outcome will be felt for years to come.One case is about to be argued before the United States Supreme Court; Congress is trying to write new legislation; a national commission may be created to find a solution, and the publishers and the libraries are to meet in Washington Nov. 19 for the third time in three years in an effort to reach compromise.

title: Wichita Broadcaster Starts a Weekly Newspaper
description: In the face of newsprint shortages, rising production costs and the concern of the Justice Department about the concentration of newspaper and broadcast ownership in many cities, a broadcaster in Wichita, Kan., has founded a weekly newspaper specializing in the coverage of local issues and events.

title: FIRST PHOTO TAKEN BY NEW TELESCOPE
description: The largest telescopic eye ever opened on the southern heavens has produced its first photograph as a prelude to observations that are expected to broaden understanding of the universe.

title: RADIO SHOW LINKS NEW YORK, LORD
description: An international, live radio callin show, termed the first of its kind, in which listeners in New York and London will be able to participate, will have its premiere tomorrow night on WMCA here and on the British/ Broadcasting Corporation in London.

title: Big Board Seat Sold
description: The New York Stock Exchange reported yesterday that a leading nonmember firmKeefe, Bruyette & Woods, Inc, had joined the Big Board. A seat on the exchange, recently sold at $100,000, went to the new firm, trade sources said.

title: CHANGES SOUGHT IN U.S. FARM POLICY
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28A broad revision of United States agricultural policy, including provisions for Governmentcontrolled stockpiles of key foodstuffs, was proposed today by a national orgabuzation of highlevel business and university executives.

title: Muskie Urges Food Bank
description: PORTLAND, Me., Oct. 28 (AP)  Senator Edmund S. Muskie, Democrat of Maine, said today that an international fond bank should be established to deal with the emerging world food crisis. We simply cannot expect to live in peace and comfort in a world which is exploding because of hunger and starvation, he told students at Portland High School.

title: Tanaka Begins 12Day Pacific Tour Amid Rumors That He May Leave Office
description: TOKYO, Oct. 28Premier Kakuei Tanaka departed today en a 12day journey to New Zealand, Australia, and Burma  leaving behind growing doubts that he will survive in office much longer.

title: Islanders Turn Back Seals, 101
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Oct. 28  The California Golden Seals, who fought the Philadelphia Flyers for a 41 victory last Friday night, amassing a record breaking 232 minutes of combined penalties, lay dead for the New York Islanders tonight with hardly a punch. The Islanders beat them, 101.

title: FORD IS CHALLENGED ON SPENDING RECORD
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 (AP) When President Ford was House minority leader, he supported 86 per cent of the measures that increased spending above the amounts sought by the Republican Administration, the Democratic Study Group staff said today.

title: Watergate and Nixon Fill Wilson's New Spots for TV
description: In a reversal of strategy, governor Wilson yesterday taped a new spot television commercial telling the voters that he had no responsibility for Watergate, the Nixon pardon or the Rockefeller gifts.

title: Postcards of Belfast. Strife Are BestSellers There
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland The people of Belfast are buying picture postcards of their city's torment by the hundreds.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Article 2  No Title
ANOTHER HOSTAGEFREE IN DUTCH JAIL
description: THE HAGUE, Oct. 28Four convicts holding hostages in the chapel of Scheveningen Prison tonight released another of their prisoners and appeared to be under increasing pressure to give up their escape attempt.

title: People and Business
description: John W. Hanifin, 53, who has been president of the Chessie Sytem, Inc., for the last year, as well as president of the company's major holding, the Chesapeake & Ohio Railway, has been named chief executive officer of the C. & O. When directors of the Baltimore & Ohio Railroad, a C. & O. subsidiary, meet next month, it is expected that they will name Mr. Hanifin chief executive officer of the B. & O. as well.

title: Friends of Anne Sexton To Pay Tribute in Poetry
description: Friends and admirers of Anne Sexton, the poet who committed suicide at her home in Weston, Mass., on Oct. 4, will give readings from her works and recollections in a program entitled A Tribute to Anne Sexton at Town Hall, 123 West 43d Street, tomorrow at 5:45 P.M.

title: Foreman 31 Over Ali in Zaire Tonight
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, Oct. 28 In the darkness before dawn, when ordinarily only the textile factory workers are laboring here, George Foreman will defend his world heavyweight championship against Muhammad Ali at 4 o'clock Wednesday morning. Each gladiator has been assured $5million to alter his sleeping habits.

title: Congress: New York City
description: The Times begins today its electionyear endorsements of Congressional candidates in the tristate metropolitan area. Today's listing is for the five boroughs of New York City; tomorrow's will cover Suffolk, Nassau, Westchester and other nearby counties and neighboring districts in Connecticut and New Jersey. Districts are omitted where there is no contest or where no candidate is endorsed.

title: 4% Growth Is Forecast BY Europe Community
description: BRUSSELS, Oct. 28 (AP)A European Community report predicted today, the economic growth of the nine member countries could be somewhere between 4 per cent and 4.5 per cent for, the period from 1973 to 1978.

title: The Bright Side of Smog
description: CHICAGO (UPI)  Dr. Albert M. Potts of the University of Chicago says eyeirritatine photochemical smog is a blessing in disguise. It is probably the single most important factor in directing attention to the air pollution problem, the eye specialist said.

title: Rockefeller Lists More Loans Totaling $507,656 in 17 Years
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28Vice President designate Nelson A. Rockefeller disclosed today that he made $507,656 in loans during the last 17 years to friends, associates and family membersincluding his wife of which $147,733 has not yet been repaid.

title: Joseph Durso Another Diplomatic Success
description: SAPPORO, Japan, Oct. 28The New York Mets pushed their goodwill tour of the Orient to the far North of Japan tonight after another diplomatic success in Tokyo earlier in the day. They lost a tworun lead in the last half of the ninth inning to the Yomiuri Giants, settled for a 44 tie in the 10th and left town with no victories in their first two appearances in Japan.

title: Israel Jails 2 Dutch Women Who Carried Arab Message
description: RAMALLAH, Isralioccupied Jordan, Oct. 28 (AP)  An Israeli military court today sentenced two Dutch women to prison for three and a half months for having smuggled a letter written in invisible ink to Arab guerrillas.

title: Kissinger Bids India Join In Curbing Atomic Arms
description: NEW DELHI, Oct. 28Secretary of State Kissinger tonight called on India, as the newest nuclear power, to join the United States and other nations in an effort to preventthe spread of nuclear technology that could be used to clelielop weapons.

title: Energy, Pride and Grit Sustain a Woman at 89
description: Florence Colebrook Powers is 89 years old, and her two tiny rooms in a residence hotel here are cluttered with mementos.

title: Proxmire Denounces Bin Allowing Interest Deduction
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 (UPI) Senator William Proxmire, Democrat of Wisconsin has denounced the bill recently approved by the House Ways and Means Committee that would permit taxpayers to deduct up to $1,000 of interest earned on savings accounts. He called it another new tax loophole.

title: Kissinger Bids India Join In Curbing Atomic Arms
description: NEW DELHI, Oct. 28Secretary of State Kissinger tonight called on India, as the newest nuclear power, to join the United States and other nations in an effort to prevent the spread of nuclear technology that could be used to develop weapons.

title: The Heat's Gone Out of 2 Issues in Governor Race
description: Like the leaves on the trees, two issues that were heatedly debated at the height of the summer gubernatorial primary have dropped away in the fall campaign. The issues  Governor Wilson's law practice while he w a s Lieutenant Governor and Representative Hugh L. Carey's ties to the oil industry had been repeatedly raised by Howard J. Samuels during his unsuccessful bid for the Democratic nomination for Governor.

title: Cunard Says China Agrees On a Cruise Visit to Canton
description: LONDON, Oct. 28 (Reuters) An agreement has been reached with the Chinese Government to allow a party of about 500 Western tourists to visit the Canton area next spring, the Cunard Line announced tonight.

title: Pro Transactions BASKETBALL
description: ST. LOUIS (ABA)Placed walvers M?? Williams/ guard.

title: U. S. TO AUCTION ADDITIONAL BILLS
description: The Treasury, preparing for its quarterly refunding cycle, disclosed yesterday that it would raise an extra $200mi1lion in cash at its next bill auction, the date of which has been changed to Friday, instead of next Monday. This announcement, which came as something of a surprise to the dealer community, said that the Treasury would auction $2.7billion of 91day bills and $2.1billion of 180day bills. This amounts to $4.8billion, compared with $4.6billion maturing in bills next week.

title: CNA BOARD BACKS LOEWS CORP. BID
